loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia F. is from the village of Tucal, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Delia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for breeding. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $82 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Delia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 16,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock. 

Delia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be her 10th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna D. is from Calabayan in Ozamiz City. She is 45 years old.  Edna is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation service. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Edna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair vehicle for transport business

loans.name: Kuy

texts.en: Kuy O., 37, is married and lives with her husband and five children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. O. sells vegetables, earning an income of about US $2 per day. Her husband is a recycler, earning an income of about US $2 per day. O. has to spend US $66 on food, US $2 on electricity and water supplies, and US $10 on other necessary expenses every month. O. is requesting a loan of US $400 to purchase a new motorbike for the family's use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. O. appears in the photograph with her family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Alfarero Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfarero lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Irene T. de 39 Años quien se dedica a la venta de prendas, perfumes y cosméticos Avon además de realizar bisutería desde hace cinco años.  Ella con el crédito compra los encargos que tiene para diciembre los cuales son muchos.
Las otras integrantes son Fabiola B. quien vende esquimo y cerveza desde hace 5 años y Heydi R. comercializa ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
The Alfarero group is made up of three hardworking women. One of them is 39-year old Irene T. who sells underwear, perfume, and Avon cosmetics. For the past five years she has also made costume jewelry. Irene plans to use the loan to buy the items she needs to fill her December orders, of which there are many.

The other members of the group are Fabiola B. who has been selling Eskimo milk products and beer for five years, and Heydi R. who sells clothing and footwear.

loans.use: to buy underwear, perfume, cosmetics

loans.name: Gladis Araceli

texts.es:
la señora Gladis Aracei E. E. tiene 34 años de edad, vive en el municipio de Liure, Gladis se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, Gadis es una mujer emprendedora, su negocio esta en un lugar de facil acceso, se levanta todos los dias a las 5 de la mañana para atender a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio, desea tener surtida su pulperia para la navidad.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar y de su familia.
texts.en:
34-year old Señora Gladis Aracei E. Espina lives in the municipality of Liure. She earns her living running a small general store located in her house selling basic supplies. She is an entrepreneurial woman. Her store is located in an easily accessible location. Every day she gets up at 5am to serve her customers.

Gladis plans to use the loan to buy stock for the store in preparation for Christmas. She needs the money she earns for household expenses and for her family.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store such as rice, beans, bread, cookies etc.

loans.name: Elsa Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Elsa, tiene 41 años de edad, reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, posee un comedor y vive con una de sus hijas de 14 años de edad, es madre soltera, su comedor lo inicio con poco material y atendiéndolo sola, pero hoy día tiene dos empleadas, lleva ya 7 años de administrarlo con un horario de 7:00am a 5:00pm, ha ganado mucha clientela.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para preparar los alimentos, ya que en ocasiones no logra salir con la demanda por lo que quiere aumentar su inventario comprando bebidas, arroz, pastas, condimentos, verduras y carnes, con esta compra espera tener en mejores condiciones el comedor y poder salir con todos los pedidos.
Doña Elsa, sueña con un comedor más amplio, casa propia y ayudar a su hija en los estudios.
texts.en:
Elsa is 41 years old.  She lives in San Miguel, in San Miguel department.  She is a single mother and lives with one of her daughters who is 14 years old.  She owns an eatery which she set up with just a little bit of material and, in the beginning, she worked there on her own.  However, she now has two employees and has been running her business for 7 years.  She works from 7.00am to 5.00pm and has attracted a lot of customers.

Elsa is requesting this loan to buy supplies for making her meals since she sometimes cannot meet demand.  She would like to increase her inventory, purchasing drinks, rice, pasta, condiments, vegetables and meat.  She hopes that these purchases will improve her eatery and that she will be able to cover all the orders she receives.

Elsa dreams of having a larger eatery, her own home and she would like to help her daughter with her studies.

loans.use: To buy supplies for preparing her meals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay farmhands

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes L. is from the village of Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old and single and she has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates tricycle transport services. She has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately $50 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Agnes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. 

Agnes is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La Srita. Marisol, es enfermera de profesión, pero ella se ha especializado en enfermedades de personas con discapacidad, como embolias, parálisis  temporal entre otros , pero como ella da servicio a domicilio  porque la contratan por temporadas, a ella le hacen falta  varios aparatos que requiere para dar una terapia mas profesional a sus pacientes, y dice que al tener estos aparatos, siente que va a dar un mejor servicio, y la van a recomendar mas las personas que ya han estado trabajando con ella  y le han confiado el cuidado de sus seres queridos, por lo que ella se siente muy afortunada como enfermera de hacer este tipo de trabajos, es por eso que le pagan honorarios por el cuidado del paciente y a pesar de que ya a adquirido algunos aparatos ella quiere estar  siempre actualizada, ya que su profesión  la hace ser mas humana.
texts.en: Marisol is a nurse buy profession, but she has specialized in treating people with disabilities such as strokes and temporary paralysis, among others. She works from home, and also does seasonal contract work, and she does not have all the equipment that she needs to offer her patients the most professional therapy. She says that, if she had this equipment, she would be able to provide better service, and most of the people who have worked with her would recommend her to their loved ones. She feels very fortunate to work as a nurse, and this is why people pay for her work. Although she has already bought some equipment, she wants to always be updating. Her profession makes her feel more human.

loans.use: To buy physical therapy equipment

loans.name: San

texts.en:
Mrs. San K. and her husband, Mr. Phat Phoung, have been married since 1987.  They have five children – three sons and two daughters. They are living in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

San is a vegetable farmer. Her husband is a fisherman. She is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for farm

loans.name: Sem

texts.en: Sem L. S., 43, is a widow and the mother of two teenage children. One of her children is a worker in a construction shop, and the other is attending school. Sem L. S. has been in the business of farming for a long time. She lives in the province of Kompong Cham. She owns and operates a rice farm, from which she earns a daily income. Currently, her living conditions are not comfortable because her old ladder has been broken from so much use. She wants to buy a new ladder, but she doesn’t have enough money to do so. Sem L. S. is going to use her loan to buy a new ladder to replace the damaged one.

loans.use: To buy a new ladder

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 56 years old and married with two children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock.

Alicia has borrowed and paid back 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from photography.

Alicia aspires to repair her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock

loans.name: Youness

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single and lives with six family members. Three of the family members work.

In 2007, Youness opened an auto repair shop. He has five years experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a testing machine and a nozzle-cleaning machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a testing machine and a nozzle-cleaning machine.

loans.name: Yadira

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada Arroyo de pita la cual se caracteriza por ser la unica comunidad en varios kilometros  que cuanta con un bachillerato, en esta comunidad vive Yadira R. que tiene 22 años de edad, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casada con el señor Even Ezer con el cual tiene dos hijos.

ella nos platica que su esposo es panadero y tienen una panaderia en su comunidad, ella trabaja en la panaderia desde que se caso, tambien nos comenta que en tiempo de calor vende raspados de sabores en su casa.

ella nos platica que inician a trabajar desde el medio dia en la elaboracion del pan y por la tarde salen a venderlo en la comunidad, Yadira nos dice "cuando hay mas venta es en tiempo de frio porque bien que se le antoja a uno un cafesito con pan para quitar el fri y entrar en calorsito".

Ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de arinas, azucar y leña para la elaboracion del pan y invertira  poco en la compra de hielo y saborisantes para poner su venta de raspados.

ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere ya que desea darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y que en un futuro estudien una carrera.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca there is a community called "Arroyo de Pita", characterized for being the only community in the area that has a high-school, Yadira R. lives in this community, she is 22 years old, studied up to grade 9 and is married to Evan Ezer, with whom she has two children.  

Her husband is a bread maker and they have a bakery in the community where she was worked since they got married, she also tells us that during hot season she sells shaved ice of different flavors from her house.

They start working at noon making bread and in the afternoon they go out to sell it.  Yadira says that: "Sales are high when it's cold because they (customers) feel like having a coffee with a piece of bread to warm up".  

She needs this loan to invest it in buying flour, sugar and firewood to make bread and she will also invest a bit in buying ice and flavors to start selling shaved ice.  

She hopes that with this investment her business grows because she wishes to give her children a better quality of life and the opportunity to attend university.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for bread making and shaved ice making.

loans.name: Javier Armando

texts.es:
El Señor Javier S. de 26 años, esta en concubinato con la Sra. Ramona González de 23 años de edad, ellos tienen una hija. 
Don Javier se dedica a la venta de mercaderias en forma ambulante hace más de 3 años, aproximadamente desde el año 2008; comenzó con el capital que obtuvo ahorrando estando como empleado de una carpintería, empezó vendiendo ropas a la gente de su comunidad. Poco a poco fue creciendo su venta y en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela formada. 
Javier solicita este crédito para comprar más mercaderías (pantalones vaqueros, remeras, camisas, camperas,etc.) y seguir adelante con su trabajo para mantener a su concubina, su hija y de la misma manera satisfacer a sus fieles clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Javier Salvero, 26, lives unmarried with Ramona González.  They have a daughter.

Javier is a street vendor of general merchandise; he’s been in business for over three years since about 2008.  He started out with capital he’d saved while employed at a carpenter shop.  He started selling among people in his community and gradually his sales increased and now he has a well established clientele.

Javier is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise (jeans, t-shirts, shirts, jackets, etc.) to continue working to support his spouse and daughter as well as meeting the needs of his faithful customers.

loans.use: to buy jeans, t-shirts, shirts and jackets.

loans.name: Batool

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 54 years old, divorced and has one child who works. She lives with four family members.
Batool has worked as a tailor since 2000. She makes and repairs women's clothing. She has long experience in this field, a good reputation, and is well known in her area. She is requesting a loan of $1,800 to buy a sewing machine, generator and refrigerator. She is aiming to earn more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, generator and refrigerator.

loans.name: Luisa Jannet

texts.es: La señora Luisa  es una cliente nueva en la institución se dedica a la venta D. menudencias D. carne D. res en el mercado Rodríguez  tiene su puesto D. venta propio y en un lugar fijo tiene su casa en la zona D. pasankeri  vive con sus  dos hijos, actualmente atraviesa un momento difícil con su esposo con los tramites D. divorcio pero la señora continua trabajando y no se siente mal por dicho proceso mas al contrario le da fuerzas para luchar sola con sus dos hijos  crédito esta destinado a la inversión D. capital para su negocio Comprando Carne, esta gradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Luisa is a new client of Emprender. She sells beef offal at the Rodríguez Market where she has her own location and a vending stall. Luisa has a house in the District of Pasankeri, where she lives with her two children.

Luisa is currently going through a difficult time since she and her husband have filed divorce papers. However, she continues to work and does not regret her decision to move forward alone with her two children.

This loan will be invested as business capital for the purchase of meat. Luisa is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to purchase meat in bulk.

loans.name: Mahudjro 18 Group

texts.fr: MAHUDJRO 18 est un groupe de trois personnes dont les membres appartiennent au même groupe d’artisans. La représentante du groupe, Véronique (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est née le 25 Juin 1987 dans une ville du Bénin. Véronique est mariée à un marchand nommé Joseph. Le couple a deux enfants, dont un est à leur charge. Aucun enfant n'est scolarisé. Véronique a appris la couture et l'exerce depuis six ans. Cette activité lui génère des revenus l'aidant à subvenir à ses besoins et à participer aux charges familiales. Parallèlement, Véronique vend des bois de chauffage . Véronique a besoin d'équiper son atelier de couture par l'acquisition d'une nouvelle machine en vue de mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. C’est la deuxième fois que Véronique et les autres membres du groupe MAHUDJRO 18 sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
Mahudjro 18 is a group composed of three people who are members of the same trade association. The representative of the group, Véronique, who is raising her hand on the photo, was born in a city in Benin on June 25, 1987. Véronique is married to Joseph, a merchant. The spouses have two children, of whom one is supported by them. None of the children attends school.

Véronique learnt the dressmaking trade and has been in this business for six years. Her activity gives her enough income to provide for herself and contribute to household expenses. Next to her activity, she sells firewood. Véronique needs to equip her workshop with a new sewing machine in order to better meet the demand of her customers. It is the second time that Véronique and her fellow members of Mahudjro 18 Group applied for financial assistance from the microfinance institution Alidé to strengthen their working capital and boost their activity level and better meet the needs of their customers.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Nely Marleny

texts.en: Nely lives in the town of Danli in southern Honduras where she makes a living selling clothes. She has had this small business for the past five years and has a stall located in a central location. Nely is requesting a loan of Lps 15,000 to purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing to sell

loans.name: 59 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattL.. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thuy is 22 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Thuy is the group leader of the 59 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

This is Thuy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Thuy has been involved in this business for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her are illnesses.

In the future, Thuy hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to buy land of her own, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.en:
Shuhrat is an active and hard-working man. He is married and the father of one child. His wife is a housewife. Shuhrat has worked as a taxi driver for 10 years. He learnt this business from his father because his father worked as a taxi driver. 

Shuhrat tries and works hard in order to make a good profit for his family. Shuhrat would like to get a loan of 5000 TJS for purchasing spare parts for his car in order to give better service for his clients.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Zaillia

texts.en: Zaillia is 39 years old and married with five children. All of her children are in school. She has a business selling bread in Kator Branch in South Sudan. She earns additional income from her Dobbi (washing clothes). She took this loan from BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. The extra income from this loan she will use to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a married man with three children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house without electricity or running water and his greatest monthly expenses are food, school fees, and rent. For the past three years, he has operated a business selling charcoal from home to his neighbors and passersby. Bakari’s major business challenge is seasonality. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

Bakari is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. He dreams of becoming a leading supplier in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elias

texts.en: Elias is a 36-year-old Lebanese single man living with his father. He started working as a car mechanic at a very young age in order to support his father financially. And in 1996, this man opened his own car repair shop. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business by purchasing a scanner machine to be able to serve more customers in less time. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes to further expand his business and gain a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase a scanner machine

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia de 37 años es soltera con 2 hijas, la mayor que esta casada y tiene su propia familia y la menor estudiando la secundaria secundaria. Virginia trabaja como maestra multigrado desde hace 11 años en la zona rural de Acoyapa. Esta solicitando su 6to crédito con el objetivo de construir la cocina de su casa, la cual construyo gracias al apoyo del Proyecto San Sebastián y a los financiamientos que AFODENIC le ha dado, pues anteriormente vivia en casa de su mamá. Su mayor sueño es poder tener su vivienda con las mejores condiciones para su hija, pues es el patrimonio que ella le dejara.
texts.en:
Virginia, 37, is single and has two daughters, the older one married with her own family and the younger one in high school.  Virginia has been working as a multi-grade teacher for 11 years in the rural area of Acoyapa.

She is requesting her sixth loan with the goal of constructing a kitchen for her house, which she built thanks to the support of the San Sebastián Project and the financing that AFODENIC has given her.  Previously she was living in her mother's house.

Virginia's biggest dream is to be able to have her house in the best condition for her daughter, since it is the inheritance she will leave her.

loans.use: to construct a kitchen.

loans.name: Mwanamze

texts.en:
Mwanamze is a single woman with two children, both of whom have graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.
For the past four years, Mwanamze has operated a food sales business, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of high transport costs in her business. She dreams of establishing a stall to sell food in the future.  
With this loan of 20,000 KES, Mwanamze wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and beans. She decided to join Kiva partner Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and bean.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 45 years old and has 5 children, one child is in school. She is married.

Vivencia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11000 loan, through NWTF, to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Vivencia has been raising pigs for 3 years now. She has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Vivencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene  52  años de edad, está separada y tiene dos hijos independientes.  No concluyó la secundaria.

La señora  Catalina trabaja desde hace diez años con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio de venta de abarrotes.  Nos cuenta que también  se dedica a la venta de bordados en bayeta (telas).

Con éste nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará mercaderías como azúcar, arroz, fideos, leches y bayetas para bordarlos.  La señora también tiene criaderos de trucha y recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. 

Su sueño  es mejorar las jaulas de los criaderos.  Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo, las reuniones y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Catalina is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima communal bank in the district of Juli, Chucuito province, department of Puno. She is 52 years old and separated. She has two grown children. She did not finish secondary school

Señora Catalina has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for 10 years. Her first loan was for 300 new soles, money which added to the capital of her business selling groceries. She tells us that she is also engaged in the sale of embroidery on flannel.

With this new loan of 1500 new soles she will buy merchandise such as sugar, rice, noodles, milk, and flannel for embroidery. Catalina also has hatcheries for trout and receives assistance from her children. Her dream is to improve the hatchery enclosures.

What she likes most about the communal bank is the ease of getting loans, the meetings, and the timeliness of assistance.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as sugar, rice, noodles, milk, and flannel for embroidery.

loans.name: Erika Margarita

texts.es:
Erika, vive con su esposo y dos hijas, es casada, vendedora de mariscos y pólvora para la época de navidad, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio ya que lo realiza desde hace veinte años y su horario es de 5:30 a.m. a 1:30 p.m. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mariscos como pescado seco, camarones, pescado fresco y demás, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar su negocio y las ganancias para comprar la pólvora para esta época navideña.
Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sean unos profesionales, seguir en el negocio  y así convertirse en una pequeña empresaria con la ayuda de sus 2 hijas.
texts.en:
Erika is married and lives with her husband and two daughters. She sells seafood, as well as fireworks for the Christmas season. She has twenty years of experience in the business, and works 5:30 a.m. to 1:30 p.m. 

She is asking for this loan in order to buy seafood, including dried fish, shrimp, fresh fish, and more. The investment will help her improve her business, and with the earnings she will buy fireworks for the upcoming Christmas season. 

Erika's greatest dream is for her children to become professionals; she'd like to continue with her business and become a small businesswoman with the help of her two daughters.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, shrimp, and fresh fish.

loans.name: Reuy

texts.en:
Reuy, 55, is widowed and has five children. One of them is a dependent, while the other four are married, working as hairdresser and as a construction worker. Reuy is a farmer in a rural area of Moung Russey District. She also raises pigs and runs a small store selling face powder to generate additional income to feed her family. She has been in this business for 15 years to make a living. 

Reuy has been with VisionFund since 2007, and she completely repaid the loan with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund help her to have regular income and sufficiently feed her children. Now she is requesting for a fourth loan. She will use this loan to buy more piglets for her business. She hopes to earn more income from this business and can build on some savings for future needs.

loans.use: to buy piglets for her pig raising business.

loans.name: Mas

texts.en:
Mas is 43 and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. She sells fish and her husband buys lotus leaves to sell. 

Mas is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more fish to sell. Her loan will enable her family to generate more income. In the future, Mas would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase 1000 liters of kerosene.

loans.name: Moeurn

texts.en:
Moeurn lives in the Prey Chor district with four single children and one married child. She cultivates rice crops alongside her husband on the farmland there. She is now 48 years old and she has been engaged in this business for more than 26 years. In the next few months, one of her children is going to get married, yet Moeurn has inadequate funds to prepare for the upcoming wedding party. 

At the present, she is seeking funds from HKL to prepare for her second child’s wedding party. This loan will provide satisfaction for the whole family and remove some worries. She is very grateful for the help from our lenders.

loans.use: to prepare for her second child’s wedding party.

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза более восьми лет занимается животноводством. Она разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Ей 28 лет. У нее один ребенок. Она просит кредит для закупа корма для скота.
texts.en: Dilnoza has been raising cattle for over eight years. She breeds the cattle and sells it. Dilnoza is 28 years old and has a child. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase animal feed.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her dairy farming business

loans.name: Geomar

texts.en:
Geomar has a tailoring workshop where she sews clothing, particularly sports uniforms and clothing for social events. She has 22 years of experience as a seamstress, and 8 years in her own workshop. She tends to her clients every day from Monday through Sunday, especially when there is a lot of work. She generates additional income by printing images on the clothing. She also take advantage of her freezer to sell ice and colas.

With the loan, she will buy her raw materials: cloth, buttons, elastic, and artwork for the printing. With the additional earnings this investment will generate she hopes to renovate a part of her house for her business and workshop.

Geomar is 40 years old, with 3 children. Her husband has worked as a machine operator for 30 years. She and her husband mutually support each other. They are an enterprising couple; both have worked since they were very young. They have their own cement house. Geomar's dream is to continue working in order to generate more income and improve the business, and for her children to finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Geomar tiene un taller de costura donde cose especialmente uniformes deportivos y para eventos sociales. Su experiencia es de 22 años. Con su taller propio 8 años. El negocio lo tiene en su casa. Lo atiende permanentemente de lunes a domingo especialmente cuando hay mucho trabajo. Además ella realiza estampados en la ropa y esos son otros ingresos para ella. Ella también tiene un congelador que lo ha aprovechado para vender hielo y colas.

Ella comprará su materia prima: tela camiseta, botones, elástico, pintura para los estampados. Con estos ingresos adicionales que generará desea adecuar un espacio en su casa para el local.

Geomar tiene 40 años. Con 3 hijos. Su esposa trabaja como operador de máquina desde hace 30 años. Su esposo y ella se apoyan mutuamente, son una pareja emprendedora que han trabajado desde muy jóvenes. Ellos tienen casa propia de cemento. Su sueño es seguir trabajando para generar ingresos y mejorar el negocio y que sus hijos terminen su colegio.

loans.use: Invest in raw materials

loans.name: Eugeny

texts.en:
Eugeny is 53 years old, married and mother of eight children. She sells food products such as corn, manioc and beverages. She is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy sacks of corn and manioc in bulk for resale.

Eugeny started her business in 2001. Through her business, Eugeny has been able to support her family. She also likes it because it gives her the opportunity to make contacts with many different people, and once they become permanent clients she is able to offer them quality products at a better price. Her plan is to open a storage depot.

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and manioc in bulk for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Make physical improvements to his home and store

loans.name: Homida

texts.en:
T. Homida has been trading toys and childrens' clothes from Somon (Atushbazaar) in Khujand for six years. She loves children and prides herself on meeting the individual needs of each individual child.
In the beginning she sold only children clothes, but gradually she began to include toys into her range. Presently she has a lot of clients and her turnover of her working capital is good. In the future she wants to expand her range by including automatic toys. She also plans to purchase warm clothes with her requested loan. For these purposes she is requesting a loan of $1000.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Suitulaga

texts.en: Suitulaga comes from a family of twelve children. She got married 7 years ago and has 4 children. Suitulaga's husband works in a supermarket. He is very hard-working, always working in the plantation also after work and during the weekends. The couple has decided to improve their plantation. Suitulaga, therefore, joined SPBD, and is very happy about her decision, since she can now borrow money to buy the equipment she needs for her plantation. Suitulaga is asking for a loan of US$300, and is very thankful for such a great opportunity to develop her business.

loans.use: Purchase of equipment for a plantation

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina T. is 46 years old, married and has 4 children.  She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells cooked food.  She has been a LAPO member for 8 years.  She is requesting a loan of $700 to enable her to buy more foodstuffs.  This, she said, will enable her to serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for cooking food to sell

loans.name: Ataboev

texts.en: Ataboev Z. lives in Spitamen (Soghd oblast, Tajikistan).  He is married and has 3 children. Ataboev Z. applied to MicroInvest in 2007 and  is a serious and responsible client. His business' stability and income increase helped him to repay the previous loan and to improve his business situation.  Because he has been engaged in the livestock business from the early years when he helped his father raise and sell cows and sheep, Ataboev Z. has the appropriate knowledge for his business . In addition, he is engaged in  agricultural production and rice cultivation.  In time, he would like to purchase a horn pedigree bull to breed and further increase his livestock numbers. Now Mr. Ataboev Z. requests a loan of $350 for  business development and the horn pedigree bull purchase that would allow him to increasing significantly the family income.

loans.use: for business development and the  horn pedigree bull purchase

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco, 40, is married and has one 12-year old son who is in 6th grade. His wife is a homemaker and cares for their son. This small family lives in the Memorial Sandino settlement, a neighborhood where people have few resources. Many of the people of the neighborhood work as street vendors, selling their products in other parts of the city, at markets and street corners.

So it is that Francisco has earned a living, working as a street vendor for the last 12 years, selling cosmetics and men's and women's clothing at good prices in order to be able to take money home at the end of each day. He begins his day at 6 in the morning and doesn't get home until 6 at night, every day of the week. Francisco now hopes to buy new merchandise including children's clothing which is in high demand and the product that sells fastest.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Don Francisco tiene 40 años de edad, casado, con un hijo de 12 años de edad, el cual cursa 6to grado de primaria, su esposa se queda en casa realizando los oficios del hogar y cuidando al niño. Esta pequeña familia habita en el asentamiento Memorial Sandino, en donde los pobladores de este sector son de escasos recursos económicos y muchos de ellos salen de sus viviendas a vender sus productos de manera ambulantes a otros barrios, mercados y semáforos de la ciudad.

Es así como se gana la vida Don Francisco, un hombre que desde hace 12 años se dedica a esta actividad, vende cosméticos y ropa para dama y caballeros a precios favorables con el propósito de llevar dinero diario a casa, inicia su día de trabajo a las 6:00 am y llega a las 6: 00 pm, todos los días de la semana. En estos momentos el sr. Desea comprar mercadería y diversificar el producto comprando ropa de niños que le están demandando y es lo que más se vende con rapidez.

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng S., 26 (her husband is pictured), the mother of one child, has a business selling grocery products from her house, usually earning about $3 a day. Her husband, Mr. Chan Chen, 27, works as a truck driver with a revenue of $10 a day. To improve their standard of living and increase income, they request a loan of $1000 from Kiva which, along with savings, will enable them to purchase a small truck for Mr. Chen to transport  sand from the river to the construction site.

loans.use: To purchase a small truck.

texts.es:
En la zona de villa tejada, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal del mismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “señor de exaltacion”que cuenta con 16 socias.
Un grupo muy simpático ya que además de trabajar juntas con el sistema de créditos que Pro-Mujer les ofrece, llegaron a formar una muy linda amistad entre ellas.

Son varias las actividades que  realiza la asociación “, alguna de ellas tiene  una tienda de víveres, otras socias venden comida, helados, papas, pero la mayoría se dedica a la confección de ropa como ser: blusas, pantalones y vestidos y otros. Estos artilculos son confeccionados por ellas mismas.
Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de telas importadas y equipos especiales, de esta manera poder expandir su negocio y lograr ofrecer sus productos de mayor calidad, fuera del país.

loans.use: NECESITAN MAYOR CAPITAL PARA LA COMPRA DE MAQUINARIA ESPECIAL Y MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Agus

texts.id:
Agus P. makes leather bracelet for a living. He travels 2.5 km to work using his motorcycle every day. He sells the finished braceletes direct to consumer or souvenir shop. These braceletes are made of dried leather and then shaped into bracelet in various sizes. Currently he lives in Wijaya Suwung road in Denpasar. His kid is currently in primary school. He uses the profit from his business fro daily living needs and pay his kid's tuition. Agus P. really hopes that he can obtain the loan to expand his business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

Sehari-harinya Agus P. berprofesi sebagai perajin Gelang Kulit. Agus harus menempuh jarak sekitar 2,5 km ketempatnya bekerja dengan menggunakan sepeda motor. Biasanya gelang kulit yang sudah diproduksi dijual ke toko souvenir atau langsung ke konsumen. Gelang kulit ini dibuat dari kulit yang sudah dikeringkan kemudian dibentuk dan dijahit menjadi gelang denagn berbagai bentuk dan ukuran. Saat ini tinggal bersama istri dan anaknya di.Jl Wijaya Suwung Denpasar. Anaknya sekarang sudah duduk di bangku Sekolah Dasar. Keuntungan yang didapat, selain untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga, juga dipakai untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya. Agus P. sangat mengharapkan diberi pinjaman untuk dipakai sebagai modal usaha.

loans.use: Purchase Raw Leather material

loans.name: Latyr

texts.fr:
LATYR N. is a grower and is married and the father of eight. To improve his income, he raises sheep. The income earned from his business enables him to send his children to school and to feed his family. He has already benefited from two loans of 200,000 francs CFA for strengthening his business.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

LATYR N. est un cultivateur ,marié et pére de 08 enfants .Pour amelliore ses revenus,il éléve des moutons .les revenus tirés de son activité lui permet la scolarité des enfants et nouriture pour la famille.il a déjà bénéficié de 2 prets de 200000F CFA pour renforcer son activité

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Maave

texts.en: Maave M., 66, is married with eleven children. She has three years of experience in the popcorn and ice cake business. She sells to the people in the village four days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~100 USD). SPBD loans are Maave’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan through the traditional banks. All of the loan will go towards supplies for her business.

loans.use: Puchase popcorn, popcorn bags, plastic cups, and other supplies for a popcorn and ice cake business.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Mrs. Nita L., 32, lives in Khogana Dobato. Khogana Dobato is located in Lalitpur district. Khogana Dobato is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Mrs. Nita L. has three members including herself in her family. Her husband is Mr. Kamal L., who works in a noodle factory. Her son is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. L. opened her gift shop a year ago to improve the standard of living of her family because only her husband's income is not enough to run her family smoothly. She sells various types of gift items in her shop. Now she is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 10000.00 to buy different types of gift items for her business.

loans.use: To buy gift items for re-sale

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en: Sajida baji is the wife of A. H. and lives in an area of city Lahore named Ismail Nagar, Pakistan. She has been living in this area for the last 11 years. She is the mother of four children: two boys and two girls. Her one daughter and one son are in kindergarten. Her husband is a butcher by profession. He runs a meat shop, with experience of 11 years. Sajida baji is a housewife and prefers to do household work. Sajida baji and her husband want to give their children a better future. Sajida baji successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy livestock (goats, cows) for her husband's meat business.

loans.use: To buy cattle for the meat business

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: Mrs. Sek S. is a farmer in Peam Prochum Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She is 49 years old and the mother of two children, both of whom are attending the local school. In her plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile, thus affecting her crop growth. To solve this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to improve her field conditions. Her husband, Mr. Chan Song, is a palm juice collector who gathers palms to process into sugar and wine. Aside from this business, he is also a pig breeder. Previously, Mrs. Sek S. had obtained a loan from AMK to buy piglets for her husband's business. Her husband is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mkianaisha's Group

texts.en:
Mkianaisha M. sells chapati and other small food items in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. Chapati is a flat pancake that is fried in oil and usually cooked over coals. It is served for breakfast, lunch, or as a snack during the day, and it can be eaten plain or rolled up with a fruit or vegetables inside. Mkianaisha works from 6:00am to 10:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $20 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more ingredients for the food and increase her sales and profit.

Mkianaisha is 29 years old, divorced, and has one 5-year-old child. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Zuhura, who also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for chapati.

loans.name: Mrs. Channy Koem Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank, which consists of eleven members, is located in Svay Chrum Thmey village in Kampong Chhnang Province. They plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Channy K. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She is a bean seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more beans to sell. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Sin Phalla, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Channy K. has three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study. All the members of the bank are presented in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase ingredients to produce empanadas; also to buy raw milk to resell.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom S. is 29 years old and her husband's name is Khim Sokhon, aged 33. They currently live in Purst Province, Cambodia where they earn a living raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house, raising them for slaughter and also for offspring. Their other source of income is growing rice. Eighteen years ago, they started their businesses. They are currently earning approximately US$ 5 each day.

The couple now cares for one lovely child who is female and a minor. They always work hard and especially are very responsible for their child, including paying for food, clothing, and medical care. To expand the investment and earn extra income to buy more food for the family's needs, S. is applying for a loan to purchase 10 piglets to raise and a rice mill to use for hulling rice.

loans.use: to purchase 10 piglets to raise and a rice mill for hulling rice

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 58, lives in Nabatieh, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ahmad has owned a restaurant for a few years. He serves Lebanese food. Ahmad is requesting a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan. Ahmad's restaurant is well known in his region. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and tourists. In the future, he plans to renovate his restaurant by changing the decor.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Sa

texts.en:
Mr. Sa H., 53, and his wife, Mrs. Khotijas H., 51, were married in 1982 and have two children: one son and one daughter. Their son is a fisherman and the daughter attends school and assists her parents in fishing business when she has free time. The family lives along National Road Number Six, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sa has been fishing for over twenty years, a skill he learned from his parents. His wife fishes as well. They fish from Mekong River and sell to the middleman in the village who then takes it to sell at market. Sa is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase a boat and boat motor for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and boat motor for his fishing business.

loans.name: Uldosh

texts.ru: Улугов Юсуфали житель Гиссарского района. Возраст 43 года. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Образование средне-специальное. По профессии шофер. Работает частным таксистом. Опыт работы ужен около 20 лет. Работает по маршруту Душанбе-Гиссар. Кредит необходим для того, чтобы закупить автозапчасти. Таким образом он сможет сделать своевременный ремонт машины. Полгасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Uldosh U. lives in the Gissar region. He is 43 years old. He is married and has four children. He has a secondary-specialty education. He is a driver by profession. Uldosh works as a private taxi driver. He has around 20 years of experience. Uldosh works on the route Dushanbe-Gissar. A loan is necessary to purchase spare auto parts. This will allow him to make modern repairs to his car. He plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix car.

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.ru: Иноят занимается куплей продажей детской одежды и разных мелких товаров. Постоянного места торговли не имеет и ездит по разным дням по кишлакам, где проходят местные базары. Опыт в этой деятельности несколько лет, так как после потери постоянного места работы она была вынуждена заняться предпринимательством. Иноят недавно исполнилось 44 года, она замужем и воспитывает 4 детей. Старший сын по выходным дням помогает матери в ее торговле. Иноят подала заявку на КИВА, так как собирается немного обновить свой ассортимент с приходом весны.
texts.en:
Inoyat buys and sells children's clothing and various small items. She does not have a regular shop, but each day travels to a different small town where there's a local market. She has several years of experience in this line of work, because after losing her regular place of work, she was forced to go into business. Inoyat recently turned 44. She is married and is raising four children. Her oldest son helps his mother in her business on weekends. Inoyat applied to Kiva for a loan since she is planning to restock her inventory with an assortment for spring.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To restock inventory

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
GIOVANA M. C. pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS MARGARITAS” vive en Jr Pisqui nº 383. del distrito de Callería, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 23 años de edad, no tiene hijos.

Se inició en el negocio de confección y costura de ropa, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró telas e hilos.
 
En la actualidad confecciona juegos de  ropa de cama, juego de sabanas y es muy creativa en lo que hace.  Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de una nueva máquina de coser.

“Me siento realizada dado que Manuela Ramos me dio la oportunidad de tener mi propio negocio y así poder costear mis estudios y mi sueño es ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
Giovana M. C. belongs to the Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”. She lives in Jr Pisqui #383 in the Calleria district of Pucallpa, is 23 years old and has no children. She began her business of tailoring clothes, and with her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles purchased fabrics and thread. These days she sews linen sets for beds and is very creative in what she does. With this new loan of 2,200 Nuevos Soles she will invest in the purchase of a new sewing machine. “I feel very accomplished thanks to Manuela Ramos, who gave me the opportunity to own my business, thus allowing me to afford my studies. My dream is to be a great entrepreneur”.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86611&_tpos=18&_tpg=1
Giovanna  es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de vestir y sport elegante, ella vende en su casa y lleva también a las  empresas, a lo largo de estos años ya tiene una buena cartera de clientas. 
Giovanna necesita un préstamo de  1800 soles, para la compra de ropa, conjuntos, jeans.
Desde que Giovanna están en Finca, agradece por los prestamos que recibe le han ayudado para su negocio, tiene mucha tranquilidad, puede vender más.
El sueño de Giovanna es comprarse un departamento
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86611&_tpos=18&_tpg=1 Giovanna is a member of Bancomunal Las Orquideas, and she has some space where she sells formal clothing as well as elegant sport clothing. She sells from her home and also delivers to companies. Throughout these last years she has acquired a good customer base. Giovanna needs an 1800 soles loan for the purchase of clothing, ensembles, and jeans. Since Giovanna is in FINCA, she is thankful for the loans she has received that have helped her business. She is very confident about being able to sell more. Giovanna's dream is to purchase an apartment.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.es:
Aniceta es socia del Bancomunal Las Flores.
Aniceta es  madre sotera  tiene 53 años, tiene 2 hijos, que son mayores, son independientes 
Aniceta trabajaba en una fabrica de chompas , tuvo que dejar el trabajo por que empezó  a perder la vista y ya no le respondía y se dedico a la venta de productos por catalogo. 
Desde que esta en Finca tiene muchas facilidades  para trabajar por los prestamos que dan. 
Aniceta necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,  para la compra de productos por el día del padre, colonias, medias, correas.
El sueño de Aniceta es llegar hacer consultora  estrella.
texts.en:
Aniceta is a member of "Las Flores" (The Flowers) Community Bank. Aniceta is a single mother who is 53 years old and has two children who are adults and independent. Aniceta used to work in a sweater factory. She had to quit that job because she began to lose her sight and she dedicated herself to selling catalog products. Since joining FINCA, she has many facilities to work for the loans they give. Aniceta needs a loan of 1,000 soles in order to purchase products for Father's Day such as colognes, belts, socks. Aniceta's dream is to become a star saleswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for Father's Day such as colognes, belts, socks

loans.name: Chemsa

texts.en: Chemsa U. runs a beauty salon in Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda.  At 29 years old, Chemsa is married with three children (aged 2, 6, and 9).  In order to expand her business, which makes her 100,000 Rwandan francs (FRW) per month, she requests a loan from Vision Finance Company of 500,000 FRW.

loans.use: Business expansion.

loans.name: Mrs. Socheat Uch Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of 30 people who will use the loan for a variety of purposes, is located in Ta Reap Doun Sor village in Kandal Province. Mrs. Socheat U., the village bank president, is a vegetable seller in the local market. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it and so is requesting a loan to buy different kinds of vegetable to resell in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Pov Borin, is a motorbike taxi driver who can make a small income to support the whole family. Mrs. Socheat U. is 29 years old and the mother of two children, four and five years of age.

Four members in this village bank loans have end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of vegetable to resell in the local market.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol P. is from the village of Zone 1B in Del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 18 years old and married. To make a living, Mirasol sells used clothing to local community members. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for over a years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In July 2009, Mirasol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirasol is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be Mirasol's first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business and supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and use as working capital

location.town: Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jenner

texts.es:
Jenner tiene 36 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos de 1 y 7 años de edad en la ciudad de Ferreñafe, ubicada a 20 minutos de Chiclayo.

Desde hace 10 años maneja un taller de mecánica que se especializa en la reparación y mantenimiento de motos lineales y mototaxis (vehículo motorizado utilizado en el transporte de carga y pasajeros), el negocio ha sido su fuente de sustento durante este tiempo y, debido a su experiencia y capacidad, se ha vuelto muy conocido entre los mototaxistas de la ciudad de Ferreñafe que acuden a él al presentarseles cualquier desperfecto en sus unidades móviles.

El está solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de repuestos que utiliza diariamente en su trabajo.

Jenner vive en una casa alquilada y su mayor anhelo es construir una casa propia para vivir con los suyos y asegurarles estabilidad e independencia ,desea seguir creciendo como empresario y brindarle un buen futuro a sus hijos.

Los clientes de Jenner siempre están contentos con su servicio y lo consideran alguien reponsable y muy trabajador.
texts.en:
Jenner is 36 years old and lives with his wife and their two children, ages 1 and 7. They live in the city of Ferreñafe, located 20 minutes from Chiclayo. For 10 yearss he has operated a mechanic shop that specializes in repairing and maintaining motorcycles and motor-taxis (motorized vehicles used for transporting goods and passengers). The business has been his source of support during this time, and, due to his experience and capacity, he has become very well-known by the motor-taxi drivers in the city of Ferreñafe who come to him for help with any type of imperfection on their vehicles. For the first time he is asking our institution for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles that he wants to invest in the purchase of spare parts that he uses daily in his work. Jenner lives in a rented house and his greatest wish is to build his own house to live with his family and ensure stability and independence for them. He desires to continue growing as a businessman and provide a good future for his children. Jenner’s customers are always content with their service and they consider him to be responsible and very hard-working.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts to repair motocycles

loans.name: Nathaly Luz

texts.es: LA SEÑORA NATHALY TIENE LA ACTIVIDAD DE UNA TIENDA DE BARRIO, ELLA ESTA SEPARADA DE SU ESPOSO, POR LO TANTO, DEBE MANTENER SOLA A SU HIJO DE 3 AÑOS DE EDAD. VIVE JUNTO CON SUS PADRES EN CASA FAMILIAR. PARA TENER ALGUN INGRESO ECONOMICO ABRIO UNA PEQUEÑA TIENDA DE COMESTIBLES Y OTROS PRODUCTOS; EL CREDITO REQUIERE PARA SURTIR EL NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Sra. Nathaly operates a store in her neighborhood. She is separated from her husband, so she is the only one supporting her 3 year old son. She lives at home with her parents. In order to generate income, she opened a small store where she sells food and other products. She is requesting a loan in order to stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Anne-Marie

texts.fr: Z. Anne-Marie est née vers 1959 à Adjarra. Anne-Marie est mariée à KOULIHO Marcellin. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, tous scolarisés dont trois sont les leurs. La famille vit à Adjarra. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Anne-Marie vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. En effet, Anne-Marie vend de façon ambulante les chaussures et layettes ainsi que la bouillie de maïs.  Anne-Marie est une cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Anne-Marie demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.

loans.use: Achat de chaussures et layettes.

loans.name: Simon's Group

texts.en: S. Simon is a very hard working man and a produce seller in Mityana Central market. He says that he has not been facing many challenges in business except the poor transport system which is costly, the rainy season that affects some crops as well as an off season. Simon is able to make 150,000/= as profits a week and this is mostly attributed to the 15 years of experience in business as well as the good quality of his produce. Simon has a dream of improving the quality of his business by having a variety of produce sold as well as improving his family house and initiating other projects in future. Simon is a father of 8 school going children as he takes care of two more dependants and since he has used more money to pay school fees, he needs a new loan to help purchase more produce like a sack of millet, maize, beans so as to increase stock.

loans.use: Purchasing more produce for increased stock.

loans.name: Sawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan is a 41-year-old married woman and mother of five children. In 1999, she decided to buy a sewing machine to start a business working as a home based tailor after having sixteen years of experience in this field.

Today, Sawsan is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new sewing machine to increase her sales and so her income.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Mrs. Juvy P. is from the town of D'Ban, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old, is married, and is blessed with two school-aged children. Juvy owns and operates a business selling cosmetics and food products in the local community. She earns 5,000 PHP net monthly from her business. In 2009, Juvy joined PMPC to access its programs and services. Currently, she's obtaining her 2nd loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Senac Group

texts.es: El grupo “Senac” representado por la señora Ruth Mery y conformado por 12 miembros los cuales se dedican a la venta D. ropa en forma ambulante, venta D. golosinas en porterías D. escuelas, venta D. desayuno, comida, servicio D. radio difusión, agricultura y servicio D. taxi. Como en toda actividad existe competencia, pero las señoras ponen todo D. su parte para salir adelante, además que confían en sus negocios y su capacidad D. venta D. productor ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familias. El destino del crédito es para capital D. operación y para incremento D. su mercadería con la compra D. insumos para realizar masitas para vender, adquisición D. ropa al por mayor y también para la adquisición D. herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a realizar un trabajo mas eficiente. Dentro D. la Institución van cursando su segundo ciclo sin ninguna dificultar demostrando tener ganas para sacar adelante sus negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento D. sus familia que es su razón para seguir trabajando.Las esposa D. dos D. los socios se encuentran en la foto como sus representantes debido a que no podian abandonar sus puestos D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The Senac Group is led by Sra. Ruth Mery and consists of 12 members who are dedicated to various businesses. These incluD. selling clothing as street merchants, selling sweets at schools, selling breakfasts, preparing meals, radio broadcasting, agriculture, and taxi services. The members face competition in their respective businesses, but they do everything in their power to stay ahead. They have confidence in their businesses and their abilities as producers because their families’ livelihoods are at stake.

This loan will be used as operating capital to increase inventory. This includes purchasing ingredients for snack vending, buying clothing in bulk, and acquiring tools needed to perform their work and become more efficient. The members are starting their second loan cycle with the Institution. They have had little difficulty in moving their businesses forward because they have demonstrated that they do not lack the desire to continue working.

In the photo, the spouses for two of the members are standing in as their representatives because they did not want to leave their businesses unattended.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Carlos Albino

texts.es:
Don Carlos tiene 42 años está casado, tienen 3 hijos, don Carlos cuando era un niño ya ayudaba a su madre desde entonces se dedica a la producción de leche cruda cuyo producto entregan a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de diferentes productos lácteos, en la familia de don Carlos todos trabajan es decir que los tres hijos ayudan en el trabajo de cada día.

Don Carlos y su familia viven en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de MachajMarca, en su casa es donde tienen sus 8 cabezas de ganado lechero.El crédito será destinado para la terminar la construcción de su establo esto es muy importante para la protección de su ganado, ya que se acerca la temporada de lluvia.

El sueño más importante de don Carlos es ver con una carrera profesional a sus tres hijos, y aumentar la producción de la leche cruda.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children. Ever since he was a boy he used to help his mother, and since then has worked in fresh milk production. The product is then delivered to a business that works making different dairy products. Everyone in Carlos' family works, meaning that his three children help with the job every day.

Mr. Carlos and his family live in the city of Cochabamba in the MachajMarca community. They have their 8 milk-cows at home with them. The loan is to be used to finish constructing his stable. This is very important for protecting the livestock, since the rainy season is approaching.

Mr. Carlos' greatest dream is to see each of his three children with a professional career, and to increase production of the fresh milk.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish constructing a stable to house livestock

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en: Walaa is a 24 year-old married woman living in the region of Bint Jbeil with her husband.  Since 2007, Walaa has had a women's dress and coat shop.  Walaa is requesting a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua in order to buy merchandise for the Holy season. This is her first micro credit experience and she is hopeful. Walaa is still continuing her university studies and she’s proud that from her business she was able to buy a computer that helps her study. Her customers are her relatives, university friends and associates, and tourists. In the future, Walaa is planning to expand her business by adding men's and children's clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Felipe Santiago

texts.es: El señor Felipe Santiago R. S. tiene 47 años de edad, es casado y habitan en el Reparto Juan Ramon Padilla la esposa se dedica al comercio y juntos tiene 2 hijos, ellos han trabajado arduamente con el objetivo de poder brindarles a sus hijos las comodides necesarias para que ellos tengan una vida digna y segura para esto el señor R. desde el año pasado ha solicitado prestamo con el objetivo de realizar mejoras en la infraestructura de su hogar, ellos continuaran con una sagunda etapa de su proyecto de construccion, pero solicitaran un prestamo para reinvertirlo en su negocio el cual es un Aserradero con el prestamo compraron materia prima, esto le trara mejores condiciones de vida a ellos y la satisfaccion como padres de poderles ofrecer a sus hijos un futuro mejor, logrando a un largo plazo la posibilidad de darles una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Felipe Santiago R. S., 47, is married and the father of two children. His wife is a merchant. Together, they work hard toward providing their children with the comforts required so that they can have a worthy and safe life. To achieve this, since last year, he has asked for funding to bring about some improvements to his home's infrastructure. They will continue with the second phase of their building project but the loan will be used to invest in raw materials for their business, which is a sawmill. This will improve their living conditions and give them the satisfaction of knowing that, as parents, they are offering their children a better future hoping, in the long run, to provide them with a worthy home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: S. Sam is 35 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. He is a businessman who owns a shop selling insecticides, pesticides, and so on. He has been in this business for over three years. Sam is using his loan to purchase and stock a variety of insecticides and pesticides for sale. He wishes to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase insecticides and pesticides to sell

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina M. is currently in the business of brewing and selling local beer and is requesting a loan to stock more ingredients to use.  Celerina is 25 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock more ingredients to use.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu K. makes a living selling cooking items in her town's central market. She has been in this business for 22 years, while her husband makes a living selling various food items. She has 10 children, works very hard, and does not often get assistance from other people.  Her long-term goal is to buy the stall she works in so that she no longer needs to pay rent. Kadiatu believes this will be possible because she has an outstanding credit history and is a member of a loan group.  She is applying for a loan to support her children and build a house on land that she recently acquired.

loans.use: To increase her income by buying more items to sell.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
El señor Abraham R. y su esposa la señora Perfecta Alemán tiene dos hijos de pequeña edad, les preocupa su seguridad en la casa ya que le está haciendo falta la barda al frente de la casa. 
 Pero por el momento no cuentan con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material, ya que el señor Abraham se dedica a la construcción y el mismo elaborar la barda. 
Es por eso que solicita el préstamo y planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtienen de su trabaja como albañil, ya su esposa se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso de su trabajo de limpieza de una casa particular.
texts.en:
Abraham and his wife, Perfecta, have two young children. They worry about their home’s security because it does not have a wall (fence) in the front. At the moment they do not have the money to buy the building materials. Abraham works in construction and will build the wall himself, so he is asking for this loan. He will repay the loan with his income from his work as a mason. His wife takes care of the household expenses from her income as a cleaning woman in a private home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to build a fence.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel Godínez P. es un señor  de 54 años  de edad el cual vive con su esposa en una comunidad llamada Santa Fe localizada en Los Chiles, provincia de Alajuela; está comunidad se destaca por ser una zona montañosa y por estar muy cerca de la frontera norte de nuestro país. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería y la agricultura específicamente se da la siembra de granos básicos, caña de azúcar, naranja.

Desde hace ya varios años don Isabel  se dedica a su negocio, una Carnicería. Logra vender sus  productos a los vecinos de su comunidad quienes se muestran muy satisfechos con la calidad de sus productos en especial la carne de res. Don Isabel considera que gracias al progreso de este proyecto, él y su esposa han mejorado poco a poco sus condiciones de vida.

En estos momentos Don Isabel desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢665000 (seiscientos sesenta y cinco mil colones), para comprar más vacas y cerdos  poder incrementar la ventas de su negocio. También necesita mejorar las condiciones del local ya  que se encuentra muy deteriorado y eso afecta las ventas. Asegura que su carniceria le ha dado muy buenos resultados y es por eso que necesita mejorarlo.


Isabel Godínez es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial de Santa Fe, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera crecer más a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito motivan a los microempresarios a seguir superándose.
texts.en:
