Isabel Godínez P. is a 54 year old man who lives with his wife. They live in a community called Santa Fe, which is located in Los Chiles in the Alajuela province. This community is known for its mountainous regions and for being very close to the northern border of our country. Its main economic activities are livestock and farming. Specifically, they plant basic grains, sugar cane, and oranges. Isabel’s business for several years has been a butcher shop. He sells his products to the neighbors in his community. They are very satisfied with the quality of his products, especially the pork. Isabel believes that, thanks to the progress of this project, he and his wife have slowly improved their living conditions. At this time Isabel wishes to get a micro loan for ¢665,000 (six hundred sixty-five thousand colones) to buy more cows and pigs. He will buy them to increase sales in his business. He also needs to improve the conditions of his place because it is much deteriorated, and that affects sales. He assures us that his butcher shop has given him very good results. That is why he needs to improve it. Isabel Godínez is a member of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal Manantial (Manantial Communal Credit Company) in Santa Fe, one of a hundred member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan. With the loan he hopes to grow more on a personal and economic level. He also points out that, thanks to this these types of organizations and ways of getting loans, small business people are motivated to keep improving themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy livestock and improve his place

loans.name: Ada

texts.en:
Ada is 28 years of age and married with 2 children. Her husband is a business man and they live together in Lagos.

Ada sells electrical goods and building materials in her shop. She has been in this business for the past 4 years. With the little profit she earns from her business, she helps her husband take care of their family.

Ada is determined to pull her family out of poverty. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more electrical goods and building materials to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical goods and building materials to sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “SACRO”; Nuestra socia es natural de la comunidad de cruz pata en el poblado de chinchero perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es el Sra. VICTORIA,  Nuestra socia tiene 53 años  es casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos ellos independientes; nuestra socia se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales menores, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivos y siembran papa, maíz, habas, hortalizas, quinua, tarwi y según la época. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas, abono y pagar el tractor para remover la tierra antes de sembrar.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Victoria is a member of the “Sacro” (Sacred) Communal Bank. She is originally from the community of Cruz Pata in the town of Chinchero, which is part of Urubamba Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Victoria is 53 years old, married, and has four children who are all independent. She spends her time farming and raising small animals. Victoria has land on which she grows potatoes, corn, lima beans, vegetables, quinoa, “tarwi” (a type of bean grown in the Andes), and other crops according to the season. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds and compost. In addition, she will pay to have a tractor till her land prior to planting.

Victoria appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & compost; rent a tractor to till her land

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en: Sarkis is a 59 year old man who has four children. Sarkis has owned a grocery store since 2002. In his store he sells candies, canned food, beverage, chips, biscuits etc. Sarkis requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for his store in order to be able to expand and diversify his stock; the expansion will help him answer his clients' needs. This is the first time that Sarkis has requested a loan. His clients are his friends and neighbors. Sarkis decided to open a grocery business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, Sarkis plans to keep on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Félicité

texts.fr: T. Félicité est née le 05 Juin 1960 à Adjohoun, dans le département de l’Ouémé. Félicité est mariée à DEMANGNON Marc et est mère de deux enfants.  Le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge. Félicité vit avec sa famille, au quartier Danmin dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis six ans. Félicité vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les différentes charges de la famille. Félicité n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de dix huit ans que Félicité prépare et vend du « agbéli » (aliment local fait à base de maïs, accompagné de sauce). De façon secondaire, Félicité vend également en détail, du maïs et de l’huile d’arachide. C’est à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, que Félicité achète ses produits. Face à la demande de plus en plus importante de sa clientèle, Félicité voudrait augmenter son stock de produit, et par ricochet sa production, afin de mieux faire face aux exigences de sa clientèle. C’est ce qui l’amène à solliciter pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Félicité T. was born on June 5, 1960 in Adjohoun, in the Ouémé Department of Benin. Félicité is married to Marc DEMANGNON and is a mother of two. The couple also looks after another child. Félicité has lived with her family in the Danmin neighbourhood in the Sèmè-Podji township for six years.
Félicité helps her husband cover the family expenses. Félicité did not attend school, but for almost 18 years, Félicité has prepared and sold “agbéli” (a local corn-based dish served with sauce). Félicité also sells corn and peanut oil on the side. Félicité buys her products in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.
Facing increasing customer demand, Félicité would like to increase her stock, and in turn her production, in order to better meet the needs of her customers. This is why she is requesting her first loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn and oil

loans.name: Love Each Other Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Love Each Other” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Hawanatu K. is the leader of this group. The 24-year-old is married to a businessman and they have one child. Hawanatu has been a businesswoman for four years now. She sells rubber bowls, dishes, spoons, cups, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the abov- mentioned items at wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy rubber bowls, dishes, spoons, cups, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Togtbayar

texts.en:
Togtbayar M. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and child in Hovd province, western Mongolia. Her daughter goes to a local kindergarten while her husband drives a taxi in the city. 

Togtbayar operates a women's clothing and lingerie retail business from a stall at a local clothing market. She sells a variety of different clothing items and accessories and her wide product selection attracts many customers. She started her clothing business in 2001, selling only women's lingerie items. But due to the increase of the number of businesspeople who were engaged in the same operation, she managed to enlarge the range of products and after finding success and achieving stable business operations, she expanded her product line to include lingerie and clothing. 

Togtbayar is a very open-minded and sociable woman and is well known by her customers. She is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Sarith

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarith P. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Saret Prum, have been married since 2003 and have two children: one son and one daughter. One is in school and the other one is still young. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Two about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Sarith is a silk weaver. She also buys some silk fabric from other provinces far away from her house for resale in front of the garment factory. She is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase finished silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To purchase finished silk fabric for resale.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie M. is from the village of Bantuanon, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 42 years old. Vergie is separated from her spouse and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Vergie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising ducks for sale. Vergie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Vergie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Vergie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia lives in Lahore, a historic city in Pakistan and the capital city of Punjab province. She has recently moved to the area named Yadgar with her husband and family. She is a fifty one year old lady who spends most of her time at her home and does her household responsibilities. She has three children. All of her children are illiterate and involved in different businesses. Her eldest son is an electrician. The middle one works in a motor-workshop and the youngest prepares embroidered dresses on order. Her husband is 60 years old and doesn’t do any work. 

Razia has applied for a loan on behalf of her eldest son for his electric work. With the loan amount he will buy the latest repairing tools to provide better electricity repairing facilities for his customers. Razia is hopeful that this investment will prove beneficial for her son and that he will be able to generate a good income from it. She has a plan to marry him off next year so he will become a family man and spends his life happily. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in 3rd loan cycle.

loans.use: Purchase of the latest electric repairing tools.

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa D., 36, lives with her husband and one child in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian tent home. Her child attends a university while her husband works in a secondary school as a guard. Ariunaa used to work in the floor industry as a laboratory assistant. 

She operates a meat trading business at Baigal-Eej local market. She has operated this business for the last eight years and has become quite a successful businesswoman. She has used her business earnings to cover her household's expenditures and to improve the quality of her family's lives. Her earnings also have enabled her to pay her child's tuition fees.

Ariunaa is an open-minded, generous and hardworking woman. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to buy more meat to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more meat

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en: Violeta D. is from the village of San Loenzo, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 53 years old. Violeta is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Violeta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tserensodnom

texts.en:
Tserensodnom O. lives with his wife and two children in Arhangai province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both his children attend a local secondary school while his wife works as a teacher in the school. He used to be in the monastery as a lama between 2004 and 2006. 

He has been operating a milk and dairy product trading business for the last four years with a working capital of 200,000 MNT, and has built a stable and successful operation. After years of successful operation, he has managed to increase his working capital to a level exceeding 2,000,000 MNT today. Since beginning his business, he has been able not only to provide for his family, but he has also been able to purchase a new car for himself. 

Tserensodnom is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase milk and fermented milk for his business.

loans.use: To purchase milk and fermented milk

loans.name: Dana Kerti Group

texts.en: Jero Ayu Putu P. A. is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Melaya, Bali. She is married and has a 6-year-old son. She started working straight after junior high school and dreams that her young son will attain a higher education than her own. To make a living, Jero Ayu Putu raises pigs. She started this business 3 months ago. Prior to this, she worked in a shop in a nearby town. She prefers her current farming work as it allows her to work from home. She earns approximately 400,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR) a month. In 2010, Jero Ayu Putu joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be her first loan from MUK. Jero Ayu Putu plans to use the additional income to improve and expand her business. Jero Ayu Putu is the leader of a 10 member group accessing a loan offered by MUK. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Dana Kerti" (PK-10335). About MUK The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation and loans, thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives. Jero Ayu Putu P. A. (0) merupakan 27 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali. Jero Ayu Putu adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota. Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Dana Kerti (PK-10335). Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Jero Ayu Putu sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 2 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Jero Ayu Putu menghasilkan sekitar 0,400 IDR. Dalam 2010, Jero Ayu Putu bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Jero Ayu Putu meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1.500.000 IDR. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK. Tentang MUK: Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: To purchase livestock to raise and sell

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita P. is from the city of Mantic Tangub City. She is 40 years old. Esterlita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Esterlita owns & operates a trisikad transport service. Esterlita has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esterlita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Esterlita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This will be the first loan taken out by Esterlita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en: Ouk O., 50, is a widow living in Takeo province with her seven children. She is a recycler, collecting plastics and canes since 2009. She typically makes US$ 3 per day. She is also supported by three of her children, working in a garment factory. Ouk O. is asking for a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to use to commute to work

loans.name: Resolucion Group

texts.es:
El grupo Resolución está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es Jesenia Raquel R. de 31 años quien vende ropa desde hace cuatro años el cual por su ardua labor, los prestamos e iniciativa ha ido creciendo. Ella con el crédito comprara mercadería como camisas, pantalones, vestidos, trajes, jeans, faldas…etc. 
R. tiene dos hijos de 14 y 12 años quienes en su tiempo libre le ayudan en el negocio.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Marlene S. Granada quien vende ropa y sandalias desde hace 5 años y Jasmina del Socorro C. comerciante de ropa.
texts.en:
The Resolución [Resolution] loan group is made up of three hard-working, dedicated and enterprising women. One of them is Yesenia Raquel R., who is 31 years old. She has worked selling clothes for the last four years, and because of her hard work and initiative, as well as the loans she's taken out, her business has grown. With this loan she will buy more merchandise, such as shirts, pants, dresses, suits, jeans, skirts, etc. Yesenia has two children who are 12 and 14 years old. They help her out in their spare time. 

The other members of the group are Marlene S. Granada, who has been selling clothing and sandals for five years, and Jazmina del Socorro, who also sells clothing.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing merchandise

loans.name: Mujeres En Movimientos Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres en Movimiento nace mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de Capiatá,  fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Nelly M., presidenta del grupo tiene 22 años, ella esta domiciliada en la de Capiatá, allí también tiene su  puesto de ventas de comidas, y es una mujer emprendedora e innovadora.
Ella diariamente prepara los comestibles para vender y esta muy contenta con la actividad ya que le va muy bien.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra especialmente de carne ya que el precio del mismo es muy alto y quiere adquierir en gran cantidad para no dejar de producir sus comestibles es épocas de las fiestas.
texts.en: The group Mujeres en Movimiento (Women in Movement) started thanks to the management and support of another group from the same place. This group is from Capiatá, Paraguay. and began with the main goal of growing each group member, as much socially as economically. The members are known in their area as very hard-working women. The group's president, Nelly M., is 22 years old and lives in Capiatá, where she has a food stand. She is a very enterprising and innovative woman. She daily prepares her food to sell and is very content with her work since it is going very well. She plans to use the loan to purchase meat in particular since the price is very high and she wants to get it in bulk so she will have enough to produce her meals during the holiday season.

loans.use: Purchase meat, oil and other items

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is a 46-year-old married man who owns a car accessories shop.  Samir is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary merchandise for his business.  Samir is a hard worker and his honesty is remarkable.  Samir’s main targets are to expand his business, improve his family’s social and financial situation, and provide education in the best university in town for his children.  As compared to his competitors, Samir provides good customer service, quality, and competitive prices.

loans.use: To buy necessary merchandise for his car accessories shop

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
EN EL DEPARTAMENTO DE MANAGUA LA SRA. ALBA LUZ C. SE DEDICA ARDUAMENTE A LABORAR COMO CONSERJE EN EL CENTRO DE INSUMO PARA LA SALUD, DEDICANDOSE A ESTA LABOR DESDE HACE MAS DE 10 AÑOS, ES MADRE SOLTERA DE DOS HIJOS A LOS QUE TIENE QUE PORPORCIONARLES LAS CONDICONES NECESARIAS PARA QUE SE DESARROLEN.
UNA DE LAS NECESIDADES QUE ELLA A TRAVIESA HOY EN DIA ES QUE DEBE MEJORAR LAS CONDICIONES DE SU VIVIENDA DEBIDO A QUE HA ESTADO EN MALAS CONDICIONES POR LO QUE HA TENIDO LA SABIA DECISION DE INICIAR LA OBRA DE MEJORA. ES POR ESE MOTIVO QUE ELLA A CUDE NUEVAMENTE A CEPORDEL PARA SOLICITAR UN CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE MATERIALES DE CONSTRUCCION COMO: ARENA, CEMENTO, PIEDRA Y HIERRO PARA INICIAR LA MEJORA DE SU VIVIENDA PARA EL LEVANTAMIENTO DE DOS PARDEDES DE SU CASA. POR MEDIO DE ESTA OBRA BRINDARA MEJORES CONDICIONES DE VIDA A SUS HIJOS.
ES IMPORTANTE DESTACAR QUE POR MEDIO DE ESTA OBRA LE PROPORCIONARA A SU FAMILIA A UNA VIVIENDA DIGNA DONDE VIVIR.
texts.en:
In the department of Managua, Mrs. Alba Luz C. works arduously as a janitor in a health supply centre. She has worked in this position for more than 10 years. She is the single mother of two children, to whom she wishes to provide them with favorable living conditions for them to grow. 

One of the needs she faces today is the need to improve the conditions of their home. Their home is in a poor state and she finally decided to have the improvements made. For this reason she requests a loan from Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner). She request s anew loan to purchase construction materials such as: sand, cement, construction rocks and iron. She will have two walls built in her home. With these improvements she will be able to provide her children with better living conditions. 

It is important to mention that these improvements will allow her family to have a dignified home where to live.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Chiva

texts.en:
Mrs. Chiva N. and her husband, Mr. Set Sary, live along National Road Number One, about 35 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2006 and have a young daughter.

Chiva is now a garment factory worker. Her husband drives a Tuk Tuk (a motocycle taxi). They also grow jujube on the farmland in the village.  

But Set’s Tuk Tuk is old and breaks often; he spends a lot of money to repair it. Hence Chiva is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new one for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a new Tuk Tuk

loans.name: Las Santanitas Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama LAS SANTANITAS, Esmeralda C. S. es integrante del grupo, esta ubicado en el Estado de Veracruz en México. Ella se dedica a la venta de chiles secos que inicio hcse 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para la compra de más chiles secos para incrementar su negocio. Al momento de solicitar este pestamo se siente satisfecha ya que le ayudará a su economía familiar. Ella estudio hasta la secundaria y tiene 3 hijas. Alejandra A. es la presidenta del grupo, tiene 27 años, estudió hasta Bachillerato, es casada y tiene una hija. Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos, que inicio hace 3 años. Solicita el prestamo para incrementar más su negocio y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This group is called “Las Santanitas”, which is located in the State of Veracruz in Mexico. Esmeralda C. S. is a member of this group. She started selling dried chili peppers five years ago. Esmeralda is requesting a loan to buy more chili peppers to increase her business. When she applied for this loan, she felt satisfied because the funds would help her family financially. Esmeralda studied through high school and has three daughters.

Alejandra A. is the group president. She is 27 years old and earned her high school diploma. Alejandra is married and has one daughter. She started selling Mexican snacks three years ago. Alejandra is requesting a loan so that she can increase her business even more and provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: Purchase dried chili peppers

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Hoa T. H. is a 36-year-old widow  with 2 children.  For three years, she has been running a shop that sells biscuits and paper products for funeral rites and holiday celebrations (a traditional Vietnamese business).  Her shop is very crowded with customers, especially in the July with the lunar calendar events. Every month, her shop generates 3,500,000 VND in profit, which she uses to manage her family's expenses and pay school fees for her children.  

With the loans from our credit program since 2006, Hoa T. H. has invested effectively in expanding her business.  She is now requesting 8,066,000 VND to buy more sweets and biscuits to meet the demands of her customers.

Hoai T. D. is 38 years old. She is running a tailor shop.  She is in need of 8,066,000 VND  to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy sweet and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred B. is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  He is married and has one child.  His child is currently in school.  Fred has a small retail shop, which he has had for three years.         

To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more rice and beans for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fred hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Fred hopes to expand his business and to see himself prosper in life.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and beans for resale.

loans.name: Sophoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophoeun K. (shown in the photo) is 46 years old and her husband, Mr. Vutha Hieng, is 37 years old. They live in a village about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1994 and have four children – two sons and two daughters. Three of the children are in school and the other is still young.
Sophoeun and her husband raise fish at home. In addition, Mr. Vutha Hieng is a fisherman. Sophoeun hopes to expand her business, so she is asking for her first loan of $500 to purchase additional fish to raise.

loans.use: to purchase additional baby fish to raise

loans.name: Shafiga

texts.en:
Shafiga A. is 48 years old, married and has three children. She has been running a grocery store for the past ten years. She sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks and detergents. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection.

Shafiga is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her store to buy groceries again. Shafiga is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of 1,000 AZN to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Shafiga attain all of her aspirations.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio, de 38 años de edad, natural del distrito de Kimbiri, esta casado con  Claudia de 37 años y fruto de su relación concibieron  03 hijos y juntos habitan en su propia casa  donde reina la felicidad. Julio, es un hombre que se esmera cada día por dar lo mejor a sus hijos, su trabajo consiste en labrar la tierra, es campesino y cuenta con 06 hectáreas de terreno en donde cultiva cacao y café, que son plantas nativas de la zona selvática del Valle Río Apurimac. Han transcurrido 17 años trabajando y hasta el momento continúa en esta actividad para forjar un futuro a sus hijos. Asimismo ellos lo apoyan durante la temporada de cosecha, además de contratar jornaleros, ya que este proceso requiere de mucho esfuerzo y rapidez y lograr recolectar los frutos para luego comercializarlos a las empresas acopiadoras, quienes le remuneran muy bien por cada kilogramo de cada producto que vende. Considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta la ciudad de san francisco; lugar donde le ofrecen mejores precios por sus productos. Por ahora lo que más prioriza es comprar más semillas de cacao ya que cuenta con espacio suficiente para cultivar. Este es su 12avo crédito con MFP, esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito más adelante. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participe. Con el crédito solicitado contratara jornaleros para que le apoyen en el desmonte de maleza que perjudican sus plantaciones.
texts.en: Julio is 38 years old and he is originally from the district of Kimbiri. He is married with Claudia, 37 years old, and they have 3 children from their relationship. They live together in a house that is their own and where happiness reigns. Julio is a man who works every day for the welfare of his children. His work consists of working the land. He is a farmer and he has 6 hectares of land where he cultivates cocoa and coffee. These are native plants to the jungle region of Valle Rio Apurimac. Seventeen years have passed and today he continues with the business to forge a future for his children. In turn, they help him during the harvest and he also hires farm hands especially because this work requires a great deal of effort and expediency to harvest the entire product to sell to the distributing companies. They pay him very well for each kilogram of product that he sells. He considers the most difficult part is having to transport his products from the fields to the city of San Francisco. That is where they give him better prices for his products. For the moment the priority is to purchase more cocoa seeds as he has enough room to plant them. This is his 12th loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to making his payments on time, as he wishes to access future loans. In this communal bank, he is a very involved member. With the loan that he requests he will hire farm hands to help him combat the plagues that harm his plantations.

loans.use: to hire farm hands to help him combat the plagues that damage his plantations.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married with three children. She is 26 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Jennifer has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jennifer has requested a loan of PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Jennifer has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Adida

texts.en:
Adida is a married man with seven children, three of whom are in school while four graduated from school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is the purchase of seeds for farming.

For the past five years, he has operated a mangrove-selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He also does farming as his other source of income. Adida faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of becoming the leading mangrove dealer in the future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, he wants to purchase bundles of mangrove for sale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of mangrove for sale.

loans.name: Moises Wilber

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SR. TANYANCANI”; La socia vive en el distrito de Ocongate en la provincia de Quispicanchis,  departamento del Cusco.

El socio Moises tiene 35 años de edad y el socio es conviviente, el socio tiene 3 hijos y él se dedica al trabajo de obras, el socio es albañil, el socio trabaja en construcción y obras en especial del municipio el socio también elabora adobes para construir casa y todo tipo de arreglos en sanitarios y vivienda, el socio trabaja para sacar adelante a su familia, el desea invertir el préstamo para comprar herramientas para su trabajo, el socio desea comprar martillo, serrucho, cincel, badilejo entre otras herramientas de trabajo. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de herramientas para el trabajo.  

El socio valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito otorgado ya que este le permite crecer con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Sr. Moises is a member of the Communal Bank “Sr. Tanyancani”. He lives in the District of Ocongate, Quispicanchis Province, Department of Cusco.

Moises is 35 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has three children. He works in construction as a mason, most notably on special projects commissioned by the city. Moises also makes adobe used in home construction. He performs all types of repairs to bathrooms and living rooms. Moises works in order for his family to get ahead. He wants to invest his loan in the purchase of tools for his job such as a hammer, saw, chisel, trowel, and other pieces of equipment to perform his work. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase these items for his job.

Moises values and greatly appreciates the loan that has been provided since it will allow him to grow his business and improve his quality of life. Therefore, he commits to completing his payments according to the stated terms.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita, de 52 años, es una mujer muy amble y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Elías de 58 años y sus 5 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad a la que se dedica Margarita es el alquiler de motocarros, todos los días desde muy temprano por la mañana, llegan jóvenes conductores quienes desean alquilar uno de sus motocarros para ganar un poco de dinero durante el día. Esta actividad le ha generado buenos ingresos, motivo por el cual desea continuar con este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que ayuda a las personas a generarse un ingreso alquilando su motocarro, lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que supervisar que los motocarros sean regresados en buen estado. Este será el séptimo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy respetada. Con los tres mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará repuestos para su motocarro, ya que por el uso algunas piezas se han deteriorado.
texts.en:
Margarita is 52 years old, and is a kind and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Elías, 58, and her five children who she wants to give a better quality of life.  

Margarita works renting three-wheeled vans every day.  Every morning, young drivers arrive who want to rent a three-wheeled van so that they can earn a little money during the day.  This work has generated a good income, so she wants to continue with this business.  The thing she likes best about her work is that she is helping others earn money by renting her vans.  She has been doing this work for two years.  She considers the most difficult thing is to have to make sure that the vans are returned in good condition.  

This will be her seventh loan with MFP, and she knows she has to make her payments on time, and she is ready to do so, since she doesn't want to cause problems with the members of her community bank, where she very respected.  

With the 3,000 nuevos soles that she is requesting, she will buy parts for her vans, since some of them have deteriorated with use.

loans.use: to purchase parts for her three-wheeled vans.

loans.name: Aidee

texts.es:
Aidée de 40 años es una mujer muy trabajadora, que vive en el municipio de Soledad con su cónyuge y tiene 5 hijos en las edades de 5 a 27 años. Desde hace 18 años, cuando recibió del estado nacional, la vivienda con la que actualmente cuenta, pues por causa de la erosión  había quedado damnificada,   decidió dedicarse a la venta de café y azúcar, aprovechando que su madre era conocida por trabajar en el mercado y un granero le financió sus primeras compras,  cuando la madre de Aidée desapareció, su negocio de vender plátanos quedó a su cargo, de aquí obtuvo su mayor experiencia. Posteriormente observando oportunidades de negocio en el barrio donde habita aun, y con tal de lograr un cuidado más cercano de sus obligaciones familiares, decidió ubicar un negocio de venta de alimentos,    pues los vecinos pasaban trabajo para preparar los almuerzos, porque no había gas y ellos trabajaban, fue así como se le ocurrió  ofrecer alimentos cocinando con leña; desde allí data su clientela, con los que poco a poco ha logrado un posicionamiento hasta el día de hoy, en el que cuenta con una mejor infraestructura y con un buen mercado de  amas de casa, empleados, trabajadores independientes, que son los consumidores de los  productos de fritanguera y almuerzos  que vende diariamente y de contado principalmente, aunque tiene unos pocos créditos. 
Su meta más adelante es hacer adecuaciones locativas, ubicando una terraza confortable protegida del sol y de la lluvia, para que sus clientes encuentren un refugio agradable y de descanso  en su punto comercial. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento y con el comprará en mayor volumen, insumos para la preparación de sus alimentos, pues su mayor desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para comprar de contado y en un importante volumen, que le permita sostener unos buenos inventarios y disminuir los costos del transporte.
texts.en:
Aidée, 40, is a very hard working woman living in the town of Soledad with her spouse.  She has five children ranging in ages from 5 to 27 years.  For the last 18 years, since she received the house she currently lives in from the national government because she was the victim of erosion, she decided to sell coffee and sugar taking advantage of the fact that her mother was known for working in the market.  A grainer financed her initial purchases.  When Aidée’s mother disappeared her banana selling business passed down to her and this is where she gained most of her experience.

Later on, noticing business opportunities in the neighborhood where she still lives and striving to be able to pay closer attention to her family obligations, she decided to set up a food selling business because it was difficult for her neighbors because there was no gas and they had to work so it occurred to her to offer prepared meals cooked over firewood.  Her clientele dates from back then and she has gradually gained position in the market until this day when she has better infrastructure and a good clientele composed of housewives, employees, independent workers who consume the fried fast food and lunches she prepares daily; most pay cash though she does have a few credit customers.

Her goal for later on is to do more adjustments to her locale installing a comfortable terrace that’s protected from the sun and the rain so that her customers can find a place of rest and pleasant refuge in her place of business.

Her Kiva loan is her first.  She will buy ingredients in larger amounts to prepare her meals because her greatest challenge is not having sufficient working capital to pay cash and in significant volume that will allow her to keep good stock inventory on hand and to diminish transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy meal preparation ingredients in larger amounts.

loans.name: 66 Thieu Do Group

texts.en:
Mrs Them works in agriculture, farming food. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattL. to raise and sell.

Them is 58 years old and is married with 1 child. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents.
Them is the group leader of the 66 Thieu Do solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

This is Them's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Them has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
Some of the most critical business difficulties that concern her are natural disasters and droughts.

With her business profit, Them hopes to buy land of her own, to be abL. to buy more supplies and equipment for her business and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old, widowed, and has two children. 

Rose works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional products to sell in her store. 

Rose has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending. 

Rose aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell in her store

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en: Dorothy is 27 year old woman, married, who has 2 children, aged four years old and one year old. She runs a general store in which she sells various items to the local people in Mombasa. She has been in this business and says that the business is profitable. The major challenges she has are financial constraints. She is using her loan of KES 20,000 to buy more general items to expand her business and meet the demands of her customers. In the future she hopes to diversify to a green grocery business. She describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, cooking oil, flour, etc,

loans.name: Justin

texts.en:
Justin is 44 years old and has been in the farming business for twenty years.  He currently produces milk which he sells to the local market.  He is married with one child who is in school.  

Justin has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to venture into the transportation business.  This is his second loan with Juhudi.  He says Juhudi's first loan helped him, and he remains optimistic that the transportation business will also be a success like his dairy business.

Justin notes that drought is the challenge to farmers in the area.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: For the last three years, Joseph has earned a living by running general store in the town of Kawangware. He is 30 years old, married and has two children. He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is a KADET client and is applying for his first loan, which he will use to buy sugar, rice, soap and other items to sell to his customers. In the future, he hopes to open a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers from his general store.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past four years she has operated a juice selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. Her major challenge is seasonality, especially during rainy season when the demand for fruit juice is lower compared to dry hot season. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fruits and fruit flavours. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fruits and fruit flavours.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca (plant fiber) weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and also earns an income from a sari-sari (variety) store. Lorelie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and the help of loans from NWTF

Lorelie is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy abaca weaving materials. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy abaca weaving materials

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Running a retail store for a daily profit of P200 is what occupies Maxima's daily schedule. She keeps generating income to provide a good education for her two children. She has six children. Four of them are married and now live independently. 

According to her, she has many competitors in the village who sell the same items as she sells so she needs to buy more grocery items for her store. She is now requesting a loan of P23,000 to buy items such as canned goods, bread, eggs, milk and sugar to sell. 

In the future, she would like to see her two children finish a degree and someday seek good employment and help lift their family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, bread, eggs, milk and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth, de 35 años es una mujer amable. Ella convive desde hace 5 años con, Yimi, su esposo. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Dayana y Celeste a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Acraquia. Todas las mañanas, desde los primeros rayos del sol. “Eli”, como la llaman de cariño, sale a cuidar a niños de 6 meses de nacido hasta 4 años edad. A los que cuida con mucho amor y responsabilidad, pues según afirma, ve en ellos a sus hijos. Le va muy bien en su trabajo, pues disfruta lo que hace y recibe una pensión mensual del estado, pues trabaja en un programa social denominado “wawa-wasi”. Además dedica sus tiempos libres en la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cerdos y cuyes; los que enseba para luego venderlos con un mayor precio, en las ferias que se realiza en la ciudad de Pampas. Ahora desea expandir su negocio y tener mejores ganancias, pues desea brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.  Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Acraquia” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su apoyo para concretar sus objetivos, además promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas, pues se caracteriza por ser cumplida. Elizabeth, de recibir su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de gallinas y cuyes para su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 35, is a kind woman. She’s lived with Yimi, her husband, for the last five years.  They have two children: Dayana and Celeste who they care for in their own house located in Anexo de Acraquia.  Every day at first light Eli, as she’s affectionately called, goes out to care for children between the ages of 6 months and 4 years.  She cares for them with much love and responsibility because as she states, she sees her own children in them.  She works in a program called “wawa-wasi.”  In addition, she spends her free time raising small farm animals like chickens, pigs and guinea pigs that she fattens up to then sell at higher prices because she wants to provide her family with a better quality of life.

She belongs to the “Acraquia” communal bank and this is the sixth MFP loan where she hopes to have your support to reach her goals.  She promises to be punctual with her installment payments since she’s noted for being very responsible with her commitments.  If Elizabeth were to get your support, she’ll invest the requested money in the purchase of chickens and guinea pigs for her business.

loans.use: to buy chickens and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Karen Indiana

texts.es: Karen Indiana tiene 32 años, es una mujer alegre y dinámica. La actividad que realiza es una tienda de ropa en un puesto ubicado en el mercado. Inicio con esfuerzo propio al no encontrar un trabajo decide establecer su propio negocio. Tiene 6 años dedicándose a esta actividad y en todo este tiempo el negocio le ha permitido tener un ingreso económico, que le facilita poder solventar los gastos de su hogar. Este sería el crédito número dos. Con el monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes para niños y calzado.
texts.en:
Karen Indiana is 32, and she is a cheerful and dynamic woman. She sells clothing from a stall in the market. 

She started it through her own efforts; as not finding a job, she decided to set up her own business. She has been working in this business for six years, and for all this time the business has allowed her to have an income, and enabled her to meet her household expenses. 

This would be her second loan. With the amount applied for, she will buy pants, shirts, skirts, children's clothing, and footwear.

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, skirts, children's clothing, and footwear.

loans.name: Dexterjay

texts.en:
Dexterjayr is a 18 years old farmer.  He just finished high school and could not enter college due to the financial problems of his parents. 

For this reason, he helps his father operate their farm.  Dexterjay is asking for a loan of P13,000 to buy inputs needed in their farm such as seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. 

He is hoping that, the loan and his efforts will generate more profits in the next harvesting season.  He hopes to use some of the funds for his studies and to benefit his siblings.  He dreams to become a police officer.  He strives with a content smile in his face.

loans.use: to buy inputs needed in their farm such as seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina is a 58 year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family (husband and three children). Her only son is a mason by profession, while her two daughters are involved in the sewing business. Their work is home based. All of her children contribute to the family financially from their earnings. 
Sakina’s days are focused on taking care of her family and managing her household work.  Her husband’s economic mainstay is selling animal skins. He supplies the animal skins to different factories which they use to make different products, like shoes and jackets, etc.  He has been operating his business for over 5 years and has had a good clientele. 

Sakina is requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. He will use the loan to purchase animal skins in larger quantity for re-selling.  She hopes that her husband will grow the business and improve the quality of services.  
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sakina”.

loans.use: To buy animal skins for re-selling

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Прошлый кредит Владимир использовал на постройку дополнительной теплицы. К сожалению, из-за того, что в прошлом сезоне помидоры созрели позднее ожидаемого срока и урожай запоздал, доход Владимира не увеличился и он был вынужден продавать овощи по более низкой цене. Наученный горьким опытом, Владимир планирует в этом году своевременно провести отопление в теплицах. Для этого ему и нужны дополнительные средства от КИВА. Владимир планирует провести 3 фазы и установить электрокотел на несколько теплиц.
В семье у Владимира все без изменений. Недавно в доме Владимир сделал пристройку для ванной комнаты, делает там ремонт.
Кроме огорода Владимир занимается торговлей кормами для животных, имеет дома хранилище для кормов.
texts.en:
Vladimir used the previous loan to build an additional greenhoues. Unfortunately due to the fact that last season the tomatoes ripened later than was expected and the harvest was late Vladimir's income has not increased and he was forced to sell vegetables at a lower price. Taught by bitter experience Vladimir is planning to install heating equipment in the greenhouses in time this year. To do this he needs additional funds from Kiva. Vladimir is planning to install a 3-phase and an electric boiler in several greenhouses.

There are no changes in Vladimir's family. Recently in his house Vladimir made ​​an addition for the bathroom and is doing repairs there.

In addition to the garden Vladimir is selling animal fodder and has a storage for that at home.

loans.use: to install heating equipment in the greenhouses.

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is 36 years old, a very active and efficient lady who performs her household tasks very well by staying at home. She is the mother of seven children, one of whom works, while the others are studying in a local school. Shahnaz is unable to provide education facilities for all of her children due to financial constraints.

Shahnaz's husband operates a horse cart through which he offers loading services to his clients and earns income for the family. He wants to buy a young horse because his horse has grown old and cannot run with heavy loading material on it.

Shahnaz has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah to help her husband in his business. She is hopeful that by purchasing a young horse, her husband will be able to run his business better, offering better quality loading services to his customers and increasing his profits.

loans.use: to buy a horse for her husband's loading business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Josephine is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools and gasoline for their motorcycle services.

Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and gasoline for her motorcycle service.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 51 years old and married with eleven children. Four of her children are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Sylvia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Sylvia has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from bicycle taxi.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cathrine would like to buy Packed Milk & Breads in large quantity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Jacinta intends to buy 400 poultry

loans.name: Mensan

texts.en:
Mrs. A. is 51 years old, married, and the mother of four children who are all married. She has two grandchildren in her care and both of them attend school. Her main business is corn and cassava agriculture, and she also makes “gari” (a food derived from the cassava root that is often eaten with beans) in order to sell.

Mrs. A. currently works 1 hectare of land that belonged to her father, and needs additional funding in order to be able to plant in the 3 other hectares available to her. She is asking for a $600 loan in order to be able to plant again next season and to increase her crop size, and she plans to repay the loan in 12-15 months. She was able to plant her first crop with the help of a loan from another microfinance institution that is no longer working in her area, and so she is grateful that Microfund Togo is now coming to help them.

As a child, Mrs. A. attended an English school in neighboring Ghana, but had to leave after elementary school since the money had run out. She currently lives in what was her father’s home with her two grandchildren since there is no one else there. With her increased crop and income, she is hoping to improve her health and to better care for the children that she cares for. Mrs. A. is a very hard-working woman, even at her age, and will be able to make good use of her loan.

loans.use: Mrs. Aziatroga would like to buy land to grow corn and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco T., 40, started his business 10 years ago. He works with his brother in making stones that are commonly used in Paraguay to build houses. By using a very efficient method of tying a horse onto a pole that is connected to a bucket of ingredients to mix, it saves a lot of time and labor for the brothers. Afterwards, the brothers take the mixture and place it into a mold that can make four stones each time. Then they lay the molded wet clay onto the ground for it to dry, which usually takes two days. The final process after it is dried is to fire it in a large kiln. Each day they make about 3000 stones.

Francisco and he´s brother are a hard workers; they work from 7 am until 5 pm everyday. Francisco and his brother have a stable group of clients in Carapegua that depend on them to supply the stones that are use in constructing houses. They are in need of a loan to purchase lumber for the kiln in order to fire the stones.

loans.use: Purchase lumber.

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar is 40 years old and a resident of Aghsu region, located in the central part of Azerbaijan. He has a shop where he sells fabric, textiles, curtains, etc. He has been in this business since 1994.

Yashar's business is going well but he wants to increase the variety of goods he sells. He has already taken out and repaid two loans from Normicro's Aghsu branch for his business needs. Now he is applying for a third loan, this time in the amount of US$ 1000, to expand the variety of inventory for his shop.

loans.use: To diversify his inventory

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha N. is 60 years old and widowed. She had 10 children but 6 have passed away. She takes care of 8 of her grandchildren.
Aisha has a produce stand where she sells matooke ( a kind of plantain, irish potatoes, tomatoes, onions, pumpkins, etc. She has had the stand for 10 years and has been in her lending group for 8 months. This is her second loan and with it she plans to buy more produce for her stand. Her dream is to be able to educate her grandchildren and to build a house for them. Aisha is a very friendly and well liked person with a wonderful sense of humor.

loans.use: Aisha plans to use her loan to buy more matooke, tomatoes, Irish potatoes, onions, etc. for her produce stand.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en: Mrs. Philomena K. is 48 years old and a widow.  She lives in Benin City where she sells drinks and fresh fish pepper soup.  She learned this business for six months and started her own in 1990.  She has been a LAPO member for 3 years and needs a loan of $275 to buy ingredients for preparing fresh fish pepper soup.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for preparing fresh fish pepper soup to sell

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Nguyễn Thị Thiết, 43, joined TYM fund in 2000. Her husband, Nguyễn Bá Hoàn, is an army officer. They have 2 children who are still attending school. Their house has a street front so Ms Thiết took advantage of it, she opened a grocery store in the front of her house. She feels comfortable with the weekly payment arrangement with TYM so she applied for a loan to invest in her grocery store. Since then, she has received multiple maximum loans from TYM. In total she has received almost 6000 USD in loans. Beside tending her grocery store, she also raises about a dozen of pigs, 100 chickens for meat and eggs. Her 2 children are studious, they have excellent results in school. Her son is attending the provincial vocational school, her daughter is one of the best student in the village. Ms Thiết is an examplary entrepreneur of the TYM branch which her group belongs to. Her wish is to continue participating TYM fund for years to come. This time she is requesting a loan of 950 USD to buy merchandise for her store.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thiết, 43 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ từ năm 2000. Chồng chị, anh Nguyễn Bá Hoàn, là một sỹ quan quân đội. Hai anh chị có hai cháu đang trong độ tuổi đi học. Nhà ở mặt đường nên chị Thiết sớm nắm bắt cơ hội mở cửa hàng kinh doanh tổng hợp tại nhà. Thấy cơ chế hoàn trả tuần của Quỹ Tình thương rất phù hợp với điều kiện gia đình nên chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn đầu tư. Chị Thiết là một trong những thành viên của xã nhiều vòng vốn vay tối đa của Quỹ, từ khi tham gia đến nay chị đã vay gần 6000USD. Ngoài bán hàng chị còn một mình chăn nuôi hàng chục con lợn, trăm con gà đẻ và gà thịt. Hai con của chị rất chăm ngoan và học giỏi, con trai đầu đang học trường chuyên của tỉnh, con út chị nhiều năm liền là học giỏi của huyện. Chị Thiết xứng đáng là tấm gương phụ nữ điển hình tiêu biểu của xã và chi nhánh, nguyện vọng của chị và gia đình là sẽ tham gia Quỹ lâu dài để tiếp tục vay vốn đầu tư dự án phát triển kinh tế. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 950USD để mua thêm hàng về bán.

loans.use: Buy goods for her grocery store

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.en:
María Teresa is forty-four years old, and she is the mother of five children.  María Teresa lives in Hortaliza community of Santo Domingo.
María explains that currently she needs funds to support her children's studies, and her husband’s salary (he is a policeman) is not enough to bear all the family’s expenses.  Therefore, she plans on starting a small cafeteria in her house.  She says she will sell fried food, spaghetti, sausage pork and natural juices.  María Teresa has a huge experience in food preparation, which will help her business be successful.
She is requesting a loan of $225 to purchase the necessary goods to start the cafeteria.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to start a small cafeteria.

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is 48 years old and is a married woman. Tatu owns a small charcoal store, which she started in 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $25 from her sales.

In the past, Tatu has taken out 1 successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a second loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Leoncia's Group

texts.es:
Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen have belonged to the Yanapanakusun Banco Comunal, which means "Let's help ourselves" in quechua, for 3, 5, and 3 years respectively.

Benjamina is a single mother, is 55 years old and has one daughter. She makes desserts and mazamorra (cornmeal porridge) and sells them in her daughter's restaurant.

Leoncia lives with her partner, is 45 years old and has 4 daughters. She sells children's clothing, backpacks and sombreros and depending on the location she sells in different fairs in the region and sometimes in some locations in the city.

Carmen lives with her partner, is 42 years old and has 3 children. She has a small business organizing events. She provides services such as decoration, the preparation of food, cakes and other services.

Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen need loans of 450, 450 and 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of milk, sugar, and eggs for making cakes, and backpacks, fabric and acrylics.

Benjamina, Leoncia and Carmen's dreams are for their family to be healthy and understanding, for their children to become professionals, to have their own home and for their stores to be successful.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen pertenecen al Banco Comunal Yanapanakusun que significa “Ayudémonos” en quechua, hace 3, 5, 3 años respectivamente.

Benjamina es madre soltera, tiene 55 años y 1 hija, Benjamina hace postres, mazamorras y lo vende en el restaurante de su hija.

Por otro lado Leoncia es conviviente, tiene 45 años y 4 hijas, Leoncia vende ropa de niños, mochilas, sombreros dependiendo de la campaña, sus ventas lo realiza en las diferentes ferias de la región y algunas veces alquila puestos en la ciudad.

Mientras que Carmen es conviviente, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Carmen tiene una pequeña empresa organizadora de eventos que brinda servicios de decoración de locales, elaboración de comida, tortas, entre otros servicios.

Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen necesitan préstamos de 450 soles, 450 soles, 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de leche, azúcar, huevo, mochilas, telas y acrílicos para tortas.

Los sueños de Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen son que su familia tengan buena salud y comprensión, sus hijos sean profesionales, tener casa propia y una tienda bien implementada.

loans.use: Benjamina, Leoncia y Carmen need loans of 450, 450 and 1500 soles, which will be invested in the purchase of milk, sugar, and eggs for making cakes, and backpacks, fabric and acrylics.

loans.name: Khom Tuy Group

texts.en: Mrs. Khom T. is the group leader of five members in Cham Bak Phém Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. A Khmer cake seller and farmer, she is 51 and a widow with four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others stay at home to help their mother sell Khmer cake in the village. In the dry season this year, Mrs. Khom T. hired a laborer to work on her rice plantation. She now does not have enough money to pay for the laborer, and is thus seeking a loan for this purpose. Previously, Mrs. Khom T. obtained a loan to buy fish to resell in order to support the family.

loans.use: To pay for a laborer hired to work on her rice plantation during dry season.

loans.name: Columba

texts.es:
Columba is an honest, hardworking, enterprising woman who is 63 years old. She started her own business because her husband did not earn enough income working as a security guard. She started out selling different products in order to help out with the household expenses. After her husband starting having heart problems and could no longer work, they decided to build some business spaces so that they could earn a living by renting them out.

It all started 20 years ago, when her husband’s friend offered them a plot of land near their home at a good price. Having their future in mind, they purchased it because her husband had been laid off due to his heart condition. They first built one business space, and with the money earned from renting it out, they started building more spaces one by one. They currently have 4 business spaces, but they need to give them some maintenance, such as a paint job, new flooring, replace old pipes, and install a new toilet and sink in one of the business spaces.

She needs a loan of $700.00 USD, which will be repaid in 6 months, so that she can remodel and give maintenance to her business spaces, as well as build a restroom in one of the spaces that needs it. With your help, Columba will get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Columba es una mujer de 63 años, honesta, trabajadora y emprendedora. Inició su negocio porqué el sueldo de su esposo no les alcanzaba ya que el trabajaba como vigilante, fue por eso que ella emprendió su negocio, primeramente en la venta de diferentes productos para ayudarlo con los gastos de la casa. Después su esposo enfermó del corazón y como ya no podía trabajar decidieron construir unos locales comerciales para vivir de la renta de los mismos.

Todo comenzó hace 20 años, un amigo de su esposo les ofreció en venta un terreno cerca de donde vivíamos en un buen precio, y pensando en el futuro lo adquirieron, ya que a su esposo lo habían liquidado de su trabajo por una enfermedad del corazón. Primero construyeron un local, y con la renta que cobraban del mismo fueron construyendo uno por uno y en la actualidad ya tienen 4 locales, pero necesita darles mantenimiento como pintura, ponerles piso nuevo, cambiar algunas tuberías que ya están viejas y además ponerle taza y lavabo nuevo a uno de los locales.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $ 700 que pagara en 6 meses que le permitirá remodelar y darle mantenimiento a los locales, así como construir el baño a uno de los locales que le hace falta. Con tu apoyo Columba saldrá adelante.

loans.use: Maintenance of business spaces

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun K., 35, takes care of her household, and lives in Siem Reap with her husband, Lenn Theat, and one of her children. Her husband travels around the community and sells firewood to a variety of businesses, making US$5 each day. Her child helps her husband with his firewood business, but they need to purchase two cows and a cart to aid with the transportation. Their current transportation is unreliable and they need to be able to depend on the business to support their family. Khun K. has asked CREDIT for a loan of US$700 to purchase these items for her husband, to help support her family. She believes that his investment can increase her daily income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: Purchase two cows and a cart for business transportation

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en: Mr. Tuy L. lives in Koh Prak Village in Kandal Province. He is a farmer who always cultivates twice a year. In the rainy season, he cultivates rice, while he grows vegetable (beans, cabbage, etc.) in the dry season. Nowadays, Mr. Tuy L. needs to grow rice because it is the rainy season; unfortunately, he does not have enough money to purchase rice seeds. Thus, Mr. Tuy L. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose, and he would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizer. His wife, Mrs. Sath Chea, helps him in the field. Mr. Tuy L. is 67 years old and the father of three children, one of whom is 35 years old and has been married already but still lives with Mr. Tuy L.. That child is employed in a garment factory while another one is a house constructor. The youngest one is attending high school. Mr. Tuy L., his wife and his granddaughter are shown in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase rice seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Koth

texts.en: Koth S., 36, is an entrepreneur who has businesses selling many kinds of food to the local people. She earns approximately $3 of profit per day. Her husband, Yoeun Nov, owns a plot of land for growing vegetables. On average, he sells the crops in the local market and is able to make around $3.50 per day. This couple has five children, one of whom sells used clothes at an open air market, three of whom are students and one other is married and no longer lives at home. Mrs. Koth is asking for a loan from of $200 to purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport vegetables to the market

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Greetings from Laurence in Kigali, Rwanda! Laurence is 36 years old, married with 4 children. 

Laurence owns a shop selling various items including bags of maize flour, cassava flour, beans, and bags of sugar. Besides that, she sells various fresh food items such as bananas, potatoes, etc. in her shop.

She is requesting a loan worth 515,000 Frws. The loan is to expand her stock and buy more food items for her growing clientele. The loan period is 8 months, repaid monthly.

loans.use: to increase her stock of foods for sale

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma M. has been selling clothes in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day and earns a profit of approximately $85 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more inventory for her shop and increase her sales and profit.

Fatma is 47 years old, married, and has six children, twins aged 10, and other children aged 11, 13, 14, and 20.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of six members, is located in Souben village in Takeo Province.  The members plan to use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Thy S. is the village bank president, selected by the members. He is 29 years old and the father of two children who are enrolled in the local school. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land where he cultivates both rice and vegetables to earn his living. His wife, Mrs. Kong Chrean, is a pig breeder. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, they decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding. They hope to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. 

All the members in this village bank loan have end-of-term loans, so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has an overall delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Marianela

texts.en:
Marianela is a member of the Bienestar (“Wellbeing”) Village Bank. She is 30 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their son. Marianela and her husband sell foodstuffs like rice, sugar, and oil. They buy the items in the Santa Rosa Market in the city of Ayacucho and bring them to the Ayacuchan jungle in her sister’s truck, where Marianela sells them wholesale to distributors. She has been in this business for three years now.

Marianela is requesting a loan of 3000 soles to buy more rice, sugar, and oil in bulk. Her goal for the future is to build a home of her own, using her FINCA savings. (She currently lives with her in-laws.)

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, and oil in bulk for re-sale to distributors

loans.name: Khushall

texts.en:
Khushall K. is a young uneducated man but he has lots of experience in a retail shop that he has been involved in for more than 10 years in Jalalabad. Before this he worked in agriculture. Now he has the responsibility for his family and for the last 10 years he has tried to enlarge his shop but he could not. When he found AFSG in Kabul he was really very happy and decided to apply for a loan.

He has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghans for the term of 12 months to enlarge his shop and further his business and make a good monthly income for his family.

Khushall wants to thank lenders around the world and thank Kiva and AFSG for this fantastic loan process. He would like to say, "In my time I still couldn’t find such a good program in Afghanistan. People were faced with lots of difficulty. I would love to see more success in this program in the future."

loans.use: Buying foods and some necessary things for his shop

loans.name: Mahkamboy

texts.en:
S. Mahkamboy is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of cultivated vegetables, which means that he can be around his family, helping to raise their quality of life and educate his three children. Mahkamboy has been characterized as a person who is hard working, since he has been working in agriculture since he was very young. This kind of work requires effort, dedication and above all, strength, as it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. In spite of this, Mahkamboy is determined to raise to the level of living in his family, and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help in order to be able to receive more credit from IMON International.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.
