These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Madame Oumou Dembélé est une femme mariée de 48 ans, mère de  6 enfants qui vit dans une famille nucléaire à Sanankoroba à 20  kilomètres de Bamako (la capitale du Mali).
Oumou Dembélé, comme  bien d’autres femmes de Sanankoroba, dans le souci d’alléger leur pauvreté, intégra le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Après  3 prêts solidaires tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son quatrième prêt individuel.
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 600  kilogrammes d’arachide, 250  kilogrammes de tubercules et divers articles sur le marché de Sanankoroba et environnants. Elle  effectue  sa vente au marché sur une étale, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle essentiellement composée de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  120. 000FCFA.. Ce bénéfice servira à rembourser les intérêts du prêt et contribuer aux dépenses de la famille
texts.en:
Mrs. Oumou Dembélé, age 48, is married and the mother of 6 children. She lives in a nuclear family in Sanankoroba, located 20 kilometers from Bamako, the capital of Mali. Like many other women eager to alleviate their poverty, Oumou Dembélé joined the loan program of Kiva's partner Soro Yiriwaso. After three solidarity loans (group loans) that were all repaid without problems, she's now seeking her fourth personal loan. She intends to use it to buy 600 kg of peanuts, 250 kg of yams, and various other items at the markets in Sanankoroba and in the surrounding villages. She sells her goods on a stall at the market, for cash or on credit, to a clientele comprising mostly women. She expects to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 120'000 (ca US$ 240), to be used to repay the loan and to help with the family expenses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts, yams, and various other items

loans.name: Bummi

texts.en: Bummi sells crates of drinks in retail to her customers. She needs the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She promises to pay back her loan promptly. Bummi is 44 years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Ms. S. is 49 years old and presently residing at Magsaysay, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed and blessed with two children - both are employed. Ms. S. is presently living with her mother-in-law. She is engaged in growing vegetables and corn as support to their income.

Ms. S. became a member of Paglaum in March 2001 followed by a sudden stoppage of membership when she tried an employment abroad. Now she’s requesting her 9th loan amounting to PHP 5,000. The loan is to be used as payment for labor in the preparation of land, for buying seedlings for the garden and for fertilizer.

Her hope and aspiration in life is to have an abundant harvest so that she can save for her future grandchildren.

loans.use: To pay for land preparation and to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Test

texts.en: dsa

loans.use: dsa

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa, 53 years old, is divorced and has three daughters of junior high and high school age. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. 

Yaa is a trader. She trades in textile materials - specifically, in printed and designed fabrics. She also deals in ready-made apparel. She hawks her wares in the neighborhood and also journeys to other towns to sell. Yaa procures her materials from Dormaa. She has been in business for over 20 years and hopes to obtain a loan to procure textile materials in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure textiles in bulk

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela B., 59, is from the village of Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Miguela is married and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Miguela owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector farming. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Miguela has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns ~1,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Miguela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Miguela is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for growing corn. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Miguela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business and to support her family's basic needs.
 
About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for growing corn

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi B. est conducteur de taxi moto à Womé. Âgé de 36 ans, koffi est marié et père d’un enfant. il exerce cette activité depuis 4 ans. Kodzo désire avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto et bailler le premier à une tiers personne contre des versements des mensualités. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses revenus et par conséquent améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Koffi B. is a motorbike taxi driver in Womé. He is 36 years old, married, and the father of one child. He has been in this business for four years. He would like to use this loan to buy a new motorbike and to rent out the old one to a third person for monthly deposits. This will enable him to augment his revenues and consequently to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
34-year-old Rosemarie M. has five children with her husband, Alexis Mellero. Her eldest child is a grade five student and her youngest child is five years old.

Rosemarie knew that she had to be hardworking to achieve her dreams of sending all her five children to school until college and to build a stable house someday. She knew that she had to have a business of her own since she has no one to depend on to sustain the needs of her children and to give them a better kind of living - eating regular meals with enough food and better clothing. Her husband, Alexis, understood where his wife's feelings were coming from because he is in prison.

Rosemarie, came from a very poor family. She wanted to have her own business if her children were not to experience the bitter experiences that poverty had given her. When ASHI came one day and knocked on her door, she embraced the opportunity of loaning to achieve her vision of having her own business.

Now, her loanable amount is bigger and she has more options to enhance her business of buying and selling first-aid medicines. For the loan she has applied for now, she will not only be changing her own family life but also the lives of poor families in their village. Her business gives people access to first-aid medicines and provides services such as checking their blood-pressure.

With all of the adversities caused by poverty, Rosemarie's hope is with the loans she can obtain from ASHI.

loans.use: To buy first-aid medicines to sell and a stethoscope

loans.name: Rey Micho

texts.en:
Rey Micho A. is from the village of Zone1B, del Carmen, Iligan City. He is 44 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. For a living, Rey Micho owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector--raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, raising pigs for sale is the primary source of income. Rey Micho has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6000.00 PHP a month.

Rey Micho joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services and help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rey Micho is requesting a loan of 5000.00 PHP which he will use to purchase additional animals. This will be his first loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to support the education of his children."

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. Based in Cagayan de Oro City, HSPFI is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional animals

location.town: Zone 1B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en:
Rutcel G., age 25, is from the town of Aloran. Rutcel is married. To make a living, Rutcel owns and operates a manicure and pedicure business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Rutcel is just starting this business.

In 2009, Rutcel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Rutcel is requesting a loan in the amount of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide services as well as to buy construction materials for their new house. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rutcel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide services as well as to buy construction materials for their new house

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy B. est une femme de 59 ans, elle est mariée et a la charge de 9 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Lyndiane-2-pont depuis 8 ans. C'est un membre très dynamique dans les activités de son groupe. Elle développe une activité de vente de produits halieutiques. Elle soutien son mari dans la prise en charge familiale. Elle rembourse son prêt globalement en une seule échéance en fin de cycle
texts.en:
Amy B. is a 59-year-old woman. She is married and has nine children to support. She has been a member of Banc Villageois de Lyndiane-2-pont for eight years and is a very energetic member in her group’s activities. She’s developing a business selling seafood products. She supports her husband in meeting family expenses. She’s repaying her loan over-all in a single payment at the end of the cycle.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her work in commerce

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: L. Célestine est née vers 1954 à Sakété. Elle est mariée à Robert, un chauffeur de la Cour Suprême à la retraite déjà. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Sègbèya à Cotonou, Capitale Économique  de la République du Bénin. Grâce au revenu de son activité, Célestine vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Célestine vend des ustensiles de cuisine (bassines, seaux, porte savon…), des divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.), de charbon de bois et de la pâte de maïs. Célestine achète ses articles à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin et les vend chez elle à domicile. Célestine est une ancienne cliente d’ALIDé qui rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour  augmenter le volume de son activité, Célestine demande de crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
L. Célestine was born around 1954 in Sakété.  She is married to Robert, an already-retired chauffeur of the Supreme Court.  The couple have three children, who are all in school.  Two of them are still in their care.  The family lives in Sègbèya in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  Thanks to the revenues from her business, Célestine comes to the aid of her husband in regards to family expenses.  She sells kitchen utensils (basins, buckets, soap dishes,...); and various items, such as candy, cookies, canned foods (milk, sardines, tomatoes), sugar, pasta, soaps for the laundry, dishes, and bath, batteries, and candles; and charcoal; and pâte de maïs (a kind of boiled polenta).  Célestine purchases her goods at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin. And she sells them out of her home.  She is a former Alidé client who indeed repays her loans.  To increase her business volume, she is asking for a loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and charcoal

loans.name: Frajarata

texts.en:
Frajarata A. is currently in the business of selling beans, beer, and sugar at home and is requesting a loan to open up a shop at the nearby market. Frajarata is 30 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop for selling bags of sugar.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Opening up a shop at the nearby market

loans.name: Flor America

texts.es:
El banco comunal Alianza Unida se encuentra en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad  es reconocida por sus escritores y artistas así como por  su belleza arquitectónica, además tiene paisajes muy hermosos por su geografía accidentada su clima frió  contrasta con el calor de su gente amable y cordial como nuestras socias. 

La señora  Flor V. vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca, es socia activa del  banco comunal Alianza Unida, tiene 41 años de edad esta casada y tiene tres hijos de 23, 21, 15 años de edad, su hijo mayor ya trabaja y le ayuda con el pago del servicio de energía  eléctrica, el segundo estudia en la Universidad Católica de Cuenca y su ultimo hijo en el Instituto IEISA,  mantienen una buena relación intrafamiliar;   tienen casa propia pero no viven en ella pues les queda muy lejos de su trabajo y colegio por lo que viven arrendando. 

Flor es comerciante desde hace cinco años tiene un puesto de audio y video  (vende cd de toda clase de música y películas) en un local arrendado, nos cuenta que  esta temporada se encuentra un poco bajo el  negocio pero está segura que pronto va  a mejor.  
 
Flor lleva ocho años trabajando con la fundación y nos comenta que los créditos le han  permitido incrementar su negocio,  con el préstamo que la FUNDACION ESPOIR le entregue lo va a invertir en la compra de películas, videos musicales, videos didacticos, etc. para abastecer su negocio con mercadería para niños y adultos.

Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The Alianza Unida Communal Bank is located in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its writers and artists as well as for it beautiful architecture. It also has beautiful scenery and an uneven terrain. Its cold climate contrasts with the warmth of the kind and cordial people like our members. Flor V. lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. She is an active member of the Alianza Unida Communal Bank. She is 41, married, and has three children. They are 23, 21, and 15. Her oldest son works and helps with the electricity payments. The second child attends the Catholic University of Cuenca. Her last child goes to the Instituto IEISA. They maintain a good family relationship with each other. They have their own house, but they do not live in it because it is very far from their work and school. They live in a rented house. Flor has been a business person for five years. She has an audio and video stand (she sells CDs and all types of music and movies), which is in a rented location. She tells us that this season business is down a bit, but she is sure that it will soon improve. Flor has been working with the Foundation for eight years. She tells us that the loans have allowed her to increase her business. With this loan from the ESPOIR Foundation she will buy movies, musical videos, and educational videos, etc. to stock her business with merchandise for children and adults. Her greatest dream is to see her children become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy movies, musical videos, and educational videos,  for children and adults

loans.name: Kanoumafin Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kanoumafin est composé de six femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 52 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Bamanan kin de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des relations de voisinage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes du quartier. 
Les membres du groupe Kanoumafin exercent le commerce d’articles divers tels la vente des produits cosmétiques, de pagnes  wax, de céréales, de savons, de parfums,  d’habits  pour enfants etc.
Après avoir bien remboursé les quatre prêts précédents, ce groupe est à son cinquième prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.
Elles comptent utiliser leur prêt pour acheter, 5 sacs de riz, 3 sacs de niébé, 10 sacs de fonio, 70 pièces de pagnes wax et un rouleau de bazin (à teinter avant d’être vendu). Elles se ravitaillent en céréales à Koutiala, en pagnes wax et bazins au grand marché de Bamako. Les produits sont revendus au comptant et à crédit dans les foires de Dougabougou, Sibila, Siribala, Boussin et Diamarabougou à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 53 000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé dans leurs activités et pour l’achat petit à petit des trousseaux de mariage pour leurs filles. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’entretenir leur collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’augmenter le plus que possible le volume de leurs activités en épargnant et en contractant le plus de prêts.
texts.en:
The Kanoumafin group is composed of six married women who mainly live in monogamous households, and are on average 52 years old with 4 children. They all live in the Bamanan district of Markala (4th administrative region of Mali), and know each other through neighbourhood relations and their membership in the same traditional women's association in the area. The members of Kanoumafin group run businesses selling various items such as cosmetics, pagnes wax (a type of brightly-printed West African cloth), cereals, soap, perfumes, children's clothing, etc. After having repaid their four previous loans properly, this group is working on their fifth solidarity (group) loan through Soro Yiriwaso (one of Kiva's field partners). The intend to use their loan to buy 5 bags of rice, 3 bags of niebe beans, 10 bags of fonio (a type of grain), 70 pieces of pagnes wax, and a roll of damask (to be dyed before selling). They obtain their supplies of cereals in Koutiala, and their pagnes wax and damask at the grand market in Bamako. The products are sold in cash or on credit at the fairs in Dougabougou, Sibila, Siribala, Boussin, and Diamarabougou to a mixed clientele. They foresee making an average monthly profit of 53,000 FCFA, which will be used for their business and to buy piece by piece their daughters' wedding trousseaus. Their goal is to maintain their collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase as much as possible the size of their businesses by saving and obtaining further loans.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various items for resale

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: Maria Eugenia García S. tiene la edad de 23 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica esta actividad. Ella dio inicio con muy poca mercadería, ella ofrecía ropa interior a ella siempre la ha caracterizado por el espíritu luchador y las ganas de salir adelante. En la actualidad ella continúa con este negocio, ya que es su único medio de trabajo y disfruta mucho el conversar con sus clientes. A pesar de las dificultades que enfrento como es el tiempo por lo que tiene que buscar sus productos en donde se encuentran mucho mas favorable.
texts.en:
Maria Eugenia García S. is 23 years old. She has been selling cosmetics for five years. She started selling lingerie with very few supplies. But she is a fighter and wants to succeed. Today, she continues selling cosmetics, her only means of income, and enjoys chatting with her customers. She has endured many difficulties and because of this, she has to find products in ways that are more favorable for her.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Soba Soba Nambozo Sulaina Group

texts.en:
N. Sulaina is forty-five years old and is married with eight children, all schooling. More so, she looks after four orphans who are all schooling, too.

Sulaina operates a shop which she has been running for eight years. She is using the loan to add stock to her shop. She will purchase retail items such as drinks, soap, sodas, sugar, and so forth.

Sulaina is a hardworking businesswoman whose dream is to lift her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her shop

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana is an entrepreneur who lives in Novaya Kahovka. She sells clothing in a small store and in some other local markets. She has been in this business for five years and is a serious and skilled business owner. Her perseverance, combined with the lending assistance she has received, have allowed her to gradually expand her business. Presently, Svetlana’s working capital has grown to 30,000 Grivnyas and her net profit amount to 6,000 Grivnyas a month. 

There are many vendors and competition in clothing sales is high. However, Svetlana’s pleasant manner and willingness to meet clients’ needs have helped her keep loyal clientele. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to buy an assortment of clothing in bulk to sell in her store. Her sense of responsibility, stable business growth and prompt payment record convince us that she is highly capable of repaying this loan.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise

loans.name: Milda

texts.es: Milda tiene  32 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la fabricación de tejas y ladrillos  en los terrenos que arrienda con  su esposo; ellos mismos extraen la tierra arcillosa que es la materia  prima básica  en la fabricación, también se abastece de los materiales indispensables para realizar este trabajo, es de esta manera que siempre trabaja  todo el día para aumentar su producción, las mejores épocas de rentabilidad son durante el  verano, y cuando bajan las ventas es durante el invierno. Tiene planes de incrementar la extensión de su fábrica  para tener mayor producción.Es la cuarta oportunidad que  tiene un crédito con  MFP, y  ha demostrado ser una las mejores socias más emprendedoras de su  banco comunal.El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de  aserrín para aumentar de esta manera la producción de fabricación de ladrillos y tejas.
texts.en:
Milda, 32, lives with her husband and three children in her own home. For the last 4 years she has manufactured roof tiles and bricks on land that she and her husband lease. They, themselves, extract the clayey soil which is the prime ingredient in manufacture of their products and they stock up on the other indispensable materials needed for their work. This is the manner in which she works all day to increase production. Summer is her best selling season and Winter is when sales drop the most. She aims to enlarge her factory. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has proven to be one of her communal bank's most enterprising members. The funds will be used to buy sawdust which will be used to increase roof tile and brick production.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sawdust.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorbike taxi

loans.name: Kimhiv

texts.en:
Mrs. Kimhiv N. is 60 years old and lives in Popeal Khae village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Vit Loem, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate rice to support their family living.

In the rice field, they have a problem because it is time to harvest the rice but they do not have money to support it. Thus, Mrs. Kimhiv N. decided to apply for a loan to hire some laborers to harvest her rice.

Mrs. Kimhiv N. is the mother of three children who are attending the local public school. Her husband is shown on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest her rice

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario Rodríguez Ramírez esta preocupado por el bienestar de su familia con ahorros propios construyo su vivienda. El señor es padres de 5 hijos y una de sus hijas es madre soltera en la que sigue apoyando moralmente; es por ello que quiere construir una recamara en la parte de arriba de su casa para que tenga privacidad junto con su hijo pequeño. Mario y su hija son las personas que trabajan ya que la esposa se queda a cargo de sus demás hijos para darles mejor atención. 
Mario es una persona que desea darle lo mejor a sus hijos es por ello que pide el apoyo para poder realizar su proyecto y seguir ayudando a su hija.
texts.en:
Mario Rodríguez Ramírez cares about his family's wellbeing. He used his own savings to build his house. He is the father of 5 children and one of his daughters is a single mother, to whom he continues to offer moral support. For this reason, he wants to build a bedroom on the top of his house so that she and her small son can have privacy. Mario and his daughter are the members of the family that work because his wife says home to care for the rest of the children. Mario is a person who wants the best for his children and asks for this help to complete this project so that he can continue to help his daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bedroom for his daughter.

loans.name: Navy

texts.en: Mrs. Navy T. is 44 years old and a villager who lives in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. She is a vegetable and baby clam seller who earns a small income to support her family. Her husband is a government worker receiving a small salary to help his family. This couple does not earn enough income from their different businesses to support their family; thus, Mrs. Navy T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. This couple has four children: one is a government worker while the other three are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Sonia Verónica

texts.es: Sonia X., soletera de 25 años de edad, vive con su hermana gemela. Ella se dedica a elaborar y vender güipiles tipicos, trabaja medio tiempo en el sanatorio de la comunidad como Enfermera Auxiliar, siempre ayuda a la comunidad prestando sus servicios cuando pacientes o vecinos solicitan de sus servicios. Sonia solicita el crédito para la compra de cortes, fajas y blusas típicas y asi poder poner una tienda de trajes típicos, y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias y la oportunidad de tener una vida mejor al lado de su hermana.
texts.en:
Sonia Xicayl is 25 years old and single. She lives with her twin sister. She makes and sells huipils (traditional Guatemalan blouses). She works half time in the community sanatorium as an auxiliary nurse. She always helps the community, lending her services when patients or neighbors ask for them. Sonia is applying for the loan to buy fabric, sashes, and typical blouses so that she can set up a shop of typical clothing and thus be able to have better earnings and the opportunity to have a better life at the side of her sister.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in merchandise for a shop selling typical clothing

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 45 years old and married with six children who go to school. He has been running a laundry shop to earn a living. He has been in this business for 10 years and has two employees. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has benefited by saving his money with his fellow members of the Pendano group. He can easily be guaranteed with the members if he takes a loan. He had previously taken out two loans from Faulu Kenya, a Kiva partner, which he used to expand his business and successfully repaid. He hopes to grow his business and open outlets with modern equipment.  

He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Faulu Kenya to buy washing detergents, an iron box, a water tank and a generator.

loans.use: To buy detergents, an iron box, water tanks and a generator

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo.
Julia es soltera, tiene 67 años y 2 hijos, Julia viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa y de las ferias compra animales, la carne lo vende de casa en casa. Además Julia hace 3 meses implemento una tienda de abarrotes y le esta yendo muy bien.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerveza, azúcar, arroz, golosinas.
Los sueños de Julia son que sus hijos progresen y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Triunfo Communal Bank.

Julia is single, is 67 years old and has two children. She travels to different markets in the region where she sells clothing and she also buys animals whose meat she sells door to door. Three months ago, Julia started a grocery store and it is going very well.

Julia needs a loan of 2000 soles, money that will be used to buy beer, sugar, rice and candy.

Julia’s dreams are that her children progress and to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer, sugar, rice and candy.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 42 years old and married to a teacher. She sells household goods, both in wholesale and retail. She was previously employed as a teacher before she started her business. 

She mainly earns her income by knitting sweaters and scarves. She gets her orders from schools. She joined Vision Corner self help group with Faulu Kenya, in order to access capital more easily. This is because the group members guarantee each other loans. So far, she has managed to service one loan from Faulu Kenya. She has applied for another loan, worth Kes. 40,000, from Faulu Kenya. She plans to buy knitting yarn, materials and accessories for knitting sweaters and scarves. She hopes to improve her business and create employment for the youth.

loans.use: To buy knitting yarn, materials and accessories

loans.name: Mame Diarra Bousso

texts.fr: Madame Mame Diarra Bousso Ndiayeest commerçante de chaussures, sacs et autres depuis 1989.  Elle s'approvisionne en république de la Gambie et place ses produits à ses clients qui réglent à la fi de chaque mois. Cette femme divorcée compte sur son seul business pour satisfaire ses besoins. Elle souhaitait cependant un prêt de 150 000 FCFA pour mener à bien ses activités.
texts.en:
Madam Mame Diarra Bousso N. has been trading in shoes,bags and other items since 1989. She gets her supplies from the Republic of Gambia and gives her products to her customers who pay at the end of the month. This divorced woman counts on her only business to meet her needs. She wants a loan of 150 000FCFA to operate well her business.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To get her supplies

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 53-year-old married man from Lebanon who is the father of seven children. He runs a taxi business and has over 28 years of experience as a driver. In Lebanon, it is common to use taxi services to go between neighborhoods in a given town as well as to travel between different regions. These services are especially important in areas where the infrastructure is less developed, which is true for most of the towns outside of Beirut and its suburbs. 

Today, Hassan is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a new car for his business. His previous loan allowed him to perform much- needed maintenance work on his taxi’s engine and body so that he could continue to offer comfortable transportation service to his customers.

loans.use: To buy a new car for his taxi business.

loans.name: Paulo

texts.pt:
Paulo Sembanhe vive em Boane, província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique. No empréstimo passado conseguiu canalizar para o que esteve previsto e também foi suficiente. Conseguiu pagar a sua letra segundo o calendário estabelecido.
A sua obra esta decorrendo bem e com o presente empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, chapas de zinco, barrotes e outros) para concluir a sua obra. 
O empréstimo foi satisfatório, esta conseguindo alcançar o objectivo que preconizou. Pretende solicitar mais crédito para iniciar com actividade de criação de aves para venda.
texts.en:
Paulo Sembanhe lives in Boane, Maputo Province, southern Mozambique. With the past loan he managed to achieve the planned results and to make sure that it was enough. He also managed to pay back according to the schedule. His construction work is proceeding well and with this loan of 20.000.00mt he wants to buy more construction material (cement, zinc plates, beams and other) to complete the work. He is very pleased with the loan, that is allowing him to achieve his goals as planned. He intends to request an additional loan to start a new business and breed birds for sale.

Translated from Portuguese by Monica Urban, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction material (cement, zinc plates, beams and other)

loans.name: Seom

texts.en: Seom N., 31, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. N. raises pigs at home, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a farmer, growing rice for an income of USD 3 each per day. N. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase a plot of farmland to improve the farming business. In the future, she would like to use aN. additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Reun

texts.en:
Mr. Reun K., 57 (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Mrs. Sokha Long, 56, live in a village along National Road Number one, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1980 and have seven children - four sons and three daughters. Three of them are married and live in separate homes, two are security guards, and the other two are garment factory workers.
 
Reun has been a motor taxi driver since 1990. His wife sells porridge in the village. He is requesting his first loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for his children to drive to work. He also will use a part of the loan to repair the house where he lives.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his children to drive to work and repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Sonnie J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Faith. Sonnie is 36 years old, married, and has five children who range from 20 to 8 years old. She was not able to attend school due to poverty. All of her children are attending school. For 3 years, she has been selling oil, salt, tomatoes, and peppers in New Georgia Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 5,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 25,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more oil, salt, tomatoes, and peppers. She describes herself as determined. Her dream is to grow her business, build a house, and continue to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more oil, salt, tomatoes and peppers

loans.name: Lasoi

texts.en: Lasoi is a farmer who has farmed her own piece of land for the last ten years. She learned about KADET from other women who are already registered members. This will be her second loan, thirty thousands shillings, to prepare the land for planting potatoes, which normally do well in her area due to good climatic conditions. She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. Lasoi's dream is to build a nice house and see her people advance academically. She is a hard-working woman who, with financial support,  can achieve a lot.

loans.use: to prepare land for planting potatoes.

loans.name: Chrin's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people.  Chrin N., 35, is its leader. They all live in Svay Prey village, Kandal province.  Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Chrin is a widow with a child, who is a rice farmer and seamstress in a garment factory.  She is asking for a loan from AMK to buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for laborers to plow her field.  Chrin is able to earn a small income to improve her family.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, pesticide and to pay for laborer to plow her farm.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
This is Fe B., 46, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Erlito Jose B. and mother to four young hard working adults. One is working and helping out with the household finances, while the others are still in college. By the grace of God, Fe has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their every day expenses.

Fe operates a variety store where, during the evenings, she also sells bar-b-qued food. She also does direct selling of frozen cuts of meat and native meat delicacies. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go for to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies in wholesale price and selling in piece rate.  Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php11, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She will also invest a portion of her loan to buy meat, spices, sauce and firewood for her barbecues. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Fe dreams of being able to renovate her house soon, with all of her work with the business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy products like groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory and meat, spices, sauce and firewood for her barbecues

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: He wants to complete his stock

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma L. is from the village of Puntod Lopez Jaena. She is 36 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Alma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Alma has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Alma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC which was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Alma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. This will be the fourth loan that Alma has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and provide working capital

loans.name: Nub

texts.en: Nub S., 41, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia — an area known for pre-angkorean temples. S. is a farmer earning an income of about USD 0.5 each a day. Her husband is a driver, earning an income of USD 1 a day. Two of her children are factory workers, earning an income of USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. S. has to spend USD 50 on food, USD 5 on electricity and water supplies, and USD 70 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase fruit to sell in front of the factory in the city. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es: Alfredo, de 54 años, se separó de su mujer hace 10 años. Pero a pesar de los inconvenientes que tiene, recibe el cariño y comprensión de su hija Sherly, de 16 años. En unión familiar ellos viven, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Desde que era niño sus padres le enseñaron a tejer, y como herencia familiar el continuó tejiendo hermosos tapices y carteras; que durante muchos años adornaron el taller de sus padres. Pero después de la muerte de ellos, quedaron a su cargo, hoy comercializa este trabajo artesanal en las ferias textiles del país. Por otro lado, trabaja también en el municipio de su localidad, limpiando pisos y ventanas, trabajo que le ayuda a generar otros ingresos, ya que mensualmente tienen que enviar a su hija una suma considerable de dinero para que pague sus estudios universitarios. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, y a pesar del poco tiempo que dispone, asiste puntualmente a las reuniones con su banco comunal, en donde se siente feliz y desarrollado. Con el crédito que recibirá, lo invertirá en la compra de varios hilos para tejer, así como también comprará, calzador; con los que podrá alinear los hilos.
texts.en: Alfredo, 54 years old, separated from his wife 10 years ago. In spite of his current inconveniences, he receives the affection and understanding of his daughter Sherly who is 16 years old. They live together in their own house located in the town of San Pedro de Cajas.  Alfredo’s parents taught him how to weave since he was a kid, and as his family legacy, he continued weaving beautiful tapestries and handbags that decorated his parent’s workshop for many years. After the death of his parents, all the handicrafts remained under his responsibility; he now commercializes the handicrafts in the country’s textile fairs. On the other hand, he also works cleaning floors and windows in local municipality; this work allows him to have additional income since he has to send his daughter a considerable amount of money every month for her college education. This is the fifth loan with MFP and, in spite of his limited free time, he is punctual when attending the meetings of his community bank where he feels happy and fulfilled. He will invest the loan in buying assorted threads to weave, and tools to align the threads.

loans.use: Buy threads and tools to align the threads

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Villa Jazmín de la cuidad de Tobati que dista a 17 km de la oficina regional Caacupé.

Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida y la de sus hijos.
Las señoras  están en el ciclo Nº  1º con sus 10 integrantes. 

Una de las integrantes es la señora Cándida quien se dedica a la elaboración de comestibles.
Ella cocina para varios empleados de varias fábricas de la zona.
Comenta que cuenta con varios proyectos para mejorar su vivienda y asi tener mejores comidas para su ella y su familia para lo que solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
The women of this group are from Villa Jazmín, a neighborhood in the city of Tobati which is 17 km from the regional office in Caacupé.

The women are very happy with the economic support provided by Fundación Paraguaya.  With their loan capital, the women of this group will improve their small businesses and in doing so their income streams so that they can better their lives and those of their children. 

The women are in their first cycle, and their group has 10 members. 

One of the members is Mrs. Cándida, who specializes in the preparation of food for sale.  She cooks for various employees of manufacturing plants in the area. She has numerous projects to improve her house as well as improve the foods she prepares for herself and her family.  It is for this reason that she has asked for the loan.

loans.use: Expenses for Home Improvement

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señorita. Mayra C. es socia del banco comunal Atenas, vive por el sector del Carmen de Sinincay en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad realizando varias actividades.
 
La Señorita Mayra tiene 18 años de edad, es soltera, su papá labora como empleado privado y su mamá trabaja elaborando guaipe (tela para limpiar), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.
 
Nuestra socia estudia en el colegio y va por el último año de bachillerato, es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y con el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela para la fabricación de guaipe y comenzar en esta actividad.
 
Su meta es ponerse un local de cabinas telefónicas y también brindar el servicio de Internet.
texts.en: Miss Mayra C. is a member of the Atenas community bank. She lives in the El Carmen de Sinicay sector, where the people work in agriculture and a great part of the population works various jobs in the city. Mayra is 18 and single. Her father works as a private employee and her mother makes guaipe (cleaning cloths). They do not have their own home because they live in the home of a family member. She studies in university and is in her final year of a bachelor's degree. This is her first loan with the community bank and with the money she will invest in the purchase of fabric for making guaipe and start this work. Her goal is to open a telephone booth business and also offer an internet service.

loans.use: to purchase fabric

loans.name: Emiliana Amalia

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana vive en casa propia  ya que su papa le heredo un pequeño terrenito para que construya su casita como ella quiera y lo hizo así sacando prestamos del banco ahora ella vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Ahora tienen un taller de costura, son conocidos y tienen un contrato con una empresa de chamarras quienes les dan todo cortado y ellos lo costuran, así fueron creciendo poco a poco comenzaron con dos maquinas y actualmente cuentan con siete.

Como segunda actividad la Sra. Emiliana se dedica a la transcripción ya que este es un ingreso mas para poder pagar sus deudas. El crédito que solicitaron es para poder comprar una fotocopiadora ya que su hermano tiene un internet y muchos preguntan si ahí fotocopian viendo la necesidad de las personas que viven por la zona tomaron la decisión de comprar una maquina de fotocopiar así tener otro ingreso mas para poder subsistir, agradecieron mucho por el crédito que se otorgo.		

En la foto, la señora sale en su taller de costura
texts.en:
Emiliana lives in a house that she owns, as she inherited a small piece of land from her father to build her house as she wished.  She constructed her house taking out loans from the bank and now lives with her husband and young son.  They now have a sewing workshop, are well-known, and have a contract with a jacket company that gives them everything cut and they sew it.  This is how they grew little by little.  They began with two machines and currently have seven.  

As a second job, Emiliana works in transcription, as it is another form of income to be able to pay her debts.  The loan that they requested is to be able to purchase a photocopier since her brother has an internet café and many people ask if they photocopy there.  Seeing the demand of the people that live in the area, they made the decision to purchase a photocopying machine to have another source of income to be able to survive.  They are very appreciative of the loan granted.			

Emiliana is pictured in her sewing workshop.

loans.use: Purchase of a photocopier

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en: Mrs. Sambo Y. has a full-time job in a hotel in Phnom Penh, and her husband works as a teacher. She owns one motorbike (which we see in the photo) which her husband uses to drive to school everyday. She is applying for her first loan, for $600, to buy a second motorbike for her own commute. The family lives about 13 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. They have been married since 1998 and have two daughters, both of whom are in school.

loans.use: To buy a second motorbike to use to commute to work.

loans.name: Brigido

texts.es:
Don Brigido, de 54 años de edad, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, vive en este lugar junto a su esposa María Ángela y sus hijos Bernardo de 17 años, José de 15 años, Julia de 13, Elsa de 11, Amelia de 9 y Marta de 7 años de edad, todos son dependientes.
Don Brigido trabaja en la agricultura y crianza de cerdos, es muy reconocido en la comunidad, es honrado y muy trabajador, sus oficios los realiza desde hace 20 años, como herencia de sus padres quienes le enseñaron el proceso agrícola perfectamente y es el que hoy día mantiene a su familia. Él está solicitando un préstamo para comprar cerdos y para la recolección y almacenamiento de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), con esta inversión espera mejorar su comercialización de cerdos y recibir más ganancias.
Las aspiraciones de don Brigido es que a través de su trabajo las condiciones de vida de su familia sean mejores cada día.
texts.en:
54-year old Sr. Brigido lives in Corinto in the department of Morazán with his wife María Ángela and their children Bernardo (17), José (15), Julia (13), Elsa (11), Amelia (9) and Marta (7), all of whom he still supports.

Sr. Brigido is a farmer and raises pigs. He is well-known in the community; he is well-respected and works hard. He has been doing this work for 20 years, having inherited the business from his parents who taught him how to farm. Nowadays he supports his family on the income. 

He is seeking a loan to buy pigs and to get help with the harvest and storage of his crops (corn and beans). Through this investment Brigido expects to improve his farm and earn more money.

He hopes that through his hard work, he will gradually be able to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pigs and pay workers to help at harvest time

loans.name: Prudencia

texts.en:
Prudencia is a 53-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a pig-fattening business.  She lives in the municipality of Oslob, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig-fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,500. Prudencia is now borrowing PHP 19,500 to purchase feed for her pigs.  This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Prudencia aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ochirpurev

texts.en: Ochirpurev B. is 32 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school.  They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Ochirpurev is a taxi driver and his wife is a beautician. Since 2006 Ochirpurev has been running a taxi business, which is the family’s only source of income at the moment. Ochirpurev owns a plot of land and a small wooden house on it. The house needs some refurbishment.  When winter is over, Ochirpurev wants to do some renovation to the house. He is requesting a loan to purchase cement, wood planks, paints, and wallpaper.

loans.use: To purchase building materials to renovate the family house

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn G., 28, continually ventures into selling various kinds of products in order to make her business thrive. Although Analyn only has high school education, she is ever determined to succeed in life. She is married to William, a taxi driver, and they have a child who attends elementary school. They used to live in Naga City in the lower part of Luzon, but now they live in Caloocan City, Metro Manila.

Direct selling is one source of income for Analyn. She distributes catalogs of famous beauty brands in her community, gets orders from friends and neighbors, buys these orders from the sales office, and delivers them to customers for a commission. However, her focus as of the moment is selling corn near their community in Kiko, Camarin. She has been selling corn for six years and is able to earn PHP 7,280 monthly.

To help her continue operating her businesses, Analyn is requesting a PHP 26,000 loan. She will use this money to buy essential ingredients to sell corn, such as corn, sugar, and margarine. She also plans to expand her business by selling other nutritious food such as sweet potatoes, peanuts, Indian mangoes, and bananas. The loan will benefit her greatly as it serves as the finances to sustain such business ventures.

Vacations are difficult for Analyn's business, as they are to other micro-entrepreneurs' businesses, since there are fewer customers. Nevertheless, Analyn works hard to make sure she helps her family with its daily needs. She continually looks for innovations or expansion in her business, because the bottom line is that she wants to become successful.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase essential ingredients for corn selling

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, Hellen has operated a beauty salon; she works at the market, with ladies being her potential customers. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Hellen decided to work with Yehu to access loans to raise her living standards. With a 20,000 KES loan she she wants to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves. She dreams of owning a well-furnished beauty salon shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and hair weaves

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa S. is married and has four children. In order to supplement the income of her husband, who works with Zoomlion, a waste management company,Yaa prepares and sells kenkey, a popular Ghanaian dish made from fermented corn dough. Kenkey is usually served with pepper sauce and fried fish. Yaa would like to grow her business, and a loan from Kiva will allow her to purchase more corn and oil to increase her food production. She wants to save up enough to pay for her children’s tertiary education.

In the photo, Yaa is showing the soaked maize she uses for corn dough to prepare the kenkey.

loans.use: to purchase more corn and oil to increase her food production.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy G. is 52 years old and married. She has four children, with one in school. Nancy works very hard to provide for them.

Nancy runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. Nancy has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as diapers, bread, canned goods and other miscellaneous items.  

She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock for her store to sell.

In the future Nancy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Madina

texts.fr:
Madame Madina est âgée de 39 ans, a 5 enfants et vit  dans une famille nucléaire avec son mari et ses enfants au camp militaire de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença tôt à faire le commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses côtés, elle finit par évoluer seul pour faire le commerce d’habits confectionnés dans le pays Dogon et la préparation vente de jus de fruits et de glace. Elle mène cette activité depuis 5 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. 
Dans le souci de faire de face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait   recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui, elle est en relation depuis 66 mois. Après 10 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel tous  correctement remboursés, elle est à son 2ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 1 congélateur. Elle s’approvisionne sur place à Ségou. Madame Madina vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 100 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra de contribuer pour les dépenses familiales et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. Madina is 39 years old. She has five children and lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children in the military camp of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having attended school for societal reasons, she got an early start in commerce along side her mother, who used to sell condiments. After several years of apprenticeship at her side, Madina came to advance on her own doing commerce in clothing made in Dogon lands. She also sells fruit juices and ice. She has been in this business for five years and enjoys much experience and a large customer base.  

Concerned about coping with customer demands, she turned toward the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with which she has been associated for 66 months. After ten solidarity loans and one individual loan, which were all properly repaid, she is now on her second individual loan. She intends to use this new loan to buy a freezer. She gets her supplies locally in Ségou.

Ms. Madina accepts cash or credit from a customer base composed of women and men. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will enable her to help with family expenses and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy a freezer

loans.name: Señor Nazareno Group

texts.es: Luz es integrante de la Alcancía Comunal “Señor Nazareno” donde lo conforman 7 personas responsables, quienes realizan diversas actividades económicas. Actualmente Luz asume el cargo de tesorera, es conviviente, tiene 34 años con 1 hija. Luz nos cuenta que hace 05 años se dedica a  la venta de bebidas y golosinas en su bodega bar de nombre Aurora, viene trabajando en este negocio  gracias a su madre quien la motivo a tener un negocio propio, también se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de frutas, confitería y gaseosas a los pasajeros de las empresas de transporte que pasan por su comunidad y en esto ya lleva mas de 10 años, gracias a los esfuerzo de Luz a podido lograr que su hija este por terminar sus estudios y además logro construir su vivienda. El deseo de Luz es ampliar su casa para así poder tener un espacio mayor donde pueda  vender. Con el reciente préstamo  Luz piensa  comprar mercadería para su pequeño puesto ambulatorio como frutas, confitería, gaseosas, etc. para así tener más ingresos y poder ofrecer una mejor vida a su familia. La Alcancía Comunal “Señor Nazareno” está agradecida por el préstamo recibido y comprometidos con el programa Prosperidad. Madeleyne no  llego a tiempo de sus centro laborales por motivo de trafico es por ello que no están presente en la foto de la Alcancía Comunal “Señor Nazareno”. y Rolando esta adjunto a la foto.
texts.en:
Luz is part of the Communal Bank “Señor Nazareno” which consists of seven responsible individuals who engage in different business activities.  She currently holds the position of group treasurer.  Luz is 34 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has a daughter.  She says that she been selling drinks and candy from a store named “Aurora” for the past five years.  Luz started working after her mother convinced her to start her own business.  She also sells fruit, sweets, and sodas as a street vendor to public transportation passengers who come through her community.  Luz has been a street vendor for more than 10 years.  Thanks to her efforts, Luz was able to help her daughter finish her studies and build a house.  She wants to expand her home so that she can have more living space.  

With this current loan, Luz plans to buy merchandise for her small street stand such as fruit, sweets, sodas, and other products.  The Communal Bank “Señor Nazareno” is grateful for the loan that has been issued and commits to the terms of the Prosperidad program.  

Madelyne is the member of the Communal Bank who does not appear in the photo.  She arrived late because of city traffic.  Rolando is the member who appears next to the group photo.

loans.use: to purchase fruit, sweets, sodas, and other products.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
El comité se inició a iniciativa de la Señora Crisolina, quién vive en Ciudad del Este. Ella  contactó con sus vecinas y amigas, las organizó y las motivo para formar el comité en dicha zona.
El comité se Denomina “San Cayetano” y están en el Tercer  Ciclo con  16  integrantes con sus respectivas labores productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas. Se destaca el grupo por la unidad existente y por la cooperación imperante. Se definen como luchadoras, lo único que desean es el bienestar de sus familias y una vida digne.
La Sra herme se dedica a la venta de pescado, hace ya varios años, todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para poder ir a vender sus productos. Sueña con poder aumentar la variedad de peces que posee pues sabe que habiendo mas variedad poda atraer mas clientes.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mas pescados y así poder aumentar la cantidad de su mercadería. Cree que el credito le sera de mucha ayuda para mejorar sus ingresos.
.
texts.en:
This committee arose thanks to Crisola’s initiative.  She lives in Ciudad del Este.  She contacted her neighbors and friends, organized and motivated them to form a committee in said zone.

The committee is called “San Cayetano” and they are in their third cycle with 16 members each with her own productive work.  They are very unified, responsible and mutually supportive among themselves.  The group stands out because of the unity that exists and the cooperation that reigns.  They define themselves as tenacious.  All they want is their families’ wellbeing and dignified lives.

Herme has sold fish for several years now.  She rises very early every day to go sell her products.  She dreams with being able to increase the variety of fish she has because she knows that having more variety will lead to attracting more customers.

She is asking for the loan to buy more fish to increase the amount of her merchandise.  She believes that the loan will be very helpful to improve her income.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Maritza es socia del banco comunal La positiva del Distrito De calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene siete hijos, solo dos de ellos están en su poder.
Hace cuatro años que pertenece a la familia de Manuela Ramos, tiempo que aprovechó y con un pequeño capital pudo trabajar como consultora de belleza, ofreciendo sus productos por catálogo y brindándoles facilidades a sus clientes a quienes les vende al crédito y al contado.
Con su nuevo préstamo de  S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles comprará: 2 champoo, 1 colonia para niño, 1 lápiz delineador,  1 crema para manos, 2 perfumes para hombres, 1 esmalte de uñas, 1 crema lipo reductora, 1 quita esmalte.
Toda sus ganancia que obtiene por la venta de sus productos lo invierte en la compra de madera para poder arreglar su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida, sobre todo para sus hijos.
"Gracias a Manuela Ramos por todas las cosas buenas que me ha dado" y que lo estoy sabiendo aprovechar.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of the communal bank "La Positiva" in the Callería district of the state of Ucayali.  She is 52 years old, married, and has 7 children.  Two of them still live with her.  

She has been part of the Manuela Ramos family for four years. She took advantage of this time and with a little capital she started a business as a beauty consultant.  She sells products by catalog, and offers her customers payment options of cash or on credit.  With her new loan of 1,000.00 New Soles, she will purchase 2 shampoos, 1 baby cologne, 1 eyeliner, 1 hand cream, 2 men's colognes, 1 nail polish, 1 slenderizing cream, and 1 nail polish remover. All of the profits she makes through the sale of her products are invested in purchasing wood to fix her home and improve her quality of life, especially for her children.  

"Thanks to Manual Ramos for all of the good things that they have given me and I am putting to good use."

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, colognes, nail polish, etc.

loans.name: Aitaji's Group

texts.en:
Aitaji is the leader of this group. She is 58 and married to a teacher whose monthly salary is 1000 soms. Together they have raised a son, 36, who is married and works in construction. Aitaji cultivates potatoes and breeds cattle to earn money. By reselling cattle at a higher price and from a portion of the harvest, she contributes an additional 5000 soms to the family budget. Aitaji applied for the loan because she needs additional funds to purchase a bull-calf. In the future she wishes to purchase a vehicle for the family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a bull-calf

loans.name: C5532 Hirwamutegarugori Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 30 years old and is married with seven children  between 8 and 21 years of age.  She is a businesswoman selling products such as sorghum and beans. She is also the leader of this group which is called "HIRWAMUTEGARUGORI". In the local language this means "HAVE CHANCE WOMEN" . She is the second person on the right side.

Jacqueline has four years of experience.  She works from 6am to 6pm every day except on the weekend and she currently employs one person to help her.

Jacqueline and her group have requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses. Once their businesses are expanded, they hope to satisfy their customers and earn more profits which will allow them to reinvest in their businesses and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as sorghum and beans for sale

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
This is Mary Jane, 39, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, the Philippines. She is married to Tyron, a messenger, and is the mother to their child. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business, working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Mary Jane operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store that sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Mary Jane earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Aside from the store she has a food stall, where one can buy home-cooked meals. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 933 every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 16,000. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. A portion of the loan will be used to buy quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments, and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Mary Jane dreams of being able to give her child a good and high-quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet every week. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Houen

texts.en:
Houen, 56 years old, is a farmer with $8 per day for her income. She is a single mother who lives with three children, and all of them are working for $3.5 per day. 

Every month, she has to spend $155 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on transportation, and $10 on other expenses. 

She would like to request a loan of $500 to buy fruit from local farmers for resale. She just started this career, and if she gets a good profit, she will continue doing it. She hopes to support her children so that they can learn a skill that can get them a good career for their living in the future.

loans.use: To buy fruit from local farmers for resale.

loans.name: Rabiha

texts.en: Rabiha is a 43-year-old Lebanese married woman. She is living with her husband and only child who is attending school. After having her first child, she decided to help her husband with the household expenses. So she started to work as a private teacher in her home. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to prepare a special education room outfitted with the needed teaching materials and supplies to welcome students appropriately. She notes that she will also need the loan to pay her daughter’s school fees to allow her to pursue her education properly. She is very positive and willing to apply for additional Kiva loans in the future.

loans.use: to prepare a special education room and pay her daughter’s school fees

loans.name: Martín Dario

texts.es:
El Señor Martín tiene 34 años actualmente vive en la ciudad de Carapeguá. El se desempeña como albañil profesional y esta trabajando por cuenta propia. Martín aprendió el oficio en la Argentina donde estuvo trabajando durante cinco años, con un tío, luego se murió su madre y vino a quedarse en su país.
Actualmente esta construyendo una casa y cuentas con mucho trabajos por que su especialidad es la terminación como molduras, colocación de azulejos en baños y pisos, ahora esta trabajando con él su sobrino a quien le enseña la profesión y la vez les paga por los servicios.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de mas herramientas de trabajo, como ser baldes, cucharas de albañilería y otros. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Martín is 34 years old and currently lives in the city of Carapeguá.  He is a professional builder and is self employed.  Martín learned the trade in Argentina where he worked for five years with his uncle.  Then his mother died and he came back home to Paraguay.

Martín is currently building a house and he has a lot of work because his speciality is finishing work such as moldings, laying tiles in bathrooms and also on floors.  He is now working with his nephew to whom he is teaching the profession and, at the same time, paying him for his services.

Martín is requesting this loan to buy more work tools such as buckets, trowels, etc.  He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving him.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Rano's Group

texts.en:
Rano is the leader of this group. She is 40 years old and is married to a baker. Together with her husband, she raises four daughters and a son. Their oldest daughter is married, another daughter studies at school, and their son is just one year old. 

Twelve years ago, with an initial investment of 3500 soms, Rano’s husband rented a place for baking bread.  At the moment, Rano has applied for the loan because they need additional money to purchase more flour and coal for baking bread. In the future, she plans to improve the business. With the profits gained from the trade, Rano plans to celebrate her second daughter’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by MCC Mol Bulak Finance LLC (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase flour and coal.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en:
