Roger is 21 years old, single, and lives with his family in the village of Bacolod, in the Angadanan municipality of the Isabela province. At his young age, Roger is willing to work hard every single day to provide their daily needs.

Roger wants to continue to manage the business so that he can earn and save money for the future emergencies. He is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his corn farming business. He believes that through patience and hard work, he will have a plentiful harvest this coming harvest season.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides for his corn farming business.

loans.name: Cheer

texts.en:
Cheer is married and has one child. She is 31 years old, residing in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 

Cheer operates her own cellphone load retail business in their community to make a living, and she has been in this business for over two years. Each month, she earns PHP 900 doing this work. 

She has requested a loan with the amount of PHP 5,000 to purchase sim cards for cell phones and pay for a retailer sim card. She will spend some of the revenue sending her one child to school.

Cheer has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Cheer is hoping that her business will grow so she can support the financial needs of her only child.

loans.use: to purchase electronic cellphone load

loans.name: Gina

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra: Gina; La socia tiene 31años de edad, la socia  es conviviente,  tiene 1 hijo, la socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de taller de mecanica junto a su esposo,la socia trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,al socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de taller de mecanica. La socia desea el préstamo para comprar instrumentos para su taller de mecanica como repuestos.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member, Mrs. Gina, is 31 and lives with her common-law husband and a son.  She and her husband are still running their auto repair shop from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.  Through her work she has been able to provide for her son.  Now she wants to expand and improve the business and plans to use the loan to buy spare parts and instruments.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy instruments and spare parts for her auto repair shop.

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
san Sebastian es el comité integrado por 11 mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras D. la ciudad D. Villa Ygatimi, todas ellas son mujeres jefas D. familia, que día a día luchan por el sustento D. su familia. Ellas vieron en el programa D. la fundación paraguaya una excelente oportunidad D. progreso. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras, pero les gustaría poder ir más allá.
Un ejemplo D. lucha es la señora Ramona, quien cría y venD. animales, como ser gallinas, cerdos. Comenta que es muy sacrificado su trabajo, pues debe estar pendiente D. los animales que cría, para que los mismos no tengan ninguna enfermedad o problema. Comenta que este trabajo la ha ayudado mucho para crecer y ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. gallinas y cerdos pequeños para la cría y posterior venta, pues ella quiere seguir progresando y creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
San Sebastián is the communal bank formed by 11 very hardworking women, fighters from the city of Villa Ygatimi.  All of the women are heads of household who struggle to support their families every day.  They saw in the Fundación Paraguaya program an excellent opportunity for progress.  They are currently in the first loan cycle of the program for women entrepreneurs, but they would like to be able to go beyond this.

One example of struggle is Ramona, who raises and sells animals, like chickens and pigs.  She says she is very selfless in her work, since she has to be devoted to the animals she raises, so they don't get any illness or have any problem.  She says this work has helped her a lot to grow and help her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy young chickens and pigs to raise and later sell, since she wants to continue progressing and growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy pigs and chickens to raise and later sell.

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en: Sophon resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia. Sophon sells clothes, and her husband is a construction foreman. Sophon is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase more fabrics to design clothes to sell. By doing so, her family is able to generate more income. In the future, she would like to use any additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to design clothes to sell.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman. 

Julita runs a sari-sari (general) store. She sells items like vinegar, soy sauce, shampoo and soap. She also bakes bread that she sells to her community. 

Julita has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar and more items to sell. Julita hopes for her business to grow. She also hopes for bright futures for her children.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and more items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chicks and feed, plus ground nuts for peanut butter making

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 
Flordeliza is providing motorela or motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for the services.
Flordeliza has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for the services

loans.name: Philip

texts.en: This Barber Shop called New World Creations is one of the best 'haircutting' centers in Taifa vicinity in Accra. The operator of the shop is called Philip. He is a dynamic young man and employs 2 apprentices in the shop. Philip requires a KIVA loan in the amount of $1,175 to enable him purchase 4 additional barbering machines. Philip was very enthusiastic when he was introduced to the TEACH lending methodology. He learned the bookkeeping skills quite fast and has developed the business and the marketing plan.

loans.use: 4 Barbering Equipments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ann Wanjiru Ngare intends to set up a green grocer shop

loans.name: Robrt

texts.en:
Oketha Robert was born in 1980 in his home village which is in Anaka sub-county Nyoya division Amuru district. He has four brothers,four sisters and three cousins.

Robert has been one of the volunteers at Charity for Peace Uganda since 2003. While at the center Robert has been a member of disciplinary committee and the Children's Cordinator at life in Africa.

Robert is a hard worker and he has set his goals on created a better life for the future. His first goal is to start a brick making business. Bricks are in good demand during the building season. A loan of 250,000=/ will make this goal a reality plus he will be able to proivide some income for others.

He plans to make 8000 bricks. The labor cost for this will only be 55,000 and they can be sold for a profit of 800,000. With this profit Robert believes that he would be able to pay back the loan and have a surplus to start up a Hotel with the help of his own savings.

He intends to refund the loan after 6 months

Below is his budget plans

hiring plot...............................10,000=

3 tapulines................................45,000=

5 wooden molding machine...................15,000=

Fire wood..................................60,000=

Transport...................................45,000=

water bill..................................20,000=

labour......................................55,000=

Total.......................................250,000=

loans.use: Labour for laying bricks

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina is 30 years old, divorced and has two children, ages 12 and 5. Being left alone to take care of her oldest daughter and without anyone to take care of her, Alejandrina saw the need to start her own business selling groceries seven years ago. This business is the only source of income she has to cover the basic needs and education of her children, and she has worked hard and would like to keep expanding it to improve her family's quality of life.

Now, to be able to offer a greater variety of products to her clients, she is asking for a $200 loan to purchase merchandise. She will pay it back in full in 3 months. Be a part of the growth and development of this business, Alejandrina and her family are very grateful for your support.

Alejandrina tiene 30 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene dos hijos de 12 y 5 años. Al quedar sola a cargo de su hijo mayor y no tener a nadie que cuidara de él, Alejandrina se vio en la necesidad de iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de abarrotes hace siete años, éste representa su único ingreso para cubrir las necesidades básicas y educación de sus hijos, por lo que ha trabajado mucho y desea continuar creciendo para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Ahora para poder ofrecer una mejor variedad de productos a sus clientes está solicitando un crédito de $ 200 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo y crecimiento de este negocio, Alejandrina y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo.

loans.use:
Purchase of merchandise

Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.en:
Dona Maria works hard next to her husband to improve their family's life and secure a brighter future. She is the mother of 3 children raised with discipline and taught to love hard work. it's been 20 years since she and her husband started their small furniture workshop, where they sell handmade chairs and sofas. Their team approach, which incorporates their children's help, has resulted in their business flourishing in the local market. This in turn has allowed their children to attend school so that they have become independent. Today, only the youngest daughter remains at home.

Lately, demand for their goods has decreased, which precipitated an economic crisis and forced Dona Maria and her family to become more innovative in their approach. To offer more creative, quality chair designs, the family has made the commitment to invest in additional raw materials, which is the reason they are requesting this loan of $525, to be repaid over 6 months. Let's support Dona Maria's family business as they strive to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria, se esfuerza al lado de su esposo por mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y lograr un futuro mejor, es madre de tres hijos que formó con disciplina y amor al trabajo.Ella y su esposo hace más de 20 años que formaron este pequeño taller de confección de muebles en los que ofrecen sillas y sillones confeccionados a mano e hicieron juntos y con la ayuda de sus hijos un trabajo en equipo que permitió que este pequeño taller salga a flote y destaque en las inmediaciones del mercado local, además ha permitido durante mucho tiempo que sus hijos estudien cómodamente para que cada uno de ellos independientemente pueda forjar su futuro; ahora sólo la menor sigue a cargo de ellos. Actualmente la demanda ha ido decayendo por lo que Doña Maria y su familia pasaron por una crisis económica que los obligó a ser aún más creativos para ofrecer a todos los visitantes del mercado sillas más vistosas y de calidad, ahora, como parte de este proyecto familiar, Doña Maria y su familia han decidido invertir en insumos de trabajo para producir más con el deseo de conseguir satisfactoriamente el sustento diario para su familia.Por ello su solicitud haciende a 525 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses.No permitamos que Doña Maria y su familia estanquen su desarrollo apoyemos su esfuerzo.

loans.use: The Canchari family wishes to purchase raw materials for their furniture-making business

loans.name: So-Khoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. So-yoeurn is divorced with 5 children. She started raising pigs in 1996, and she now has 48 baby pigs, including one mother pig. All of her children are living under her care. The eldest daughter assists her in raising the pigs at home, and the other children are studying.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA twice. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $600. She will use this money to purchase 20 more baby pigs to raise in the pig shed next to her house.

loans.use: To purchase 20 baby pigs

loans.name: Carlota Isaura

texts.pt:
Carlota Isaura B. is 31 years old and a single mother of 2 children. She lives in the Maxaquene district in Maputo. She entered the program in January of 2007 with a loan of 5.000MT. She has a stand where she sells drinks and sodas in the same district. This is her third loan cycle and was able to repay the first two on time. This third cycle she is asking for $500US for 6 months and plans to replenish her stock to meet the high demand of the festive season that is approaching.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Carlota Isaura B. tem 31 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de dois filhos.Vive no bairro da Maxaquene em Maputo.Entrou para o programa em Janeiro de 2007 com um empréstimo de 5.000MT. Tem uma barraca de vendas de bebidas e refrigerantes no mesmo bairro. Está no terceiro ciclo de empréstimo e reembolsou os anteriores dois pontualmente. Vai ao 3º ciclo e vai tomar 12.000MT pagáveis em 6 meses com vista a reforçar o stock com vista a fazer face à alta procura na quadra festiva que se avizinha.

loans.use: Increase stocks

loans.name: Sokim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokim S. (age 27) and her husband have been married since 2001. They have two children—one son and one daughter. Her son is studying in primary school in the village and her daughter is still young and stays at home. Sokim and her family live along National Road number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. She and her husband are in the business of growing rice since 2001. Besides growing rice, her husband is a construction worker.

She is asking to borrow money from MAXIMA for the first time in the amount of $100. She will use this money to buy fertilizer for growing rice.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for growing rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fruit from a wholesaler.

loans.name: Makoma Central A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Margret A.. She is currently in the business of selling tomatoes and is requesting a loan to add capital. Margret is 35 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant farmer. She has 8 children ranging from age 6 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Margret makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land.

Margret is joined in her small group by Nakecho K., Pamela A., Base N., and Rose K.. Nakecho K. has a business in tailoring and wants to purchase more cloth fabric. Pamela A. is currently operating a weaving and mat selling business and wants a loan to add working capital. Base N. operates a business in fish sales and wants to boost business. Rose K. is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to construct a vegetable stall.

loans.use: To boost vegetable selling business

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
Justina has belonged to the Communal Bank of Love and Truth for ten years.

She is a 48-year-old single mother with one daughter. She travels to different fairs in the region two times per week where she sells groceries, fruit, and breads. She buys cheese at the fair that she then resells in the F. Vivanco Market.

Justina needs a loan of 2500 soles ($925 US) that she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, noodles, flour, cookies, breads and various fruits.

Justina’s dreams are for her daughter to become a good professional, to make progress with the business, and to have a permanent store in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Gladfelter, Alex Christoff and Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteers.

Justina pertenece al Banco Comunal Amor y Verdad hace 10 años.

Justina es madre soltera, tiene 48 años y 1 hija, Justina viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región dos veces por semana, donde vende abarrotes, frutas, panes y de las ferias trae queso que vende en el mercado F. Vivanco.

Justina necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, fideo, harina, galletas, panes y frutas variadas.

Los sueños de Justina son que su hija sea buena profesional, progresar con su negocio y tener una tienda estable en la ciudad de Ayacucho.

loans.use: Justina needs a loan of 2500 soles ($925 US) that she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, noodles, flour, cookies, breads and various fruits.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is married; she is 35 years old with 5 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. Her provisions range from milk, beverages, and soap to drinks items like juice. She started her business 1997. She needs a loan of $450 to buy more provisions and drinks for sales. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To buy fruit juice, drinks and provisions for sales

loans.name: Jovana

texts.es:
The sale of CDs, DVDs, and MP3s has turned into a very profitable business for Jovana and her family. Since starting a family she has placed most of her energy on their interests and activities, working toward their success so that she could enjoy peace together with her dear children and her husband, who is musically talented and dreams of one day sharing a stage with his children.

Jovana begins her work at 4:00 pm and finishes at 10:00 pm and in the mornings she makes beautiful knit sweaters and vests with the goal of selling them and generating extra income for her household. She would like to obtain a loan in order to increase the variety of her merchandise so that she can improve sales and profits.

Translated from Spanish by Kristy, a Kiva volunteer.

La venta de CD, DVD y MP3 se ha convertido en un negocio muy rentable para Jovana y su familia. Desde que formó su familia puso su mayor esfuerzo en todas las actividades a las que se dedicó, con el fin de salir siempre airosa y así gozar de tranquilidad junto a sus amados hijos y esposo quien tiene cualidades especiales para la música y sueña algún día compartir el escenario con sus hijos.Jovana inicia su labor a las 4:00 de la tarde para culminarla a las 10:00 de la noche y por las mañanas confecciona hermosas chompas y chalecos con el objetivo de venderlos y generar ingresos extras para el sustento de su hogar.En esta oportunidad desea obtener un préstamo para aumentar la variedad de su mercadería con el que pretende también mejorar sus ventas y sus ingresos económicos.

loans.use: Increase of capital to elevate production and the sale of articles.

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru:
Surayo N. lives in Rudaki, Tajikistan. She is 50 years old, married, and has 3 children. She works as an obstetrician-gynecologist at the nearby hospital. She wants to obtain a loan to buy a cow in order to be able to feed her family milk. She will also be able to sell excess milk to her neighbors. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Dan Ostrovsky, Kiva Volunteer.

Нусайриева Сурайе проживает в районе Рудаки. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Возраст 50 лет . Работает акушер-гинекологом в роддоме района. Хочет получить кредит и купить корову.Купив корову она сможет обеспечить свою семью молоком. А если будет лишнее сможет даже продавать соседям. Погасить кредит планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Buy a cow

loans.name: Rock City 2030-C Group

texts.en:
This small group's leader is Santina P.. She currently sells bread and is requesting a loan to build a house to rent. Santina is 38 years old and is married to a farmer. She has four children in school, ranging in age from six to eighteen years old. Each week Santina makes approximately 150 Sudanese pounds in profits.

Santina is joined in her small group by Grace L., Magret Gabriel, Hellen K., and Rose J.. Grace L. sells charcoal and wants to expand her business. Magret Gabriel sells biscuits at her shop and wants to expand the shop. Hellen K. sells cakes and breads in a shop and wants to construct an oven. Rose J. sells fruits at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: Build a house to rent and expand their respective businesses.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en: Lach S., 40, is a mother of two children and resides in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works as a tailor from her home to earn a living and is able to make around $1.50 of profit per day. Normally, she purchases cloth from the garment factory to make gloves and sells them to the market. Her husband Bou Pov, 44, is a motor-taxi driver and is able to make $5 of profit per day. Mrs. Lach would like to loan of $400 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business. In the future, she wants to set up a grocery store to double the family income. (Mr. Bou is pictured with his motorbike outside their home)

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi business

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es: Fortunato es agricultor, tiene una gran pasión por trabajar las tierras y hacerlas producir, tiene grandes hectáreas de terrenos de cultivo en las afueras de su comunidad, lugares que están sumamente alejados de su hogar, pero gracias a su caballito puede trasladarse sin dificultan y rápidamente a sus chacras.Nos comenta que le tiene un gran aprecio a su caballo, quien además es una muy buena compañía cuando sale muy temprano de su hogar.Fortunato es quien sostiene los gastos de su hogar, y ahora está muy preocupado por su producción debido que le hace falta una fumigadora, con la cual poder atacar las plagas y enfermedades de sus cultivos, por este motivo, solicita este préstamo, para la compra de su fumigadora y los abonos necesarios para sus terrenos de producción.
texts.en:
Fortunato is a farmer who has a great passion for working the land and making it produce. He has many hectares of farmland outside of his community, areas which are quite far from his home. However, thanks to his little horse, he can travel quickly and without difficulty to his small farm. He tells us he has a great appreciation for his horse, who is also good company when he leaves very early from his house. Fortunato is the one who supports his household, yet he is currently worried about his crops given his inability to use a fumigator. This leaves them vulnerable to attack from pest infestations and disease. It is for these reasons that he seeks a loan, so that he can buy a fumigator and the necessary fertilizers for his farmland.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a fumigator and fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: La Victoria Group

texts.es:
El Grupo denominado La Victoria se inició en el año 2.008, entusiastas mujeres forman parte de un excelente grupo, cuentan con una comisión bien conformada, el grupo es integrado por 16 señoras, la mayoría de las integrantes realizan emprendimientos orientados al cultivo de: lechuga, tomate, perejil, acelga, rabanitos, etc. para su posterior venta al mercado, la mayoría de los pobladores de la zona donde ellas viven se dedican a la horticultura.

La clasificación de actividades es como sigue:

1- Zunilda Ygnacia Q. – Venta de verduras.

2- Elena O. Morel – Venta de verduras.

3- Florentina R. Cantero – Venta de ropas.

4- Cinecia Carolina P. – Venta de verduras.

5- Lilian Ramona V. – Venta de verduras.

6- Silvina Benítez Cantero – Venta de carbón.

7- Antonia C. Benítez - Venta de verduras.

8- Carol Marlene V. – Venta de verduras.

9- Josefina C. Núñez – Venta de verduras.

10- Alba Rosa M. – Venta de mercería.

11- Ramona V. – Venta de verduras.

12- Paulina Martínez – Venta de verduras.

13- Catalina M. – Venta de comidas.

14- Estefana A. Recalde – Venta de verduras.

15- María Selva Martínez – Venta de cosméticos.

16- Facunda M. de Espínola – Venta de verduras.

Se destaca la solidaridad y la unión que las mismas están forjando entre ellas, asisten voluntariamente a las reuniones, realizan sus pagos en forma puntual.

La comisión nos comentó que optaron por realizar una feria con el objetivo de incentivarlas a mostrar sus productos y para promover la inclusión social.

Consideran la importancia del programa ya que les permite ayudarse y ayudar a gente conocida y de confianza, generando una cadena de colaboración mutua.

Con el crédito desean adquirir insumos para el cultivo de verduras, compra de mercería, compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas como: empanadas, pizza, sopa paraguaya, chipa paraguaya para su posterior venta, compra de cosméticos.
texts.en:
The group called La Victoria (The Victory) began in 2008. The enthusiastic women are part of an excellent group, and they count on a well-formed committee. The group is made up of 16 women. Most of the members pursue enterprises related to the farming of: lettuce, tomatoes, parsley, beets, wild radishes, etc. to sell in the market. Most of the women in their area work in agriculture.

The classification of activities is as follows:

1. Zunilda Ygnacia Q. – Sells vegetables. 2. Elena O. Morel – Sells vegetables. 3. Florentina R. Cantero – Sells clothes. 4. Cinecia Carolina P. – Sells vegetables. 5. Lilian Ramona V. – Sells vegetables. 6. Silvina Benítez Cantero – Sells coal. 7. Antonia C. Benítez – Sells vegetables. 8. Carol Marlene V. – Sells vegetables. 9. Josefina C. Núñez – Sells vegetables. 10. Alba Rosa M. – Haberdashery 11. Ramona V. – Sells vegetables. 12. Paulina Martínez – Sells vegetables. 13. Catalina M. – Sells food. 14. Estefana A. Recalde – Sells vegetables. 15. María Selva Martínez – Sells cosmetics. 16. Facunda M. de Espínola – Sells vegetables.

The solidarity and the union that they are forging among them are emphasized. They voluntarily attend meetings and make their payments punctually.

The committee chooses to make a fair with the goal of encouraging the members to show their products and to promote social inclusion.

They consider the program to be important since it allows them to help themselves and to help people they know, generating a chain of mutual collaboration.

With this loan, they want to acquire supplies to farm vegetables, to buy merchandise, to buy ingredients for the preparation of food like: empanadas, pizza, sopa paraguaya, and chipa paraguaya, and to buy cosmetics. These items will later be sold.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy varied merchandise

loans.name: Sherzod

texts.ru: Файзуллаев Шерзод житель гиссарского райна. Возраст 20 лет, холост. Образование неполное высшее. Учится в Политехническом Университете. Работиает в диллерском центре. Оказывает услуги по ремонту мобильных телефонов. Кредит хочет получить для того, чтобы закупить запчасти , используемые в ремонте. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sherzod F. lives in the Gissar district. He is a 20 year old bachelor. He is completing his university degree as a student at the Polytechnic University. He works in a small shop, providing mobile phone repair services. He would like to use a loan to purchase spare parts needed for repairs. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts

loans.name: Miurel Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Miurel del Rosario C. tiene la edad de 21 años, habita en el barrio Piedra Menuda, ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya, junto a su esposo e hijo de tres años, los planes de doña Miurel para su familia son darle una mejor condición de vida. Ella trabaja como domestica en una casa privada desde hace dos años, es un trabajo agotador pero tiene que salir adelante con su familia, ya que todo esta bien caro,  ella solicita el apoyo de Afodenic para poder comprar materiales de construcción y así poder mejorar su vivienda, ya tiene comprado parte de los materiales como los bloques y espera comprar piedra, arena, cemento, hierro entre otros, para poder gozar de un techo digno con su familia.
texts.en:
Miurel del Rosario C. is 21 years old, living in the Piedra Menuda (Tiny Rock) neighborhood in the city of Masaya. She lives with her husband and son. She and her husband care for the little boy of three years. Miurel's plan for her family is to give her son better living conditions. She has worked as a maid in a private home for two years. It's an exhausting job, but she wants her family to do well, and everything is expensive. She is asking for Kiva partner Afodenic's help so she can buy construction materials and fix up her home. She has already bought some of the materials, such as the bricks, and she hopes to buy rocks, sand, cement, iron, etc., so she and her family can enjoy a proper roof over their heads.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to fix up the home

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim P., is the leader of the four-member group; all the borrowers live in Sro Ngeir Commune of Siem Reap Province. Sim P., 38 years old, is a vegetable seller in Kok Tlok Market. She runs a small store inside the market to sell different kinds of vegetables, selling cabbages, potatoes, and morning glories. She currently earns an average of $3 a day and has been running the business for more than three years. She is married to Mr. Roeun Saroeum, who is a motorcycle taxi driver and also helps her in transporting vegetables to market. She has five children: four are single and one is married and lives away from the family home. One of her singles sons is working as a construction worker. In order to make the business successful and generate a stable income for the family, Sim P. is applying for a loan to purchase more vegetables to sell.
The other three borrowers are:
Chhlang S., 29, who earns a living by renting rooms to tourists. She requests a loan to buy a trailer-motorcycle for her husband to pick up passengers.
Vong S., age 35, who is a tailor. She asks for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her family's transportation.
Lum T. is 40 years old, who has rooms for rent. She needs a loan to purchase piglets to raise.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables for sale

loans.name: Amenye

texts.en:
Pictured is 35 years old Amenye K. from Mbeya. She is married with two children, between the ages of 15 and 17. Amenye has been running a crops-selling business since 2002. Her business consists of purchasing maize and beans from wholesalers and then selling those items in retail. 

She works at the business for about five to eight hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her husband.  Amenye currently earns about 100USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 375USD in order to purchase beans and maize in bulk for reselling. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business.  Amenye thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:	
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase beans and maize in bulk for reselling

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 40-year-old man living in the village of Chhim in Mount Lebanon Governate.  He owns a linen shop which serves his village and the surrounding villages.  He has already received several micro loans from Ameen to improve his business. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 to be used to buy inventory at a very good price.

loans.use: Buy more inventory

loans.name: Birungi Monica Group

texts.en:
Mugoya V. is 31 years of age and is married with four children aged 13 years to 9 months. She rents a one-roomed house. She also stays with her two sisters. She has three meals a day.

She has a retail shop where she works seven days a week. She receives about 20 customers a day and she has run this business for 6 years now. Prior to this she had tried tailoring. Her main challenge is rent for her place of work.

She has been with MCDT for three years now and she has received three loans. The reason why she chose to work with MCDT is because of the loan interest rates they charge. She will use this loan to pay for tuition for her children. She will also use part of it to increase her stock.

Her aspiration is to pay tuition for her children till they complete their education.

loans.use: To pay tuition for her children and to increase on her stock

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 35 years old, married, and has four children: ages 16, 12, 10 and 8. She also cares for two additional dependents.

Salma has been a bites (maandazi: bread-like rolls) seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She belongs to Uvumilivu group loan (Group code 2101). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works for 12 hours at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business and she wishes to start a new business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business and to open a new business

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Candelaria es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Candelaria es líder de una línea de ventad e cosméticos llamado Oriflame, a su cargo tiene a vendedoras y percibe un pago mensual por esta función, También vende los cosméticos. Candelaria junto a su esposo tienen un hospedaje.
Candelaria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos.
Los sueños de Candelaria son mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a member of the Retoño Communal Bank. Candelaria lives with her partner, is 27 years old and has one child. Candelaria is a leader in the sale of a cosmetics line called Oriflame. She supervises other saleswoman and receives a monthly payment for this role. She also sells the cosmetics. Candelaria and her partner have a small hotel. Candelaria needs a loan for 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics. Candelaria's dream is to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cosmetics.

loans.name: Takku Liggey Tefess 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe  takku liggey tefess 6est une association qui regroupe des femmes  mariées qui s ‘activent de petit commerce de divers produits. elles vendent de la patte d’arachide. Le groupe de trois(3) membres se réunissent chaque semaine pour collecter  les cotisations des membres qui sont versées à une d’elle à tour de rôle .Avec le prêt elles comptent renforcer leur activité en achetant plus de marchandises.les revenus tirés de leurs activité leur permettent d’entretenir leurs enfants. Ces femmes habitent à Mbour  ville côtière située à 70 km de Dakar
texts.en:
The group Takku Liggey Tefess 6 brings together married women who sell various products. They sell peanut butter. The group of 3 members meets each week to collect dues from each member which are paid out to each of them in turn. With the loan they intend to bolster their businesses by buying additional inventory. The income from their businesses allows them to support their children. These women live in Mbour, a coastal town situated 70 km from Dakar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of peanuts

loans.name: Cherry Belle

texts.en:
Cherry Belle C. is from the village of Poblacion in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 38 years old. Cherry Belle is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Cherry Belle runs a repair service in her local community. Cherry Belle has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Cherry Belle joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry Belle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000.00 PHP from PMPC. She use her previous loan to purchase business supplies. Cherry Belle is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP that she will use to buy more business supplies. This loan will be Cherry Belle's fifth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's tuition.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy business supplies

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is twenty-nine years old. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She works very hard to provide a brighter future for her children. She is a trader who sells rice at the local market in her community. She buys her rice from wholesalers in Accra and resells them to her customers at profit. She wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice for keep and sell them over time to avoid price hikes from the current food crisis in the country. She belongs to the community group called Joyful Family Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice.

loans.name: Lal Mohammad Group

texts.en:
Lal M. is the group leader of Lal M. group. There are two members in this group and each of them would like to receive money for their own business.

Lal M. wants to take a loan for his business of selling car-parts. He wants to buy necessary materials for his business.

G. M. wants to take a loan for his general store business. He wants to make his shop larger.

They are both very happy with this small-loan process in Afghanistan. They thank AFS and all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To  make his shop larger

loans.name: Gecelie

texts.en:
Gecelie J. is from the village of Zone1B, del Carmen, Iligan City. She is 22, married and owns & operates a a food stall, where she sell a variety of fruits to the local community. Gecelie has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately P15,000 PHP a month.

Gecelie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gecelie is requesting  5,000 PHP, which she will use to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Zone 1B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania T. is a 72-year-old woman who lives with her farmer husband and their child, who is a teacher. The planting and selling of vegetables has been the couple’s source of income for 40 years. Through this business, they have been able to help their child graduate from college and have seen him attain a career in teaching.

Farming can be sporadic, and Epifania wanted to enhance their livelihood by starting her own business. She hoped to gather enough capital to start her own business of raising and selling vegetables. She also hoped to expand her pig-raising business.

In 2008, she joined ASHI and obtained a loan. With this, she financed her current business, and after repaying her first loan on time and with good performance, she was allowed to take out a bigger amount. This loan was used in her pig-raising business as well as to finance her farming business. Her livestock business has doubled in capital because a piglet that she bought for Php 2,500 could be sold for Php 6,000 after four months. Epifania could then buy two piglets.

Continuing her business with ASHI, Epfania wants to take out a larger loan in order to grow her businesses. She hopes to build a piggery in their back yard, since the lot is wide and less populated, surrounded by a wide rice field and vegetables. This is where she will house the piglets she raises. A small portion of the loan will also be used to finance her agriculture business.

loans.use: To build a piggery and to finance her agriculture business.

loans.name: Akua

texts.en: Akua is a 38-year-old married mother of two children, the elder of whom has completed senior school and the younger of whom is in technical school. Akua owns and operates a grocery store selling items such as rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed milk powder, polybags etc. She deems it a big opportunity to expand her business to include other items frequently demanded by her customers. Akua wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve sales to enable her to save more for her children’s education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To increase her grocery inventory

loans.name: Antoney Group

texts.en:
Here is Rugiatu K. and Zainab B.. They named their group Antoney.  They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. This is not their first loan from Kiva through SMT. They had all previously received several loans from Kiva through SMT. Each one of them in the group received a loan of Le 800,000 during the last loan cycle. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use the proceeds to pay for their children’s school fees.  They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans.  Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 1,000,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Rugiatu K. (left) is the leader of the group. She is thirty-five years of age. She was born in a small town called Robuya Romende, in northern Sierra Leone. She now resides in Makeni with her husband and three children. Her husband is also a businessman and two of her children are attending school and the other is not of school going age. Rugiatu sells slippers, she has been a businesswoman for fifteen years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Telesforo

texts.es:
Telésforo se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche  comercializa a Pil Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche), También trabaja como albañil en pequeñas construcciones en su comunidad. Su esposa se dedica al cuidado de sus  hijos y colabora con los cuidados del ganado en la ausencia de su esposo. Tienen seis hijos el mayor de 23 años estudia en un Instituto Superior para Profesor, y los demás se encuentran en edad escolar, 
Residen en la localidad de Ancocagua de la Provincia Los Andes ubicado a cuatro horas de La Ciudad de la Paz.

El crédito lo destinara a la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar la producción de leche para poder tener mejores ingresos.

Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el primer crédito lo cancelo satisfactoriamente, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por Telésforo.
texts.en:
Telésforo raises cows. He sells his milk production to Pil Andina (Industrializad Milk Plant). He also works as a bricklayer on small construction in his community. His wife takes care of the children, and she takes care of the livestock when he is not there. They have six children. The oldest is 23 and is studying at college to be a teacher. The other children are school aged. They live in the Ancocagua area in the Los Andes province, which is four hours from the city of La Paz. The loan is to buy a dairy cow to increase milk production and be able to have improved income. This is his second loan with IMPRO. The first loan was paid back satisfactorily. The completed evaluation qualifies Telésforo for the loan he is soliciting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a dairy cow to increase milk production

loans.name: Donato

texts.en:
Donato is a 53-year-old dairy cow farmer and bricklayer.  A single father of two children,  Donato has been working with dairy cows for over 15 years now on a plot of land that he inherited from his father and that he shares with his brother.  Some of the milk he produces goes to the local milk company, Pil, and the other part Donato uses to make soft cheese for sale in the markets.  Donato lives in Maica Amba, which is a rural area behind the airport in Cochabamba's.  

With Donato's recently paid-off CIDRE loan he purchased a dairy cow, an acquisition that has really helped to increase his earnings. With this second loan from CIDRE, he will purchase a high-quality dairy cow that should help him produce about 25 more liters of milk each day.  This will greatly increase Donato's earnings and assist him in improving his children's quality of life .

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Madame Khady G. est une sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis mai 2009.Elle s’active dans le commerce et la vente de boubou. Elle emprunte 100 000frs et l’objet de prêt est d’acheter des tissus qu’elle va confectionner. Son premier prêt de 50 000 frs lui a permis de réaliser un bénéfice de 100 000 frs et de bien assister S es enfants dans leurs besoins quotidiens. Pour confectionner les habits qu’elle vend elle fait très souvent appel a un tailleur  a qui elle paie la main d’œuvre. Son vœu est d’acheter une machine a coudre et d’embaucher un tailleur pour mieux faire face a la demande croissante surtout comme en ces veilles de fête.
texts.en:
Ms. Khady G. has been a member of the Baye Laye branch since May 2009. She is active in commerce and in selling boubou (long flowing outfits). She is borrowing 100,000 francs, and the purpose of the loan is to buy fabrics for making clothing. Her first loan of 50,000 francs enabled her to realize a profit of 100,000 francs and to help her children with their day-to-day needs. To make the clothing she sells, she often calls upon a tailor and pays for his labor. Her wish is to buy a sewing machine and to hire a tailor for coping better with the growing demand, especially for this period ahead of the holidays.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her capital

loans.name: Berdina

texts.en:
Berdina C. is from the village of Comon, Mambajao, in the Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Berdina is married and has 6 school-aged children. Berdina owns & operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks & other delicacies to the local community. Berdina has been running this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Berdina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Berdina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Berdina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Berdina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Junior Alexis

texts.es:
Junior tiene 20 años de edad , es soltero y vive junto a su madre, su abuelo y sus tres hermanos en Puerto Malabrigo, distrito de Rázuri, provincia de Ascope, en la región la Libertad, ubicado a tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde que tenía trece años se dedica a la panadería. Su abuelo instaló en su casa un pequeño establecimiento donde comercializan los productos que ellos mismos elaboran en un horno instalado en la parte posterior de su vivienda. Usualmente comercializan panes, bizcochos y algunos dulces. Este negocio familiar se ha constituído como el único ingreso que cubre sus gastos familiares.

Junior se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de panetones. El aprendió cómo hacerlos hace algunos años y desde entonces los ha venido preparando y comercializando durante todas las temporadas navideñas.

Junior gusta mucho de lo que hace, su más grande anhelo es seguir sacando adelante la panadería y trabajar hasta convertirse en distribuidores. El es un joven inteligente, laborioso y muy creativo. En la fotografía aparece mostrándonos los primeros panetones que ya está elaborando.
texts.en:
Junior is 20 years old and single. He lives with his mother, grandfather, and three siblings in Puerto Malabrigo, District of Rázuri, Ascope Province in the region of La Libertad. This community is located 3½ hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Junior has been working in a bakery since he was 13 years old. His grandfather established this business in their home, where they sell products that they bake themselves in an oven located at the back of the house. They usually sell breads, cakes, and some sweets. This family business provides the only source of income to cover their expenses.

Junior is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 800 soles in order to buy ingredients for making panettone. He learned how to make this delicacy a few years ago and since then, he has been preparing and selling panettone every Christmas season.

Junior really enjoys what he does. His greatest dream is to continue making the bakery successful so that they eventually become distributors. He is an intelligent, hardworking, and very creative young man. In the photograph, Junior shows off the first batch of panettone that he has prepared.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making panettone

location.town: Puerto Malabrigo - Rázuri - Ascope - La Libertad

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is a 34-year-old petty trader. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She sells used clothing and has been doing this business for the past five years to support her family. With low capital, she is not able to buy larger bales of used clothes to sell. She would like to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothes with variety to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes in bales

loans.name: Victoria's Group

texts.en:
Victoria O. is from the village of Manano. She is 48 years old. Victoria is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Victoria O.'s Group.

Victoria is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Victoria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets to raise & sell in the future. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Victoria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Amy D. est une femme de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis mars 2002 et a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité (l'embouche bovine) pour l'avoir mené pendant plus de 5 ans. Son objectif est de mieux développer son activité et de prendre en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Amy D. is a woman of 46. She is married and the mother of six children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois since March of 2002 and has good experience in her business area (the fattening of cattle), which has enabled her to lead the enterprise for over 5 years. Her goal is to better develop her business and to support her family.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her business

loans.name: Biola

texts.en:
Biola sells drinks and is in the sachet water business. She is married to a commercial driver and they have 2 sons. She is happy about the progress that her children are making in school.

At this point, Biola is hoping for the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She also has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organisation) which is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is thankful in anticipation for your kind support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia P. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo. She is 44 years old. Letecia is married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Letecia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs to sell. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

location.town: Oroquieta-San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City Misamis

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy currently tills 3.75 hectares (9+ acres) of rice field in her town in South Cotabato. She is 37 years old, married and has no children yet.

Mercy has been farming since 2004 and the farm is the only source of income she and her husband have. She wants to maintain this business of hers because she wants to have a better income, especially now that they are planning to have kids.

Mercy is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She said she would use this loan to acquire seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Henry Alberto

texts.es: El cliente es originario del municipio de Cinco Pinos y el crédito será destinado para mejorar su negocio, compra de enseres domésticos, tales como: aceite, arroz, frijoles, maíz, golosinas, cajas de jabón de baño, de lavar, y está caracterizado por ser buen cliente ya que cumple en tiempo y forma la cancelación de su crédito.
texts.en:
Henry Alberto is originally from the town of Cinco Pinos. This loan will be used to improve his business by purchasing household goods such as oil, rice, beans, corn, candy, cases of bath soap, and cleansers. He is known for being a good client who completes his loan payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to improve his business

loans.name: Camino Al Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “Camino al Triunfo” y está conformado por 13 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Ellos se dedican principalmente a la preparación y venta de alimentos como sopaipillas, mote con huesillos, hot dogs, empanadas, churrascos, almuerzos y desayunos preparados, almacén, minimarket, fotocopias y venta de muebles.
La socia entrevistada fue Damaris, quien es la secretaria de este grupo. En la foto se encuentra en el 4º asiento de izquierda a derecha en la 1º fila. Ella tiene un minimercado en su misma casa y es una herencia de su mamá. 
Damaris invertirá este préstamo en comprar mercadería y apartará lo que le falta para hacerle un cobertizo a su negocio, para de esta manera prepararse para la lluvia del invierno. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y poder algún día entregarlo como  herencia a sus hijas. Tiene 2 hijas, una estudiando en 4º año medio y la mayor que le ayuda en el negocio. 
Lo que más le gusta a Damaris de trabajar con Fondo Esperanza es conocer a más personas emprendedoras igual que ella, ya que así aprende de las experiencias de sus compañeros y se pueden aconsejar mutuamente. Además comenta que le ha servido mucho la educación sobre el manejo del dinero en el negocio.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This bank is called “Camino al Futuro" (Path to the Future) and is comprised of 13 members from the city of Temuco. They primarily work in making food like “sopaipillas” (a type of fried pastry), “mote con huesillos” (a traditional Chilean summer-time drink), hot dogs, empanadas, barbecued beef, and prepared breakfasts and lunches. Some members have grocery stores, mini-markets, provide photocopies, or sell furniture. Damaris is the member that was interviewed. She is the secretary of the group. In the photo she is in the fourth seat from left to right in the first row. She has a mini-market, which she inherited from her mother, in her house. Damaris will use the loan to buy merchandise. She will put aside what she needs to make a shelter for her business. That way she will be prepared for the winter rains. Her dream is to expand her business to be able to someday give it as an inheritance to her daughters. She has two daughters. One is in her fourth year of high school, and the older one helps with the business. What Damaris likes the most about working with Fondo Esperanza is meeting more entrepreneurial people who are like her. That way she learns from her colleagues' experiences, and they can give each other advice. She also says that the education about managing money in business has helped her a lot. Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers south of Santiago (capital of Chile). It has a series of marshy spas and very colorful vegetation and wildlife. It is worth stating that 50% of the mapuches, indigenous people, that exist in our country are living in this region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Beer, drinks, and some of the loan for a shelter from the rains

loans.name: Melania Del Carmen

texts.es:
La  Señora. MELANIA DEL CARMEN Q. M. , Labora como Cocinera en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua. UNAN-Managua.
El tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, por lo que comprara  arana, piedra, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de un cuarto para su hijo.
 Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
La Señora. MELANIA DEL CARMEN Q. M. , Labora como Cocinera en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua. UNAN-Managua. El tiene un hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias al financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción, por lo que comprara arana, piedra, cemento y piedrin para la construcción de un cuarto para su hijo. Todo esto con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Sabath Solidarity Group

texts.en:
Nicholas is a 36-year-old man who describes himself as smart.  He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 1 and 10 years old. For the past 3 years, Nicholas has operated a trading business where he sells cassette tapes and compact discs.  He plans to use the loan to buy compact discs and cassette tapes in bulk.  Nicholas’ ambitious future goals include owning his own recording studio and a house in Kumasi.  Kumasi is the second largest city in Ghana and is known as the cultural center of Ghana.  

Currently, Nicholas is the leader of the group named 'Sabbath Solidarity Group'.  Nicholas believes he was elected group leader because he is a good coordinator.  There are 6 members in this group.  The other group members are traders and food processors. They anticipate receiving the loan to enable them to buy various kinds of stock to grow their business and provide adequate support to their families.

loans.use: To purchase cassette tapes and DCs in bulk

loans.name: Catherine

texts.fr: Née en 1975, Y. Catherine est mariée à HODEHOU Faustin, un menuisier. Catherine est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Catherine vit avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Sèkandji, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, depuis six ans. Catherine subvient ensemble avec son mari, aux divers besoins de la famille. Catherine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Catherine prépare et vend de la nourriture (« akassa », fait à base de maïs ; riz ; accompagné de poissons et d’ailerons frits) à Sèkandji. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Catherine achète ses produits. Catherine exerce cette activité depuis huit ans et est à son deuxième crédit à ALIDé. Le premier prêt que Catherine  avait obtenu a été bien remboursé. La clientèle de Catherine s’accroît au jour le jour et Catherine n’arrive plus à tous les satisfaire, en raison du peu de moyens financiers dont elle dispose. C’est donc pour renforcer son activité et faire face à la forte demande de sa clientèle que Catherine sollicite un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1975, Catherine Y. is married to Faustin Hodehou, a carpenter. Catherine is the mother of three children, all of whom are educated. Catherine has lived with her husband and children in the Sèkandji quarter, in the Sèmè-Podji,community, for six years. She and her husband support their family's diverse needs. Catherine did not go to school. To meet her needs, Catherine prepares and sells food ("akassa," made from a maize base, and rice with fried fish fin) in Sèkandji. Catherine buys her products In Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She has done this work for eight years and is on her second loan with ALIDé. The first loan which Catherine received has been repaid in full. Catherine's clientele is growing everyday, and she can no longer satisfy them all due to lack of financial means. Thus, to strengthen her business and meet the strong demand of her clientele, Catherine is asking for a second loan.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of maize, fish, fins, and condiments

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick O. O. is married and has three children between the ages of eight and one. His business is located at Kamkunji in Nairobi. He is a blacksmith who makes cookers, metal boxes, and other items. He sells the items to the local people. He has been in this business for the last nine years. He says that this business is profitable, but the major challenge is the high cost of raw materials. However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well.

He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy materials to make more items to grow his business. He describes himself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en: Warlita P. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin province. She is 41 years old. Warlita is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Warlita makes and sells food. The main source of income for her business comes from selling specialty food products in the local community. Warlita has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Warlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Warlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Warlita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Warlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Nhem

texts.en:
Nhem S., 58, is widowed and resides with her three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated area in the country. S. sells Cambodian traditional cakes, earning an income of USD 2 per day. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for one of the children to commute to work.

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to expand her current farming business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Haki Sawa Group

texts.en:
Zuhura Abdallah, age 33, is single and has two children ages 8 and 15 years.  She has operated a café business for 2 years now.  She works from 7am to 4 pm daily and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $129.

This will be Zuhura second motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  A Motisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  She used the previous motisha loan to increase on her business stock and she has paid back the loan successfully. She hopes for a new motisha loan to buy more items for her café such as utensils, chairs, rice and flour.   She hopes that her business continues to improve and grow, so that she can continue to help her family.  

Zuhura will share this loan with her loan group, Haki Sawa, which has 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.
In the picture, Zuhura is the woman wearing the plaid kilemba (hair wrap) with a white t-shirt, sitting in the front row.

loans.use: To buy utensils, chairs, flour and rice for cafe.

loans.name: Abisiba

texts.en:
Abisiba is a farmer from Kisii town in Western Kenya. She has been operating her mixed farm for over thirty years. Her main products are maize, tea leaves, bananas, millet and beans, which she sells at the local Magena market, Kenya Tea Development Authority and to other retailers. She also runs a hotel business in the same area.
 
Abisiba is 54 years old. She is married and has been blessed with eight children, now aged between 13 and 38 years. Two of the children attend school.  

Abisiba has requested her second loan from Juhudi Kilimo, of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to expand her cereal business. She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her to take her children to a better school and to provide for their basic needs. In the future, she intends to open up a big retail shop in her locality and, at the same time, expand her cereal store.

The challenges she faces in business are transport problems during the rainy season and unpredictable weather patterns affecting farm produce. She appreciates how far Juhudi has brought her and hopes that the partnership will continue.

loans.use: To expand her cereal business.

loans.name: Meu

texts.en: Meu F. is a 60 year old widowed mother caring for five children. All five children are still living in the family home and are employed in different jobs. Meu F. is a recycling seller--she buys used goods to sell to a wholesaler, who then sells the goods in bulk to other countries. The used goods she deals in are mostly leftover electrical wires. Meu F. is looking for a loan to use as capital to buy more stock to increase her profits. Meu F. will provide part of the loan she requested for her son to use as capital for his clothing business.

loans.use: To buy more stock to increase her profits.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 28-year-old married man with one child, who is attending school. He is the main income provider for his family and has ten years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm independently since 2003.

His specialization is using plastic tents to grow his products. These tents allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase an agricultural plow to cultivate his land.

loans.use: To purchase an agricultural plow

loans.name: Pirisila

texts.en: Pirisila A. is currently in the business of selling charcoal, sugar, tomatoes, etc.,  and is requesting a loan to improve on her stock. She is 50 years old and widowed. She has five children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a big shop.

loans.use: To increase her stock

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina has been living in an area of city Kasur named Kot Fateh Naaz Khan for more than 15 years with her family. Kasur is a small city of Punjab and is known for its leather industry in Pakistan. 
In order to help share her family's financial burden, Sakina operates her embroidery business by collecting orders from her neighboring clients. She completes a fully embroidered dress in 7 days and earns almost PKRs 500-700 profit on each dress. Her earning encourages her to work with more dedication and enthusiasm.  
Her husband, S. M., is a rickshaw driver by trade.  He provides transport services to his passengers and earns income for the family. 
She has given birth to three sons and three daughters. Her two elder sons are illiterate and do different works to financially support the family. Her eldest son performs his duty as a rickshaw driver. He drives a rickshaw on rent while the second son works at a gas station for a very little income. 
Due to their jobs, Sakina is able to send her younger children to school. She wishes that they could complete their education and make their futures bright.  
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son. With the loan, her son will buy a rickshaw. If he has his own rickshaw, he will be able to work longer hours and earn a good income. 
She is very hopeful that by purchasing a rickshaw for her son, her family’s living standard will be improved. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has proved herself as a responsible client and paid her installments on time.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Yoem C., 36, is a villager who lives in Kompong Tom Province. She and her husband (pictured in the photo) have a business of purchasing, at low cost, hair from women who have long hair, and reselling it at a profit to hairdressers and other salon shops in their community. They are blessed with one young child who is not yet enrolled in school. 

Yoem C. wishes to enlarge her business and is applying for a loan to purchase more hair to sell. This will allow her to increase her income to ensure that her entire family attains a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more hair to sell.

loans.name: Ligaya

texts.en:
Ligaya M. is a 41-year-old married woman and supports her family by operating one business venture: a fishing business.  She lives in Sitio Bulobito-on, Brgy. Miranda, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. 

By working hard in her fishing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Ligaya is now borrowing PHP 18,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment.   This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ligaya aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase fishing net and equipment for pumpboat

loans.name: Deyci

texts.es: Deyci, de 35 años, está casada con Abel, de 40 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Alexander, de 18, Erick, de 9 y Justo de 4 años de edad. En unión familiar ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Cajas. Está valiente mujer, hace algunos años se enfermó gravemente; pero pudo salir adelante y ahora con más fuerzas y ánimos, desea trabajar duro para incrementar las ventas de su negocio. Hace 15 años que tienen una pequeña tienda de venta de lana de diferentes colores. Los que vende por kilos a los compradores de su localidad, generando una ganancia diaria de 40 nuevos soles como mínimo.
