Su negocio es muy rentable, ya que la mayoría de los pobladores se dedican al tejido de diferentes prendas a base de lana e hilo de algodón; 2 veces al mes viaja a la capital de Lima, donde compra la lana por mayor y como buena comerciante aprovecha en comprar la artesanía que hacen sus vecinos, para revenderlos en la capital. Es el tercer crédito con MFP y como integrante nueva, se compromete en no defraudar la confianza que le dio su banco comunal. De obtener el crédito está pensando invertir, en la compra de más mercadería con nuevos e innovadores colores, los que le servirán para surtir su tienda.
texts.en: Deyci is 35 years old and married to Abel who is 40 years old. They have three children: Alexander (18), Erick (9), and Justo (4). As a family group they live in a rented house, which is located in San Pedro de Cajas. This admirable woman, who was gravely ill a few years ago, continues to move forward. Now, with a lot of energy and enthusiasm, she would like to increase the sales of her business. For the past fifteen years they (she and her husband) have had a small store where they sell many colors of wool. They sell it by kilos to the buyers in their area. This generates an income of at least 40 soles a day. Her business is profitable. The majority of the inhabitants in her town weave different garments with a wool base and cotton thread. Two times a month Deyci travels to Lima where she buys wool wholesale. Like a good businesswoman, she also buys the crafts of her neighbors and sells them in the capital. This is her third loan with MFP and as a new member she promises not to betray the confidence of the community bank. After obtaining the loan she would like to use it to buy more merchandise with new and innovative colors. This will give more variety to the products in her store.

loans.use: She will buy many colors of wool.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 34 años, es soltero, vive en la cñia. Mcal. López de la ciudad de Piribebuy con sus padres. 
Pedro es comerciante desde hace más de 4 años, se dedica a la venta de ropas en forma ambulante, realizando sus ventas y cobranzas en una motocicleta que adquirió gracias al esfuerzo y dedicación que le imprime a su actividad, cuenta con clientela formada con aproximadamente 700 clientes, quienes constantemente acuden a él para solicitarle algún tipo de prenda de vestir que está acorde a la moda o el gusto de cada uno de ellos.
Con el préstamo que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo renovar su stock para estar acorde a la estación entrante (verano), entre otros productos para poder hacer frente a los numerosos pedidos que tenia.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva por el apoyo y la confianza que han depositado en él.
texts.en:
Pedro is 34 years old, single and lives with his parents in the Mariscal Lopez neighborhood of the city of Piribebuy.

For the past four years, Pedro has been selling clothing from door to door. He makes sales and collections on his motorcycle, which he was able to acquire thanks to the effort and dedication he puts into his work. He has a well-established client base of about 700 people, who recur to him regularly to request items of clothing that are in style or to their liking.

With the loan he received from Fundación Paraguaya, Pedro renewed his stock with trends for the summer season, among other products, in order to fulfill the many orders he had received. He thanks Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the support provided and the trust they have shown in him.

loans.use: Buy summer clothing like jerseys, dresses and shorts

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania, de 42 años, se separó de su esposo hace un año; pero a pesar de los problemas y conflictos, ella trabaja con mucho esfuerzo para cuidar de su hija Aime, de 10 años de edad, con quien vive en una casa alquilada ubicada en la ciudad de La Merced. Está trabajadora mujer que a pesar de los inconvenientes sufridos, continúa trabajando arduamente, pues según menciona quiere ser una mujer independiente y con mucha proyección para el futuro. Hace un año comenzó con el negocio de un locutorio, donde las personas realizan llamadas a diferentes lugares del Perú y del mundo; este negocio le resulta muy rentable, ya que su tienda de servicios está ubicada en una zona estratégica. Tania, menciona también que está pensando comprar la parte de inversión de su socia, con la que puso su negocio de locutorio, y de esa manera no depender de nadie, ella está segura que con el apoyo de su hijo Harry, que trabaja en la capital, podrá lograr esté objetivo. Esté es el séptimo crédito con MFP, y se siente agradecida por todo el apoyo que recibe de parte de los integrantes de su banco comunal. De adquirir el crédito que solicita, implementará su negocio de más cabinas telefónicas.
texts.en:
Tania is 42 years old.  She separated from her husband a year ago.  However, in spite of the problems and difficulties, she works very hard to care for her 10 year-old daughter Aime, with whom she lives in a rented house in the town of La Merced.

This hard-working woman, in spite of the difficulties she has suffered, continues working hard since she says that she would like to be an independent woman and she has a lot of plans for the future.  One year ago she started running a public telephone business where people make calls to different places in Peru and elsewhere in the world.  This business is very profitable since her premises are in a strategic location.

Tania mentions that she is thinking of buying out her partner in her public telephone business so that she doesn't have to depend on anybody.  She is certain that with the support of her son Harry, who lives in the capital, she will be able to achieve this goal.

This is Tania's seventh loan from MFP and she feels grateful for all the support that she receives from the other members of her community bank.  She will use her loan to install mO. telephone booths in her business.

loans.use: To install more telephone booths in her business

loans.name: Maria Aracely

texts.es:
Maria Aracely Z. B. tiene 31 años de edad. Es soltera vive con los hijos  en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia Los Ríos, Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. JESUS NOS AMA se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto los Amarillos, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Maria Aracely se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz, cacao desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Agripac Eicopa, y  vende en la feria en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, arroz, Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es darles el estudio a sus 2 hijos.

Le gusta la lectura.
texts.en:
Maria Aracely Z. B. is 31 years old. She is single and she lives with her children in the city of Ventanas, in the province of Los Rios. She has 2 children. 

The community bank named "Jesus Loves Us" is located in the community of Los Amarillos in the city of Ventanas. This group is dedicated to short-cycle agriculture, planting corn and rice. They have been practicing this business for a long time. 

Maria Aracely is an agriculturist who has been harvesting corn, rice, and cocoa for the past 5 years. She purchases her products at Agripac Eicopa and she carries out her sales at the fair in Ventanas. 

She requests a loan to purchase agricultural products and fertilizers which she needs to cultivate corn and rice. The support of this loan is a financial help to supply her needs. She faces challenges such as plagues, disease, and the changing weather. Her dream is to keep her children in school. 

She enjoys reading.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural products and fertilizers.

loans.name: Say

texts.en:
Mrs. Say P., who was born in 1974, lives in Angkonh village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Somreth Som, are farmers who own a 1-hectare plot of land where they grow rice to sell to support their family. He is a village chief too.

Currently, she wants to start a new business, but her savings is not enough. So, Mrs. Say P. is applying for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is raising four children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factories, and the others attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Zenaida Ciria

texts.es: La Sra. Zenaida Ciria M. D. P. vive junto a su esposo. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el distrito D. Santiago. La Sra. Zenaida se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes desD. hace varios años. Gracias a su empeño a logrado tener este negocio. Su esposo tambien se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes. La Sra. Zenaida a logrado tener este negocio gracias a su empeño y dedicación. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar un nuevo local en el centro D. la zona. La Sra. Zenaida está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zenaida Ciria M. D. P. lives with her husband.  She has a house of her own in Santiago district.  Zenaida has been selling groceries for several years.  Thanks to her effort she has managed to have this business.  Her husband is also a grocer.  Zenaida has managed to have the business thanks to her effort and dedication.

She needs a loan to buy a new locale in the center of the zone.  Zenaida is very grateful for whatever support we may be able to proviD..

loans.use: To buy a new sales stall.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suon, born in 1945, is a farmer who owns a rice field plot where she grows rice to earn a living. Currently, she wants to grow rice in the dry season but doesn’t have enough money to do this. She has therefore asked for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire farm workers in order to support her crop.

Mrs. Suon is a widow with one child, who helps her with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide and hire farm workers.

loans.name: Mwalungo

texts.en:
Mwalungo M., a 56-year-old resident of Shanzu, is married to Salama Kadzo and they have been blessed with six children. For the past 10 years, Mwalungo has run a retail shop whose profits have enabled him to provide for his family’s needs.

He has now applied for his second loan from KADET with which he plans to purchase sugar, paraffin, rice and cooking oil for his shop. He will direct the anticipated profits to his children’s education. His dream is to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, paraffin, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang is a married woman who was born in 1987. She and her husband have two children, both of whom are too young to work or study. To earn a living, she is a chicken breeder and a farmer. Indeed, she owns a half-hectare plot of land, on which she grows rice. She explains that she sells some of the rice she grows to local customers and keeps the rest of the rice to feed her family. Her husband, Mr. Phoeun, is a fisherman and a construction worker.

Although she and her husband work very hard, they are not generating as much income as they would like. So, to improve their standard of living, Mrs. Neang would like to start a new pig breeding business. As a result, she is applying for a loan in the amount of $375 to buy some piglets and pig feed, and any remaining balance of the loan proceeds would be used to buy more chickens.

loans.use: To purchase piglets, pig feed, and chickens

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en: Clovice is a fifty-year-old married man with four children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is his family's sole supporter, and his desire is to educate his children up to the university level. He has been selling popcorn for ten years and the business is profitable. His biggest challenge is that supplies are low and prices are high due to drought. His desire is to own a food store. Clovice needs the loan to buy popcorn to sell.

loans.use: to buy popcorn to sell

loans.name: La Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Una alcancía con nuevos objetivos y nuevas metas, así se caracteriza la alcancía comunal La Nueva Esperanza integrada por 8 miembros hace más de un año. Cada integrante se identifica por la fortaleza y el entusiasmo por salir siempre adelante tal es así el caso de la señora Enma Natividad de 50 años de edad casada y con dos hijos. Ella se dedica diariamente a la venta de Ropa para niños desde hace 20 años y con el esfuerzo de tantos años de trabajo ha logrado obtener una casa propia y también puede compartir ahora los gastos del hogar con su esposo. Con el reciente préstamo lo invertirá para compra de  ropa de mujer por la campaña del Día de la Madre. En el futuro  le gustaría comprarse un auto para ponerlo a trabajar como taxi y a si mejorar su condición económica trayendo mejores ingresos a su hogar.
texts.en: A communal bank with new objectives and new goals -- that description characterizes the "Nueva Esperanza" ["New Hope"] communal bank, made up of 8 members and existing for more than a year. Each member can be identified by her strength and enthusiasm for continuous progress. This is the case with Enma Natividad, age 50, who is married with two children. She works every day selling children's clothing. She has done this work for 20 years, and with the efforts of so many years of work, she has been able to acquire her own home and also she can share the household expenses with her husband. She will use this loan to invest in buying women's clothing for the Mother's Day sales campaign. In the future, she would like to buy a car and use it to provide taxi services, thus bringing a higher income to her household and improving her economic condition.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina D. is now 38 years old and married with three school-aged children. Josefina is a farmer working in the Philippines. She earns PHP 13,000 per month. 

Josefina is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. She grows corn on her plantation and has been doing this for almost eight years.

In the future, Josefina hopes to produce a high quantity of corn and earn a higher income to finance the education of their children. She believes that with her strong determination, she hopes that they can improve their living conditions andt that their children will have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti is a married woman who has children, all of whom attend school.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.  She owns a house that lacks electricity and water.  

For the past 20 years, Binti has owned and operated a kindergarten for children from the neighboring community.  She also sells khangas, which provides her with an additional source of income.  Binti dreams of expanding her school and having it become the best area school in the future. 

Binti joined Yehu to access funds that will help her boost her business.  The Kshs 50,000 loan will allow her to purchase chairs for the school and khangas and coconuts to sell.

loans.use: to purchase chairs for her school and khangas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas, es socia del Banco Comunal Palmeras, tiene 61 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos. Es feriante, venD. ropa, el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. ropa para surtir su mercadería.
Felicitas viaja a la feria D. Allpachaca y Rumiwari donD. venD. ropa y en las ferias compra cereales, animales menores y los venD. entre sus caseras en Ayacucho. Ingresó a FINCA Perú, por la invitación D. su hermana. Le gusta porque le prestan dinero y le enseñan a ahorrar y trabajar a tener buenas relaciones con sus familia se practica la puntualidad, respeto. Su sueño es poder construir su casa.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the communal bank "PALMERAS".  She is 61, married and has five children. She works as a clothing vendor and is requesting a loan to buy clothing to add to her merchandise inventory.

Felicitas travels to the fairs in Allpachaca and Rumiwari where she sells clothing and buys cereal and small animals to sell in the Ayacucho rural areas.  She was invited to join FINCA Perú by her sister.  She likes being a part of it because she has access to loans, learns how to save, and how to relate to family based on punctuality and respect.  Her dream is to build her own house.

loans.use: To buy a variety of clothing.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: Cesar de 27 años, reside en el caserío de Antabamba, ahí formó su familia junto a Soledad, su esposa hace 2 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijas: Nicol y Sherly, a las que cuidan con mucho amor en su casa propia. Con la vitalidad de todo joven, él se dedica a varias actividades durante el día. Desde joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra, según cuenta a sus cortos 14 años comenzó a producir en los terrenos agrícolas que le heredó su padre. Con el tiempo mejoró sus cultivos con más productos, como: papa, arveja, olluco y habas. Los cuales cuida con mucha dedicación; le gusta arar la tierra para poder esparcir las semillas que crecerán en los próximos meses. Más le disgusta tener que regatear los precios en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde vende lo que ha cosechado. Asimismo se dedica a la ganadería, con lo que cuenta con 4 vacas lecheras, y consecuentemente elabora 4 moldes de queso al día, vendiéndolos los días jueves y viernes en las ferias comerciales que se realizan dentro de su comunidad. Paralelo a esa actividad se dedica al cuidado de 8 ovejas, que los engorda para luego vender su carne a un mayor precio entre los carniceros del lugar. Le va muy bien en sus diversos negocios, por eso más adelante desea ahorrar el dinero suficiente para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.  Él pertenece al banco comunal “Los pinos de Antabamba” y este será su segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera obtener el apoyo financiero para el logro de sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Cesar, de obtener su apoyo invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 5 bolsas de abono orgánico para distribuirlos en sus cultivos de arveja, que están creciendo sin inconvenientes.
texts.en: 27 year old Cesar lives in the hamlet of Antabamba where he has started a family with Soledad, his wife of 3 years. They have 2 daughters: Nicol and Sherly, who they are bringing up with great love in their own home. With the vitality of youth, he works at a variety of jobs during the day. He learnt to farm when he was young, and when he was only 14 he began farming the land that he inherited from his father. With time, he added new products to his harvest, such as: potatoes, peas, a root vegetable called olluco, and beans. He tends this with great dedication: he likes to plow the earth and sow the seeds that will grow in the following months. He doesn't like having to haggle over the prices in the main market in the town of Tarma, where he sells his produce. At the same time, he also raises livestock and has 4 milk cows. He makes 4 cheeses a day and sells them on Thursdays and Fridays in the markets that are held in his community. In parallel to this, he has 8 sheep which he is fattening to later sell for their meat at a good price to the local butchers. He is doing very well with his various businesses and he wants to save enough money to offer his children a better standard of living. He belongs to the community bank "Los Pinos de Antabamba" and this will be his second loan from MFP, from where he hopes to get the financial support to achieve his objectives. He promises to make the repayments on his loan once a month, as he did with previous loans. Cesar will use the money to buy 5 sacks of organic fertilizer to put on his pea crop, which is growing without problems.

loans.use: to buy 5 sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials such as filler, paint, thinner, hand tools, etc.

loans.name: Jhonna

texts.en:
Jhonna is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with one child.  Jhonna has a shop that sells breads, candies & snacks. She has had this business for 5 years.

She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Jhonna has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jhonna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is the mother of two school-aged children. She is 38 years old and married to a farmer. For the last 14 years, she and her husband have supported their family by growing a large rice crop. They usually earn a profit of PHP 30,000 per crop during the wet season on 1.5 hectares of land. For nine years, Elvira helped support her family by working overseas as a caregiver, but eventually decided it would be better to live at home and help manage the family business. She is applying for a loan for PHP 27,000 to buy supplies for her farm, including fertilizer, seeds, insecticides and herbicides.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her rice farm.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is an honest 51-year-old business man. He is married, and blessed with four children of whom two are in school. For the last 15 years he has been running a chemist's shop to make ends meet. In the next five years he wants to become a major distributor of medicine. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy medicine for his shop. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he has been able to learn business management skills.

loans.use: to buy more medicines.

loans.name: Sabine Wendpouiré

texts.fr:
Mme Sabine Wendpouiré est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 16ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. Tous les 04 vont à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Elle est restauratrice depuis 03ans. Mme s’approvisionne au yaar de nagrin en ville à Ouagadougou. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes et les enfants.

Elle veut s’acheter 01 marmite, un foyer à gaz et 04 grandes casseroles.

Mme économise pour ouvrir d’autres restaurants annexes. Elle ambitionne assurer l’avenir de ses enfants à travers la scolarisation et construire une maison d’habitation pour soi-même.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sabine Wendpouiré is married with four dependent children. The oldest is 16 years old, and the youngest is 6. All four children go to school. 

She has been working in the restaurant business for three years. She gets her supplies at the market of Nagrin, in the city of Ouagadougou. Her customers are women, men and children.

She wants to buy one stockpot, a gas fireplace, and four large pots.

Mrs. Sabine is saving her money to open other restaurants. She intends to provide for her children’s education and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy one stockpot, a gas fireplace and four large pots

loans.name: Colette

texts.en: Colette is 32 years old and has a six-year-old child. She has owned and run her restaurant for seven years. This restaurant has enabled her meet the needs of her family and pay her child’s school fees. Colette needs a loan to buy food for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy food to stock her restaurant.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.ru:
Сергей – женат, у него двое взрослых детей. Сергей держит свой магазин бытовой химии в городе Мелитополе. У него в магазинчике всегда можно найти самый разнообразный ассортимент мыломоющих средств по сходной цене, что неизменно привлекает все новых покупателей. Сергей начал свое дело еще 17 лет назад. С тех пор его бизнес значительно вырос и ему даже удалось приобрести собственный магазин. 

Сергей планирует использовать кредит в 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить дополнительное количество средств бытовой химии, а именно зубных паст, стиральных порошков, мыла, гелей для мытья посуды, чистящих средств и т.п. для последующей реализации в своем магазине. Вместе с женой, которая активно помогает Сергею в бизнесе, торгуя на центральном городском рынке, они планируют и в дальнейшем развивать свое дело и получать стабильный доход для содержания своей семьи. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Sergei is married and has two grown children.  He has a household products store in the town of Melitopol.  One can always find a varied assortment of cleaning supplies at affordable prices at his store, which continues to attract new customers.  Sergei started his business 17 years ago.  Since then, his business grew significantly, and he was even able to purchase his own store.  Sergei plans to use the 20 000 hryvnia loan to buy an additional inventory of household cleaning supplies, especially toothpaste, laundry detergent, soap, dish washing liquid, cleaning supplies and such, for a subsequent sale at his store.  Together with his wife, who actively helps Sergei in this business, and selling at the central city market, they plan to further develop their business and earn a stable income to support their family.

loans.use: to buy an additional inventory of household cleaning supplies, especially toothpaste, laundry detergent, soap, dish washing liquid, cleaning supplies and such

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54 years old and owns a motorcycle, which her husband has been operating for almost a year. She can manage to drive it but due to her older age, she gave the permission to her husband to handle her motorcycle. As of now, they are earning P300 per day which they usually use to buy their daily needs such as food.	

Rebecca wants to increase their everyday income but because of deterioration to her motorcycle, they have little opportunity to acquire a higher income. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of P7,000 to buy new tires and as maintenance for her motorcycle.


She hopes this will lead to improving their income in order to provide for all their needs as well as to uplift their underprivileged lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy new tires and utilize the rest for maintenance for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 38 year old married woman with one child, who is in school. She has a business of selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years. Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to allow her to purchase more charcoal for sale. The extra income from this loan will be used to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Она трудолюбивая и добросовестная женщина. Её муж уехал в Россию, чтобы зарабатывать денег на содержании семьи. Более 14 лет Саида занимается купля продажей женских одежд и нижнее белье. Раньше она помогала сестре, а потом открыла свою торговую точку. Постепенно расширила свой бизнес, и  сегодняшний день имеет дополнительные торговые точки там, где работают 5 человек. Для дочки создала рабочее место, и она рада об своих успехах. Благодаря «Имон Интернэшнл» и Киве она достигла много успехов и от всей души благодарит всех вас за вашу поддержку и помощь. Саида запрашивает займ для покупки женских одежд.
texts.en: Saida is married and is the loving mother of three children. She is hard-working, honestt woman. Her husband went to Russia to earn money to support the family. For more than 14 years, Saida has worked as a retailer of women's clothes and undergarments. At first, she helped her sister, and then opened her own stall. Gradually she grew her business and today has additional retail locations, employing five people. She has created a job for her daughter, and is happy with her achievements. Thanks to IMON International and Kiva she has succeeded in many ventures. From her heart, she thanks all of you for your support and your help. Saida would like a loan to purchase women's clothing for retail.

loans.use: to purchase women's clothing for retail

loans.name: Madres Unidas Group

texts.es: El  Sr. Cesar es conviviente,  tienes 1 hijos en edad escolar,  actualmente es integrante  en la alcancía comunal “Madres unidas”  grupo  conformado por  10  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.  Cesar  se dedica al reciclaje de plasticos, botellas y carton para venderlo en fabricas, cesar trabaja en un triciClo recogiendo plasticos, botellas y carton por las calle, cesar nos cuenta que es un trabajo muy duro pero todo lo hace por su hijo y sus esposa aunque su  esposa trabaja y se apoyan mutuamente, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, su hijo va a la escuela y sobre todo cuentan con una mejor calidad de vida , con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para dar mantenimiento a su triciclo. Sabemos que Cesar cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Mr. Cesar has a common-law partner and a son in school.  He is a member of the communal bank "Madres Unidas" which is comprised of ten members who are involved in different commercial activities.  Cesar recycles plastic, bottles and cardboard and sells it to factories.  He uses a tricycle cart to collect the plastic, bottles and cardboard in the street.  He works very hard for his son and wife, although his wife also works and they support each other mutually.  Through their hard work and dedication they have been able to improve their income.  Their son goes to school and they have a better lifestyle.  In order to continue growing the business has has requeted a new loan to provide maintenance for his tricycle cart.  We know that Cesar will reach his goals through work and much effort, and that the Edaprospo loans will help him.

loans.use: To maintain a tricycle cart.

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband who drives a wagon used to transport people for profit. With the loan, he will repair his wagon because its engine is creating problems and needs to be repaired.  By repairing his wagon, he will be able to run his wagon more smoothly and provide better transport services to his passengers.

Zarina is very supportive by nature and makes handkerchiefs.  She sells these handkerchiefs to different stores in the city for reasonably good profits. Zarina is very caring and started her business because her husband was not able to afford the living expenses of their family.

She is the mother of five children.  Her elder son is married and also a driver by profession.  Both of her daughters help her make handkerchiefs and her two other sons are students.

Zarina is a new loan applicant and very hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his income and that she will save some profits every month for her daughter’s marriage.

loans.use: to repair wagon for transport business.

loans.name: Musaka Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Musaka SHG Group in Western Kenya! Fitea is the facilitator of the Musaka SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Fitea takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Fitea had a good maize yield harvesting 9 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, she was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fitea and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance. 

With income from maize sales, Fitea will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Musaka SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Nduku

texts.en: Nduku is 40 years old, married, and has four children. To earn a living, she runs a cafeteria. She has been in the business for three years and has employed two people.  She also does livestock farming to supplement her income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans easily which has helped her to grow her business.  She has requested for 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to renovate her business premises and buy ingredients such as sugar, maize flour, rice, and cooking fat.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises and buy ingredients such as sugar, maize flour, rice, and cooking fat

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah is the mother of five children, ranging in age from 2 to 14 years. She has been engaged in mixed farming in her rural home for 5 years. Her maize and vegetable produce are sold within the local markets. She is also a dealer in second-hand clothes.

Dinah has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help her venture into dairy farming by buying and insuring a dairy cow. She says the cow's milk will help supplement family meals as well as boost her income to meet other needs. She also hopes she will be able to start a poultry business and to expand her farm. Dinah, however, laments the high cost of farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jalolidin

texts.ru: Чалолидин проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 42 года. У него четверо детей. Его жена работает учительницей. Сам он предоставляет услугу, такси. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для ремонта машины и установки оборудования для природного газа.
texts.en: Jalolidin lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 42 years old and has four children.  His wife is a teacher.   Jalolidin provides taxi service and has done this for four years.  He is taking out a loan for car repairs and to install a natural gas conversion kit.

loans.use: to install a natural gas conversion kit

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is a 19 year old single woman from Al Hashmi Amman Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 JD to pay for clothes such as children, women and boys clothes to sell in the same her area but she wants in the future to open a small shop also she would like to increase her family income.
Since Sara is under 30 year old, her loan is considered a youth loan.
Sara is a conservative woman,she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her brother

loans.use: to pay for clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO HAVE AN EYES SURGERY

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.en:
My name is Rosa H.. I sell consumer products. I´ve had my business for 4 years. I have the help of my children to sell the products. I have lots of good clients since I sell quality products at accessible prices. My business generates income to support my family. My goal is to increase my inventory and with the earnings that I obtain to be able to remodel my house, feed my family and give my children a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Rosa H., tengo mi negocio desde hace 4 años, tengo la ayuda de mis hijos para la venta de los productos, mis clientes son buenos ya que vendo productos de calidad a unos precios acesibles, mi negocio me genera ingresos para el sustento de mi familia, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario y con las ganancias que obtenga poder remodelar mi habitación, alimentar a mi familia y darles a mis hijos un buen estudio.

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes, chiles, tomatoes, bananas, coffee, sweet bread, sauces, instant soups, spices, salt, rice, beans, onions, carrots, eggs and churros.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela sells sweets and candy from a stand in the street, like many merchants in Bolivia. Her sales stand is located on America Street in the city of La Paz. She is 52 years old and has been self-employed for more than 10 years. She has 4 children and her husband is a bricklayer.

This is the second time that Rafaela has come to Impro for a loan. Her case history in the institution describes her as "client 1": excellent fulfillment of her obligation to repay her loan. The loan for which she is currently applying will be used to urgently rebuild a retaining wall in her home, which is located on the western slope of the city of La Paz (the poorest part of the city). The intense rains have knocked down the retaining wall of her home.

Her work and her previous credit history with Impro allow her access to this loan, since she has experience in her business, which will bring the earnings to repay the loan.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Rafaela, se dedica a la venta de dulces y golosinas en un puesto de la C., como muchos pequeños comerciantes en Bolivia.Su puesto de venta se halla ubicado en la C. América de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella tiene 52 años y trabaja por cuenta propia hace mas de 10 años, tiene 4 hijos y su esposo es obrero albañil.

Esta es la 2da vez que recurre a Impro para obtener un crédito.Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento excelente en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado a la urgente refacción de un muro de contención de su vivienda ubicada en la ladera Oeste de la ciudad de La Paz (la más pobre de esta ciudad), debido a que por causa de las intensas lluvias se le ha derrumbado el muro que su vivienda tenía. Su trabajo, y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito de emergencia, ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Repair damage to her home caused by the effects of the rainy season

loans.name: Evgeniya

texts.en:
Evgeniya owns a rapidly growing business selling towels and table cloths. She has been in business for three years and has proven to be a very sharp business owner. In those three years she has expanded from one to four sales locations. She now employs three salespeople, and her husband, Valeriy, also helps with the business. There is not a lot of competition for Evgeniya’s products, as is often the case with many other market vendors. This has allowed her to earn a little more income and afford to expand. At one location, she was able to purchase a storage container rather than rent another facility. She is now able to invest more money in the business instead of paying rent. Another way she has been able to save money is to buy inventory directly from manufacturers rather than from middlemen suppliers.

Evgeniya has requested a loan to help her purchase an additional sales kiosk. She found one not far from one of her other kiosks that she’d like to use to grow her business even further. Evgeniya loves what she is doing and is looking forward to the future. She and her husband are grateful for the opportunity this business has given, not only to provide for themselves, but also to help their children and grandchildren.

loans.use: Purchase additional location

loans.name: Younous

texts.en:
This is a group loan to be shared by the five women of the Daw Thiow association, led by Younous D.. In their loan application, the group described their business as follows:

“Background: The Daw Thiow group is a group of young tailors in Oussouye who have long been active in local development, having chosen as their business sewing and the sale of clothing.

Objective: To contribute to the care of our families and assure continued development of our association.

Business activities: Purchase of cloth and production of clothing for sale in the local community and region.”

Background

Senegal is one of the world’s poorest countries, yet its solid democratic tradition and highly developed associational life distinguish it from other countries in its income group. Especially remarkable are Senegal’s networks of rotating savings and credit associations, known as tontines. Commonly organized by groups of twenty to thirty housewives who live in the same village, the tontines provide poor women throughout the country with small loans to finance modest income-generating activities. Repayment rates within these associations are excellent, because they are based on local reputation and personal trust between the members. However, their financial resources are limited to the contributions of their members, frequently subsistence farmers with very little disposable income. This has prevented the traditional tontines from meeting the demand for rural microenterprise loans and restricted their impact on the economic development of their communities. The SEM Fund works to bridge this gap by linking traditional village credit associations with outside sources of finance.

Original French business description:

«Contexte : : Le groupement Daw Thiow est un groupement des jeunes tailleurs Oussouye qui travail depuis très longtemps dans le cadre de développement et Ayant choisit pour activité ; la couture et l’exposition vente..

Objectif : Contribuer à la gestion de nos familles et assoire une bonne politique de développement dans notre entourage.

Activités : Achat de tissus et confection d’habit vendu dans la commune et dans le département»

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, lace, etc. for traditional clothing production

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has a little business selling a variety of items. She sells beautiful pictures, clocks, batteries and small gadgets. She is an experienced entrepreneur, having been in business for ten years. Elena originally started her business at a market right by the apartment where she lived. She now has a sales location at the large central market in Melitopol. Elena is married with two daughters and is a dedicated mother. One of the goals she has for her business is to make enough so that she can help her children.

Elena has requested a loan of $800 so that she can purchase new inventory to sell. She has been a great client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past. All of her loans have been repaid with no delays. We are happy for this new opportunity to assist Elena as she continues to develop her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. R. Lun was married in 1975 and has 4 sons and 5 daughters. She started her farming business in 1990. She plants vegetables and bananas. In addition, she also raises a few cows at home. Her husband also farms with his wife and looks after the cows.

She has borrowed money from MAXIMA three times. She is now requesting a loan in the amount of $900. She will use this money to purchase a cow to raise and use in her farming activities.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Abra K. is 48 years old and the wife of a polygamist. She has 3 children and looks after the family’s expenses and schooling. She has been retailing pagnes (strips of traditional printed African fabric used to wrap around the body to form a short skirt) for 15 years and almost all her income comes from this activity. She knows the business inside out. Her clientele is growing significantly. She would like to use this loan to increase her stock of merchandise. Mrs. K. has been a client of FECECAV for 3 years. She has had 3 loans and has repaid all of them successfully.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Abra K. est âgée de 48 ans et femme d'un mari polygamme. Elle a 3 enfants et les charges familiales et scolaires sont prises par elle. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes depuis 15 ans et la quasi totalité de ses revenus proviennent de son activité. Elle maîtrise bien le secteur de pagnes(tissus imprimés). Elle a une clientèle en pleine croissance. Avec cet emprunt elle désire augmenter son stocks de marchandises. Madame Abra est cliente de FECECAV depuis 3 ans . Elle a bénéficié de 3 crédit et tous ont été remboursé avec succès.

loans.use: To buy 2 bundles of traditional cloth (containing 120 pieces each) to sell at retail

loans.name: Kazinga B(I) Group

texts.en: Federsi is a 45 year old woman. She currently handles poultry as her job. She plans to start up her own market stall with the extra profits.

loans.use: To help their poultry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his business selling green maize

loans.name: Khamida

texts.en:
Khamida is 25 years old and is married. Khamida is a cloth seller; she started this clothing business in 2007. Everyday, she works from 6am to 6pm and earn an average monthly profit of $230 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for this business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Eim

texts.en:
Mrs. Eim P., 53, is a farmer in Kampong Svay Village and she has three children, two of whom work in a factory while the other looks after cows. Her husband, Chhieng Pal, is also a subsistence farmer who usually cultivates the field with his wife. The family income is generated from cultivating and selling bananas and from the children's salary.

So far Mrs. Em P. has been funded by other MFIs and she got loans to cultivate rice. Last year she was ill and she spent around $12 per time on medicines. Presently, she is in good health and can work again; however, her cultivatable land is not fertile and thus she needs to ask for a loan to buy more fertilizers to support the field. Her husband is on the left on the photo.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizer.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
A. Doris prepares a native food called fante kenkey. Maize is used in the preparation of fante kenkey. It is highly desired by the natives of both western and central regions of the country. She is married and has 6 dependants.

Her business is doing very well, and she wants to increase her production and sales. She is running out of ingredients for her making fante kenkey. She is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients for producing more kenkey to sell.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for making fante kenkey

loans.name: Lachin

texts.en: Lachin was born in 1978. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli. She is now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the village of Ahmadalilar. Lachin is single. Four years ago she started a business. She needs a loan of $975 to buy goods to improve her business.

loans.use: Buy goods for her store.

loans.name: Viviane

texts.fr:
Viviane A. was born on December 2, 1974 in Cotonou and is the mother of two children, Christiane (age 10) and Ariane (age 3), who are both in school. She is married to T. Justin ZOUNDA, a tile mason, and has been residing in Sènadé, a working-class district of Cotonou, for two years. Her business of six years has been in selling school supplies, damask fabrics, shoes, and ladies' bags. Currently, this business enables her to support household expenses, since her husband was a victim of a traffic accident. Ms. Viviane A. is on her third loan and has always demonstrated her credibility. She isn't currently managing to meet customer demand, which grows continuously, which is why she is requesting this loan in order to meet the expectations of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Dame A. Viviane est née le 02/12/1974 à Cotonou et est mère de 2 enfants Christiane âgée de 10 ans et Ariane âgée de 3 ans toutes scolarisées. Elle est mariée à ZOUNDA T. Justin carreleur et réside à Sènadé un quartier populaire de la ville Cotonou depuis 2 ans. Elle exerce comme activité la vente de fournitures scolaires, de tissu basin et des chaussures et sacs dame il y a 6 ans. Cette activité lui permet actuellement de supporter les charges du foyer parce que son époux a été victime d’un accident de circulation. Dame A. Viviane est à son troisième crédit et s’est toujours montrée crédible. Actuellement, elle n’arrive pas à répondre à la demande de ses clients qui ne cesse de s’accroître, raison pour laquelle elle sollicite ce prêt afin de satisfaire ses clients.

loans.use: To buy school supplies and 4 damask outfits

loans.name: Muon

texts.en:
Muon S., 20, is married and lives with her little child in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She runs a business selling grocery products in front of her house. On average, she makes $5 in profit a day. Her husband earns approximately $5 a day as well from his motor-taxi.

Muon would like to borrow money from Kiva via Credit, Kiva's local partner, to purchase a trailer to attach to their motorbike. In Cambodia, we call a motorbike with a trailer attached a “tuk tuk”. Most of the foreigners who visit Cambodia prefer to get a tuk tuk rather than riding on a simple motor-taxi. In the future, Muon plans to expand her store by diversifying her product range.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer to attach to a motorbike

loans.name: Almas

texts.en: Almas is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Kalbadjar region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan and has settled in Baku city. She was born in 1955. Almas has been in the bread-baking business for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of US$ 1200 to buy more of the necessary products for baking  bread.

loans.use: to buy more of the necessary raw materials for baking  bread

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel O. is 50 years old and he is married with six children. He sells spare motor parts. He travels to Onitsha main market to purchase the parts which he then sells in Benin city. He also has a bus that he uses for commercial purposes. He is seeking a loan of 425 USD to buy more spare parts to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more motor spare parts to sell

loans.name: Ashura's Group

texts.en:
Ashura Z. has been preparing and selling small food items in the Darajabovu neighborhood of Zanzibar for six years. She works for twelve hours every day and earns a profit of approximately $135 each month. She has previously taken out one loan from BRAC Tanzania which she repaid successfully and on time. She is requesting her second loan so that she can buy more ingredients and increase her sales and profit. If this loan helps her to expand her business, she intends to use the increased profits to reinvest in her business so that it can continue to grow.

Ashura is 38 years old, widowed, and has two children, aged 4 and 7. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members who also have their own small businesses in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for the foods she prepares and sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase flour and other items to sell in shop

loans.name: Filida's Group

texts.en:
M. Filida is 48 years old. She is married, with 6 children between 20 and 30 years of age. She also has 9 dependents, including one adopted child who is 6 years old.

Filida is a fish monger on Lake Victoria. She sells her fish at Mpunge–Buleebi Kachanga. Thanks to previous loans, she also has 12 cows and sells 40 litres of milk per week for additional income. Her specific purpose for this loan is to buy more fish nets to meet the demands in both the local and foreign markets, and to buy more cows to provide milk to sell. Filida is a member of Tumwesige women’s group in Lugazi.

loans.use: More fish nets for her business.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang T., 29, pictured with her husband, is married and lives with her husband in the district of Bati, in the province of Takeo. She stays at home and weaves scarves to earn a living and is able to make $5 per day. Her husband, Phon Sopheap, 29, is a local teacher and make $5 per day as well. This couple together has three school-aged children. Mrs. Seang T. is asking for a loan to purchase more silk to weave more scarves in the future.

loans.use: To purchase silk.

loans.name: Super Group

texts.en:
Ferdinand sells clothing, watches, necklaces and school stationery. Before moving to Kinshasa, he taught in the Equator province in the DRCongo.  In 1987 he started his first business with a working capital of US$ 15. He was selling sugar, salt, soaps, toilet paper, candles, matches and so on in his village. From 1987 to 1997, his business was prosperous and he increased his working capital to US$ 400. 

From 1997 to 2000, the Equator province was invaded by the war from eastern Congo, and people were forced to leave their homes. He and his family moved to Mbandaka, the main town of the province. From 2000 to 2003, he continued running his business there with restriction due to the war. In 2004 he fell sick and was very often hospitalized for almost a year. He suffered from malaria and bronchitis. He used almost all of his business working capital for medical care. 

After recovering, Ferdinand decided to change his business and started to sell lamp oil in 2005 once again with a working capital of US$ 15. He worked very hard, and with good management he increased his working capital to US$ 300 in 2007. After learning through a friend about Hope’s loan program, he decided to join one of its groups in the same year. 

Ferdinand has already received five loans from Hope that he repaid correctly. With his next loan he plans to extend his business by adding others items such as bracelets and earrings. His dream is to purchase second-hand appliances from Europe and sell them in Kinshasa. Ferdinand is 52 years old and a father of 5 children between the ages 13 and 27 of whom four go to school and the oldest is independent. Ferdinand runs his business in the northeastern part of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To extend his business by purchasing other items for which there is a demand in his area

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria A. has a small store in their village. She maintains her business to support her family's basic needs. The store is their sole source of family income, since her husband is only a part-time construction worker. Gloria is rigorously looking for other business opportunities aside from her store, to earn more money and uplift her family's life. Apart from her business, she also hopes to continue to send her children to school to finish their studies for a better future. Thus, Gloria wanted to borrow the amount of PHP8,000 to further develop her community store.  
	
“It feels good when someone appreciates your deeds,” said Gloria, and she promises herself that she will continuously work harder while still strong to support her family. She is 40 years old with three children, namely: Denmark - 20 years old, fourth year college; Cherry Mae - 14 years old, third year high school; and John – 6 years old, kindergarten. Her husband, Nelson, also tries his best to earn a living for their family.

loans.use: Store Improvement

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people who all live in Peam Sala village in Kandal province make up the village bank loan and all the members will use the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Uss C. is a village president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to grow. So she decided to ask for a loan with which to buy them. In addition, she would use the rest of the loan to buy fuel to support the field and make her crop more productive. She is a 65-year-old widow with a child who is a construction worker, who can earn a small income to support the family.

Mrs. San K. did not come to take a loan but her husband did, so he is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds to grow and fuel to support the field to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Sada

texts.en:
Sada has been a food seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 12 years. She belongs to the Tujikomboe loan group (group code 2063). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $155. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items like rice, meat, and beans for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, pay school fees for her children, and save money for future use.

Sada is 48 years old, married, and has eight children: ages 26, 23, 21, 19, 16, 14, 12 and 11.

loans.use: To buy food like rice, beans, and meat for her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mally P. is a rice farmer. She started farming with her parents when she was just 8 years old, a distance away from their house. She is 47 years old, married to a farmer, and also has six loving children. She owns a 3-hectare (approximately 7.5 acre) farm. She would like to increase her yield to support the growing needs of her family.

The purpose of her loan is to buy fertilizers and seeds. She believes that by doing so, she will have the chance to improve her harvest.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to enable them to start and have their own livelihood. CEVI offers not just loans to all their clients but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Yadira Lizeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Yadira A. tiene 30 años de edad y esta casada con el sr. Erinson Castro con el cual han procreado 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la compra de mariscos al por mayoy y los vende al detalle, ella tiene 10 años de realizar esta actividad, ella necesita el credito para comprar 4 quintales de camarones y pescado. 
su meta es poder tener una gran tienda de venta de mariscos y tambien desea poner un restaurant de mariscos.
nos comento que en toda su vida le ha sido dificil salir adelante por muchos motivos pero que ahora siente que todo le va a salir muy bien y se nota que tiene todos los deseos de superarse, y tambien quiere que sus hijos sean hombres de bien y unos muy buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yadira A. is 30 years old, married to Mr. Erinson Castro and they have 2 children. She sells seafood, wholesale and retail, and she has been doing this for 10 years. She needs a loan to buy 4 "quintales" (1 quintal=46 kgs.) of shrimp and fish.

It is her goal to have a big store selling seafood and she also wishes to have a seafood restaurant. She tells us that it has been difficult for her to get ahead during her life for many reasons, but now she feels that everything is going to turn out fine and it is obvious that she desires to move ahead and she also wants her children to become good human beings and excellent professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish and shrimp.

loans.name: Boldbaatar

texts.en:
Boldbaatar G. lives with his wife and two children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His two children go to a local kindergarten. Boldbaatar has a small butchery business, which he and his wife started in 2003. He travels to herders in remote areas in the countryside to purchases sheep and goats. Once he brings the livestock home, he slaughters them and sells the meat wholesale in the local food market and the meat markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since the start, his business has expanded and his business capital has increased from 800,000 to 3,500,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT).

In the future, he would like to expand his business and be more successful. He requests a loan to purchase more livestock for his business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen sells foodstuffs and she lacks enough capital to boost her business. Helen is 30 years old and she has three children. Helen hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. 
She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo sells crates of eggs and noodles at retail to her customers. Fumilayo hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more crates of eggs to sell. Fumilayo is 45 years old and married with three children. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata S. is a small-scale businesswoman in the city of Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. Fatmata is requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 from Kiva lenders in order to boost her business. With the help of a loan, Fatmata will be able to expand her business so that both sales and profit will improve for her. As such, Fatmata’s living standard will improve; she will be able to better look after herself, her children, and other family members.

Fatmata is thirty-two years of age. She was born in Makeni and is married to a businessman; they have four children. Two of her children are in Junior Secondary schools and the other two are in primary schools. Fatmata sells ground-nuts; palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), pepper and other locally produced market-food. She has been a businesswoman for ten years now.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Zarrina

texts.en:
Zarrina M. sells women's shawls in the central market of Istaravshan. For six years, she has successfully grown her clientele. She is 31 years old and is married with two children. Now Zarrina‘s business is her main source of income, allowing her to improve her family's living conditions and to provide her children with education.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,500 to buy new shawls in order to increase her range of goods.

Zarrina would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To buy new shawls in order to increase her range of goods.

loans.name: Fatoumata Binta

texts.fr: Fatoumata Binta L. est une femme de 31 ans, elle est célibataire et a 2 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de Vélingara Ouest2 depuis le 23 décembre 2006 et y a bénéficié de 5 prêts qu'elle a toujours remboursés avec succès. Avec son prêt elle va faire un commerce de tissu teinté et les profits générés lui serviront à assurer la santé, la nourriture et la scolarité de ses 2 enfants. Le prêt sera remboursé en une seule échéance en fin de cycle de 6 mois.

loans.use: Renforcer son capital

loans.name: Ahmadiyya Primary School, Six Mile Group

texts.en:
These are teachers from a primary school in Six Mile village, about 26 miles from Freetown. They have come to SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone, to seek a loan in order to meet their immediate financial needs. Because teachers’ salaries are usually small, many of them find alternative means of making a living. Some engage in businesses and in agriculture, while others organize extra classes for the pupils (though this is a practice the government is trying to abolish). 

These teachers seek a loan in order to embark on meaningful projects, such buying of a plot of land, starting/completing the building of a house, paying school fees for either their children or for themselves to pursue further studies, buying furniture, etc. Gradually, out of their monthly salaries, they will repay their SMT/Kiva loan.

Andrew (third from right) is a senior teacher at the school and head of this group. He is 43. He was born in Yoni small town, in northern Sierra Leone. He married a businesswoman and they have six children – two in secondary schools and two in primary schools. Mr. K. has been teaching for 19 years. He will use part of the loan to pay school fees for his children, as schools are reopening pretty soon. He will also use part of the loan to repair his house and buy food for the family.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children and repair family home

loans.name: Soutoura. Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Soutoura sont tous des  femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 3 enfants et  vivant dans des familles monogames à Hamdallaye  un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative  de la  république du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  et  font  de l’achat vente, d’atiécké, de bois de chauffe, de la pâte d’arachide  et  de  la restauration, comme activités génératrices de revenus.
Avec ce prêt, elles comptent acheter, 1sac de 50 kg d’atiécké, 1sac de 50 kg de riz, 4 paquets de condiments alimentaires, 1 chargement de camionnette en bois de chauffe et 1 sac de 100 kg de graines d’arachide (pour en faire de la pâte d’arachide).  
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Sikasso ville et dans les villages environnants. Elles vendent à Sikasso ville  à domicile, dans les marchés, et dans les quartiers de façon ambulante, au comptant  souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille; l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent avoir plus de capitaux pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir aménager ou avoir leur point de vente.

loans.use: Achat d’articles divers.

loans.name: I. A. Isabelle

texts.fr: G. I. A. Isabelle est née en 1971 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Isabelle est mariée à AKPODE Edouard, un agent de la Société Béninoise d’Eau et d’Electricité (SBEE). Isabelle et Edouard ont quatre enfants tous scolarisés et encore à leur charge. La famille vit à Louho à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Isabelle et Edouard assurent ensemble les charges de la famille. Isabelle vend à son domicile des divers (sucre, biscuits, papiers hygiéniques, chaussures, piles, pâtes alimentaires, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, etc.) ainsi que des boissons de la Brasserie et de la glace. Isabelle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Isabelle sollicite ce troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Isabelle A. G. was born in 1971 at Cotonou, the business capital of Benin. Isabelle is married to Edouard Akpode an employee of the Beninoise Water and Electricity Company. Isabelle and Edouard have four children who have attended school and are still in their care. The family lives in Louho in Porto-Novo the administrative capital of Benin. Isabelle and Edouard together, meet the needs of the family. Isabelle sells from her house assorted items such as sugar, biscuits, toilet paper, shoes, batteries, meat spreads, boxes of milk, sardines, tomatoes, etc. She also sells beer and ice. Isabelle has already benefited from loans that she has made with ALIde, loans that she has duly repaid. She is requesting this third loan to strengthen her business operating funds.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies of  sugar, biscuits, toilet paper, shoes, batteries, meat spreads, boxes of milk, sardines, tomatoes, etc for resale

loans.name: Valeria

texts.en:
Valeria is a member of Asociación Arariwa, a communal bank consisting of 19 members in Cruz Pata, a town 45 minutes from Cusco. The group is called Sacro. She is from Cruz Pata and still lives there. She is a 55 year old widow with 2 children and 2 grandchildren. 

Valeria splits her time between farming and buying and selling dry goods like potatoes and beans. With the loan, she will buy seeds for her fields.

Valeria appreciates and thanks you for the loan and promises to pay the monthly payments on time.

loans.use: puchasing seeds for her fields

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Mrs. Magdalena T. is married, 67 years old, and has 5 adult children. Her husband is a farmer and they are currently living at Tawi-tawi, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.

Magdalena is requesting a loan amounting to 7,000 PHP as additional capital for her sari-sari store. This amount is her second loan since she first joined PMPC. The income of her husband is not enough for their daily needs and the stock of her store is now decreasing so she is planning to use the loan amount to purchase additional items for her little store.

Magdalena plans to expand her sari-sari store into a convenience store and wishes to see their family succeed in their chosen field of business.

loans.use: New purchased items for her existing business (sari-sari store)

loans.name: Ivie

texts.en:
Ivie is 41 years old, married with 4 children. Her husband is a commercial driver and he also supports the home. Ivie sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers in the market. She is happy with her business because her customers pay cash when they come to purchase her products.

Ivie is a client of LAPO which is an organization whose aim is to alleviate poverty in the lives of the people, especially women in Nigeria and Africa. She hopes for a loan amount of 40,000 NGN (US$275) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Promise #2 Group

texts.en:
Amelia B. is a leader of a group of two borrowers called Promise #2. She is married with five children aged 11 to 27 years old; their educational levels range from fifth grade to university. Amelia is a high school graduate and a nurse’s aide. She and her family live and work on Lawaza Road in Voinjama City, the capital of Lofa County and a bustling crossroads town before the Liberian civil war.

Besides working as a nurse’s aide, Amelia sells spare parts for motorcycles. She sells quality goods in order to encourage customers to continue patronizing her business. She has been in business for two years and hopes eventually to own her own store.

The bad road conditions and long distance from her wholesale source to her business site has been a problem for Amelia. She needs this loan to invest in and improve her business. She dreams of each and every one in her family going into business as she has done.

loans.use: To invest in her motorcycle parts business.

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en:
Clarisa S. is from the village of Sagay, Camiguin Province. Clarisa is 32 years old and married with 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Clarisa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Clarisa has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Clarisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Clarisa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Clarisa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Clarisa from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her sari-sari retail shop

loans.name: Kémé

texts.fr: Kémé D. est une femme mariée, elle âgée de 41 ans et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre de Banc villageois depuis 9 ans et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour y avoir accédé à 18 fois de suite. Ce prêt lui permettra de poursuivre sa vente de jus naturels, de glace, de draps de lit et rideaux et de pouvoir participer aux différentes charges familiales.
texts.en:
Kémé D. is a married woman, aged 41, and the mother of six children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois for nine years, and has good experience in terms of loans for having obtained 18 of them in succession. This loan will allow her to continue her sales of natural juices, ice, bed sheets, and curtains, and enable her to contribute to various familial expenses.

Translated from French by Carolyn McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her investment capital

loans.name: Aguenon

texts.fr: Née le 21 juillet 1972 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du BENIN, K. Aguenon Sourou vit depuis 9 ans à Enagnon, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN. Aguenon est divorcée et mère de 4 enfants dont seulement quelques uns sont scolarisés. Aguenon vit seule avec ses enfants. Aguenon assure seule les charges de ses enfants. Pour subvenir aux divers besoins de ses enfants, Aguenon exerce comme activité principale la vente de gâteaux et de bouillie. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du BENIN, que Aguenon effectue l’achat de ses produits. Aguenon vend ses produits à son domicile. Aguenon n’a fréquenté que le primaire mais exerce son activité depuis bientôt 10 ans. Aguenon est une cliente de ALIDé qui a déjà bénéficié de 3 crédits, crédits qui ont tous été bien remboursé. Aguenon désire épargner beaucoup plus pour acheter une parcelle mais ne dispose pas d’assez de moyens financier pour y arriver, c’est la raison pour laquelle Aguenon sollicite un quatrième crédit.
texts.en:
Born on July 21, 1972 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin, Ms. K. Aguenon Sourou has been living in Enagnon, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, for nine years.  She is divorced and the mother of four children, of whom some are in school.  She lives by herself with her children. She alone ensure that their expenses are covered.  To provide for the various needs of her children, Aguenon's main business is in selling cakes and porridge.  Dantokpa, the international market of Benin, is where she purchases her supplies.  She sells her goods out of her home.  She attended school primary school only, yet she has been operating her business for nearly ten years.  Aguenon is an ALIDé client who has already benefited from three loans, which have all been repaid.  She would like to save more money in order to buy a plot of land but lacks enough funds to do so.  For this reason, she is requesting a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn, peanut oil, and wheat flour

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Chhun R., 42, is a married woman and the mother of five teenage kids. All of them attend school and also work. She has another supporter in her husband, who drives a motorbike taxi. To pursue a daily income, Chhun R. sells fresh vegetables that she either buys from her supplier or cuts from her farm next to her house, earning $3 per day. Chhun R. wants to grow her business, but she lacks capital to make that possible. Thus, she would like to request a loan to update her business capital. Some of the loan will be used to decorate an old taxi that is not attractive.

loans.use: To update her business capital.

loans.name: Ergeshova Bagdagul`s Group

texts.ru:
Представляем на ваше внимание нашу очередную группу солидарности с г. Кадамжай. Город расположен на пересечении  границ трех суверенных государств:Кыргызстан, Узбекистан и Таджикистан, и уникален очень широким этническим составом региона. Кадамжай знаменит своей черешней и абрикосами, которые пользуются огромным спросом далеко за пределами Кыргызстана. 
Начну представление группы, как обычно с лидера. 

Эргешова Багдагул, 34 года, разведена. Она воспитывает одного 14 летнего сына, который учится в школе. Клиентка занимается сдачей свадебных платьев напрокат, а также предоставляет разного предсвадебные услуги, такие как, макияж, прическа в собственном салоне красоты. Этим бизнесом она занимается с 2007 года. Это ремеслу она обучалась в соседней республике Узбекистан. Кредит будет использован для закупа новых платьев для последующей сдачи напрокат.

Кыямидину 42 года. Он женат и воспитывает 2 детей. Супруга работает поваром. Его оба детей учатся в школе. Кыямидин занимается разведением МРС, а также перепродажей скота. Кредит будет использован для закупа 10 голов МРС. 

Гулбара, 34, замужем. Мать 4 детей: 3 дочек и одного сына. Ее супруг работает мастером по ремонту бытовой техники, сама же является локальным дистрибьютером продукции "Орифлейм" и открыла фирменный магазин.  Кредит будет использован для закупа косметических изделий. 

Гулзаада занимается реализацией женской одежды. Этим делом она занимается уже на протяжении последних нескольких лет. До этого она работала продавщицей у своей матери, но потом открыла свой бизнес. Кредит будет использован для закуп недорогих женских кофточек для ассортимента. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Let us bring to your attention our next solidarity group from the city of Kadamjai.
