This city is situated at the border crossing of three independent countries: Kyrgyzstan, Uzbekistan and Tajikistan, making this region unique in its diverse ethnic composition. Kadamjai is famous for its sweet cherries and apricots, which are in great demand far beyond the borders of Kyrgyzstan. Let’s start the presentation of the group with its leader, as usual. Bagdagul E. is 34 years old and divorced. She is raising one 14-year-old son, who is attending school. The client is involved in renting wedding dresses and also offering various pre-wedding services, such as make-up and hair styling at her own beauty salon. She has been involved in this business since 2007. Bagdagul learned this trade in the neighboring republic of Uzbekistan. The loan will be used for the purchase of new dresses to be used for future rentals. Kyyamidin is 42 years old. He is married and is raising 2 children. His wife works as a cook. Both of their children go to school. Kyyamidin is involved in breeding small livestock and also livestock sales. The loan will be used for the purchase of 10 heads of small livestock. Gulbara is 34 years old and married. She is a mother of 4 children: 3 daughters and one son. Her husband works as repairman of household appliances. Gulbara is the local distributor of “Oriflame” products and opened the brand-name store. The loan will be used for the purchase of cosmetics. Gulzaada is involved in sales of women’s clothing. She has been in this business for the last several years. Previously, she worked as a salesperson at her mother’s, but then opened her own business. The loan will be used for the purchase of affordable women’s blouses to add to the merchandise variety.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wedding dresses

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es: Kelly tiene 34 años, es casada, y de cuyo matrimonio tiene tres hijos, y juntos viven en la casa de su suegra. Se dedica en la venta de ropa, de manera ambulatoria, en un mercado populoso de su distrito. Desde entonces, tiene que luchar por un espacio dentro de este mercado, es así que va desde temprano, a las 5:00am de la mañana para que le puedan conceder el espacio, sin tener ninguna dificultad durante el día que trabaja. Al medio día retorna a su casa, para preparar el almuerzo de su esposo, que trabaja de albañil. Es así que lleva cinco años, realizando esta actividad, en la que ha sabido ganarse clientes, quienes hacen que su trabajo le sea rentable. Es por ello que en el futuro anhela adquirir un puesto dentro de ese mercado, de ese modo estabilizar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y confirma una vez más su compromiso de pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, además esta contenta de tener el apoyo de sus compañeras de su grupo, por ser muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más prendas de vestir, para brindar mayor variedad  de mercadería a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kelly, 34, is married and has three children; everyone lives in her mother-in-law's house. She sells clothes from place to place in a very busy market in her neighborhood. She has to fight for space inside the market so she gets there very early in the morning, at 5am, so that she can have a space assigned to her and not have any problems during her workday. She returns home at midday to prepare lunch for her husband, who is a bricklayer. She has been in this line of work for 5 years and she has managed to win over regular customers and improve her quality of life. This is her second loan with MFP and she once again pledges to repay in a timely fashion. Besides, she is happy to have the support of her fellow group members because they are very unified. She will use the requested funds to buy more items of clothing in order to offer her customers a greater variety of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Solomon Tb Group

texts.en:
In addition to being a vibrant entrepreneur, Paul is also married and the father of five children from age 1-13 who are pursuing education at the primary school level. He is hard-working and resourceful on behalf of his family. He is married to a trader and together they want to make sure they are financially able to support all their children through university education.

Paul operates a cold store and sells assorted fish. Fish is a common and important protein source in the preparation of most meals and lot of people prefer fish to meat. He buys assorted fish from fish mongers in fishing areas, freezes them and sells them to households and food vendors in his community. He has operated this business for the past 2 years. 

Paul is currently the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Solomon’ and comprised of six members. The other members are also engaged in businesses such as food selling, hair dressing, grocery sales, used clothing sales etc. They are the major breadwinners of their respective families and are requesting a loan to support their businesses. Their common dream is to be financially self-sustaining and to be able to support their children through quality education.

loans.use: To purchase assorted fish

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna L. is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling bananas, some spices, etc. to members of the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2008, Edna joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Edna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional goods to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods to sell

loans.name: Alejandro Jot

texts.es: Alejandro Jot tiene 43 años de edad, su actividad económica es una panadería. Don Alejandro tenía este sueño desde hace 5 años, pues desde muy joven él tenía en mente obtener este negocio que sería su medio de vida, por lo que su trabajo inicia desde muy temprano a las 4 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, por lo que siempre ha trabajado muy duro para sufragar los gastos de su familia, pues además cuando tiene que salir a realizar la entrega de sus productos es muy agotador Alejandro trabaja muy duro para llevar dinero a su vivienda. El solicita este crédito para la compra de harina, azúcar, levadura, sal, mantequilla entre otros productos. Su deseo es obtener otro medio de transporte para realizar las entregas en tiempo y forma.
texts.en:
Alejandro Jot is 43 years old, and he has a bakery. Alejandro has had this dream for five years. Ever since he was young he had in mind getting this business as his means of support. His work starts very early, at four in the morning, and works until seven at night. He has always worked very hard to pay the family expenses. Also, when he leaves to deliver his products it is very exhausting. Alejandro works very hard to bring money home. He is requesting this loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, salt, and butter, among other products. His wish is to get another means of transportation to make deliveries in due time and in proper form.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Aurelio L. is from the town of Banga. He is 61 years old. Aurelio is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Aurelio owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Aurelio has been engaged in his business for over 20 years now.

Aurelio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aurelio is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Aurelio from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About CEVI:

Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, CEVI has numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but also savings, insurance, and training, which are provided through regular cluster group meetings.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Kimenyedde Womens Group, Kayunga

texts.en:
N. Racheal at 60 years is still active at effectively seeing to it that her retail business outlet in Malyangalyanga, Kayunga, is operating successfully. It’s a business she began when she was still on the sunny side of 30 and, amazingly, it’s still going strong, notwithstanding the many challenges that have reared their heads.

Racheal’s success story has made other people in her village strive to emulate her. It’s now 42 years down the road and her unwavering business spirit does not look like it’s getting frail any time soon. Instead, she has been emboldened more by the fact that she has managed to survive this long despite the fact that she operates in a rural setting.

Racheal is a widow whose determination to educate all her seven children has never wavered. As a result, all of them are in good schools around Kayunga. In a month, she makes profits to the tune of 400,000 shillings and, with this loan, she is hoping she will have the leverage to purchase more items for her retail shop: items like bags of sugar and salt, bars of soap, basins, cups and many more items that her clients have an inclination for.

loans.use: To purchase more retail items such as bags of sugar and salt and many more items

loans.name: Put

texts.en: Shown in the photo is Mrs. Put L., a low-income person living in a rural area of Siem Reap Province. In order to earn a daiL. income, Put L. weaves thatch and sells it to people who need it to cover their houses. Also, she travels with her husband to fish along the river. There are a lot of fish that live in the river, however, Put L. doesn’t have many implements to fish with. Put L. will be using her first loan to buy nets and traps for fishing activities. The famiL. is still raising four younger children, while the other two are now married and live independentL..

loans.use: To buy nets and traps for fishing activities

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun N., 29, is single and resides with his mother in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known as the most favorite tourist place in the country. N. is a tuk-tuk driver, earning an income of USD 4.50 per day. His mother is a Cambodian noodle seller and earns an income of USD 2 per day.

N. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase a new motorbike to operate his business more efficiently. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. This is his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. N.'s wife appears in the photograph because N. is not available.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Lilibeth's Group

texts.en:
Lilibeth L. is from the village of Padul, Solana, Cagayan. She is 47 years old. Lilibeth is the group leader of a 9-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lilibeth is married and has 4 children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Lilibeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Lilibeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Cony

texts.es: La señora Quiñones es Originaria de la Ciudad de León, es de oficio Maestra ,su núcleo familiar está compuesto por tres personas Mayores de edad, posee su propia casa  y su esposo trabaja en un proyecto de medio ambiente, este financiamiento  se le ha otorgado de parte de ceprodel  para gastos Universitario.
texts.en:
Ms. Quiñones is a native of the city of León. She is a teacher by profession, and her family unit includes three elderly people. She has her own house, and her husband is working on an environmental project. This loan has been granted to her by Ceprodel for university expenses [for her daughter].

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for her daughter's university courses

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda G. is from the village of Namnama. She is 45 years old. Imelda is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns & operates a business planting & harvesting vegetables for sale. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Imelda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: In God We Trust Group

texts.en:
Rebecca W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called In God We Trust. She is 43 years old, widowed, and has seven children, the youngest of whom is 11 years old. She was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to a lack of financial support. She describes herself as a kind and polite woman.

For ten years she has been selling used bags in 72nd Community outside of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more cartons of used bags. Her goals are to improve her business and to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of used bags

loans.name: Kosim

texts.en:
Kosim K. is 63 years old. He is married and has three children. He has been very familiar with agriculture since he was young. Thanks to his parents he knows how to work the land. Now Kosim supports himself entirely from vegetable production. He works all day cleaning, irrigating and fertilizing his fields so that his production will be good. He has always liked cleaning his fields because it is important and is lighter work than many of his tasks. Kosim wishes to improve his family's quality of life; that wish provides the motivation for his arduous work. Kosim will invest the loan in the purchase of seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants, with the aim to have the best production in his community in a few months.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Mrs. Lach S. is 29 years of age and is a resident of Takhmao. She has a life partner in her husband, who works in the construction field. The couple has a lovely baby boy.

Lach’s work involves receiving pieces of clothing from garment factories and arranging them in sets for a fee. In addition, she also buys clothing and turns pieces into cradles and mats, which she sells to middlemen who then take them to sell at retail at the market.

Lach S. is requesting a loan to buy more clothing to make cradles and mats to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to make cradles and mats

loans.name: Anayat's Group

texts.en:
Anayat is a widow. She lost her husband few years ago as a result of sudden death. It was a very difficult time for her but she never lost hope and started sewing work to be able to afford the expenses of her children. She has raised her children with great care. 

Now her children are young men and do their business. She has two sons and both have a shop of automobile spare parts. They have a shop in the market where they deal with their customers and fill their need for spare parts.   Anayat now stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities and of her sons. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sons' business. They will invest the loan in purchasing spare parts for different vehicles. The availability of stock will help them to fulfill the requirements of their customers in a timely manner which will result in good earnings.  They started this business a few years ago and Anayat is hopeful that her sons will successfully be able to improve their business with the help of this loan investment. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained her good credit behavior and attended every meeting.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Anayat.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for her sons' business

loans.name: Jessel Jeve

texts.en:
Jessel Jeve V. is from the village of Poblacion, Don Carlos, Bukidnon. She is 22 years old. Jessel Jeve is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Jessel Jeve owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of fruits especially sweet and yellow bananas in the local community. In the picture is her mother and his son who help Jessel in her business. Jessel Jeve has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jessel Jeve joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessel Jeve is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fruits to buy and sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Jessel Jeve from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fruits to buy and sell

loans.name: Guido

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal  “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DE SAN SEBASTIAN” el banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Guido; el socio tiene 43 años de edad, El socio es casado; el socio tiene 3 hijos; el socio trabaja en su propia carpintería desde hace 8 años, el es carpintero, el socio desea el préstamo para poder hacer de este un capital para poder elaborar unos muebles que tiene pendiente y para poder acabarlo desea comprar materiales, el socio es un hombre muy trabajador y con lo que ingresa a su hogar él los distribuye entre los estudios de sus menores hijos y la C., el socio ahora tiene unos muebles pendientes y le falta materiales para terminar de elaborarlos antes de entregar los trabajos y así podrá cobrar por sus trabajos. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para terminar unos muebles que el socio tiene pendientes. El socio solicita le préstamo para comprar materiales.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de su cuota en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Here is a member of the community bank named "Virgen del Rosario de San Sebastian. The community bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and region of Cusco. 

His name is Guido. He is 43 years old, he is married and he has three children.  He has had his   own carpentry shop for 8 years. He is a carpenter. He wants a loan to use as capital funds to be able to make a piece of furniture that has been ordered.  In order to complete his project he needs materials. He is a very hard working man and his earnings are spent in the support of the household and in the schooling for his younger children. He has furniture that has been ordered but he is lacking materials to complete the projects. Once he is finished the furniture he will be able to collect payment. He requests a loan to invest in the purchase of materials to complete a piece of furniture that has been ordered. He requests a loan to purchase materials. 

He is very grateful and values the loan that has been granted to him. He is committed to the payment terms established for his loan.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials.

loans.name: Yuly Veronica

texts.es: La Sra. Yuly tiene una tienda ubicada cerca de la Agencia, su familia esta integrada de 4 personas su esposo Bismark, un niño de 4 años y una niña de 2 años, su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de el alto en una empresa y ella tiene una tienda de barrio  con la tienda en calidad de alquiler es una Sra. Emprendedora  ella tiene la tienda cerca de un local lo cual ayuda que le vaya bien sus ventas, ya que cada ves que en el local hay fiestas ella vende muy bien refrescos y dulces, solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería, razón por la cual se solicita el financiamiento kiva, desea comprar abarrotes, galletas, refrescos para surtir su tienda, es una persona muy trabajadora y esta muy agradecida en la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yuly has a store located close to Emprender's branch office. Her family is made up of four people: her husband Bismark, a 4-year-old son and a 2-year-old daughter. Her husband works at a company in the city of El Alto, and she has a neighborhood store in a rented space. She is a very enterprising woman, and her store is near a popular gathering place, which helps her sales since every time there is a party she sells lots of drinks and sweets.

She is requesting a loan to buy merchandise, which is why she is requesting Kiva funding. She would like to buy basic grocery items, cookies, and drinks in order to offer a wider variety of products at her store. She is a very hard-working person and is grateful to Emprender for supporting her.

loans.use: Buy basic grocery items and cookies

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en: Munhtsetseg T. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own house. Her two sons attend a local high school and her daughter, who is a one-year-old, attends a kindergarten. Her husband works in the government organization in their town. Munhtsetseg began her business in 2002 in the "Uguuj" shopping center. She has been operating a general products trade business. Within a short period, they have built a stable and successful operation and today their working capital has increased to a level of 4,000,000 MNT and they bought car. In the future, she wants to open her own magazine. She is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase and import more general products from Erlian, a border city in China, to sell at two different places for the upcoming New Year holiday.

loans.use: To purchase and import more general products

loans.name: Lourdes Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señorita. Lourdes S. es socia del banco comunal Zhidmad, vive en la comunidad de Monjas que le pertenece a la parroquia de Zhidmad, hay una gran vista de la naturaleza, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y también mucha de su población sale a la ciudad en busca de un mejor trabajo.

La Señorita Lourdes tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive con madre quien se dedica a la agricultura y tiene una casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a laborar como empleada domestica actividad que la desempeña hace 4 años,  labora de 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde  de lunes a sábados, con su sueldo ayuda un poco en la economía del hogar.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y fue invitada por su mamá a formar parte de este grupo, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en productos para poner una tienda  en casa de su mamá. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Miss Lourdes S. is a member of the Zhidmad communal bank. She lives in the Monjas community, belonging to the Zhidmad parish. They have a great view of nature. The people of this community raise animals and farm. A lot of the population leaves for the city in search of better job opportunities.

Miss Lourdes is 20, single and lives with her mother, who is a farmer, in her own home.

She has worked as a domestic employee for 4 years. She works from 7:00 am until 4:00 pm, Monday to Saturday. She uses her salary to help out a bit with the household costs.

This is her second loan in this community bank. She was invited to be part of the group by her mother. She will invest this loan in products to open up a store in her mother's home. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to purchase basic staples

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-at T. (in the photo) and her husband Mr. Thong Svay, live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2000 and have two children:  one son and one daughter. One is in school and the other one is still young.

Sam-at has been a garment factory worker for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan of $800 to expand the house where she lives, to make it better for her family to live in.

loans.use: To expand the house where she lives.

loans.name: Gabi Mariela

texts.es:
Gabi es soltera tiene 35 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Cerro La Falla, ubicado en el distrito de Olmos, una ciudad conocida como la capital del limón, situada a más de de hora y media de la cuidad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un puesto de venta de ropa en uno de los mercados de la ciudad. Ella adquiere sus productos en la ciudad de Lima y los comercializa entre el público que diariamente acude a este mercado de abastos. Las prendas que vende son para todo público y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fidelizada. Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le sirven para ayudar a solventar su economía.

Gabi desea surtir en inventario de su negocio debido al cambio de temporada. Por ese motivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de  1500 nuevos soles con los cuales comprará diversas prendas como jeans, blusas, conjuntos para niños, entre otros, atendiendo a las solicitudes de sus clientes ya que existe una alta demanda por productos debido a que es conocida por dicha actividad en la zona.

Gabi se ha propuesto invertir en mostrar una mayor calidad de prendas puesto que es la única que vende prendas novedosas y de calidad  en el mercado.
texts.en:
Gabi is 35 years old, single, and lives with her family in the Cerro La Falla sector in the District of Olmos. This city is known as “the lemon capital” and located more than an hour and a half away from the city of Chiclayo.

Gabi has a clothing stand at one of the markets in the city. She acquires her products in the city of Lima and sells them to the public who come to the market every day. Gabi sells clothes for all ages and currently has a loyal customer base. The earnings from her business help to cover her finances.

Gabi wants to restock the inventory of her business according to the change in season. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN. The money will be used to buy different garments such as jeans, blouses, children’s outfits, and other items so that she can fulfill the existing orders from her customers since these products are in high demand. Gabi is known in the area for her business.

She plans to invest in high quality clothes since she is the only vendor at the market who sells new garments that are well-tailored.

loans.use: Purchase  jeans, blouses, children’s outfits, and other items

loans.name: Ma. Aileen

texts.en:
Ma. Aileen is a widow who lives in the municipality of Carmen, Cebu . She earns her living by operating a general store. Ma.Aileen joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma.Aileen has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 14,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,500,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,000 to buy products for the store to sell to customers. In addition to her business, she serves in her community as the Barangay Kagawad of their Barangay near to her home.  Ma. Aileen is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Sheria Group

texts.fr: Luanda B.  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Sheria, âgée de 45 ans, veuve, mère de 7 enfants. Son  mari fut décédé suite à une mort inopinée. La  cliente  Luanda B. fait  le petit commerce de divers. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le quartier périphérique de Kiziba II. Il ya environs 15 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  En plus, elle vend également des boissons (Primus, Fanta, coca, etc.) à son domicile.  En 2005, elle bénéficia de premier crédit de l’IMF Hekima de 50$ pour  renforcer  son capital. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  des nouveaux produits brassicoles (13 casiers de Primus, 4 casiers de boissons Aigle, 7 casiers de Fanta).  En plus, elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise et construire confortablement  sa maison. La cliente Luanda B.  remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Le groupe Sheria est constitué de 14 membres, certains habillées confortablement en uniforme de la journée internationale de la femme du 8 mars 2011.
texts.en:
Luanda B. is an entrepreneur and the leader of the business group Sheria. She is 45 years old, a widow, and the mother of seven children. Her husband had died unexpectedly. Our client, Luanda B., has a small-scale business involving a variety of goods. She sets up her merchandise in the outlying district of Kiziba II. She has been in this business for about fifteen years. In addition, she sells drinks (Primus, Fanta, colas, etc.) out of her home. 

In 2005, she received her first loan from the micro-finance institution Hekima in the amount of $50 for bolstering her working capital. She must use this new loan to stock up on new brewery products (13 cases of Primus, 4 cases of Aigle, 7 cases of Fanta). She also has the ambition to make her enterprise sustainable and to build a house easily.

Our client Luanda B. thanks the micro-finance institution Hekima for its efforts dedicated to poor women who are excluded from traditional banks.

The group Sheria comprises 14 members, some of whom are comfortably dressed in the uniform of International Women’s Day, on March 8, 2011.

loans.use: to buy 13 cases of Primus, 4 of Aigle drinks, and 7 of Fanta

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is 35 years old and lives in the Ahouassa district of Cotonou, Benin's largest city. She is married to Romuald and they have four children, all of whom have left home.

For the past 9 years, Marie has sold jewelry as a traveling saleswoman. This is her fifth loan with ALIDE following successful past repayments. This loan will allow her to purchase stock in bulk from Tokpa, Benin's largest market. Her aim is to strengthen her business in the short term.

loans.use: to purchase jewelry items for resale

loans.name: Dadja

texts.fr: Mr Dadja est un jeune homme âgé de 29ans. Sa conjointe est une couturière et ils ont un(01) enfant en charge. Il a un grand salon de couture (JULES CESAR CREATION) qu’il a crée en 2006. Il achète les tissus veste et chemise, les confectionne et les revend à ses nombreux clients et à toutes personnes. Il a 25 apprentis. Il veut  ce premier prêt pour acheter  50m de tissu veste et 100m de tissu chemise pour confectionner plus de vestes et de chemises pour satisfaire toutes personnes, assurer un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en: Mr Dadja is a 29 year-old young man. His wife is a seamstress and they have one  dependent child. He has a large clothing shop (JULES CESAR CREATIONS) that he founded in 2006. He buys fabric for jackets and shirts, and makes and sells them to his many customers. He has 25 apprentices. He wants this first loan to buy 50m of jacket fabric and 100m of shirt fabric to make more shirts and jackets to satisfy everyone, thereby ensuring a better future for his family.

loans.use: To buy fabric for jackets and shirts

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luisa R. M. tiene  26 años de edad y vive en una casa en alquiler vivienda que esta ubicada en el barrio el Carmen de la ciudad de Tarija. Maria Luisa es madre soltera de un hijo, por circunstancias de la vida se quedo sola ahora ella tiene que trabajar para poder sacar adelante a su hijo. Maria Luisa se dedica desde hace mas de 14 años a trabajar como costurera siendo muy conocida por sus clientes que solicitan sus servicios,  Maria Luisa quiere tener mejores ingresos para salir adelante junto con su hija , pero ella nos cuenta que tiene la necesidad de comprar material de trabajo como ser telas, forros, entretelas, sierres , botones, etc. Ya que tiene un pedido de varias prendas de vestir de esa forma poder  realizar los trabajos que tiene por hacer, como ella ya tiene experiencia en el rubro el credito sera destinado para la compra de dicho material que es necesario para realizar su actividad para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Maria Luisa nos cuenta que quiere mejorar las condiciones de vida que tiene, por eso nos dice que el proximo credito que solicite sera para la compra una maquina de costura.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Luisa R. M. is 26 years old and she lives in a rental house located in the community of Carmen in the city of Tarija. Maria Luisa is a single mother to one daughter, and for life circumstances she has been left alone. She has to work to be able to support her daughter. Maria Luisa has been a seamstress for the past 14 years and as she is very well known by her clients they request her services. Maria Luisa wants to have a better income to be able to support herself and her daughter. She says that she needs to purchase materials for her business, such as fabrics, coverings, batting, zippers, buttons, etc. She has an order for various articles of clothing and this way she will be able to make the clothing that she needs to make. As she already has experience in the field, this loan will be used to purchase materials that she needs for her business, and so to improve her earnings. 

Maria Luisa says that she wants to improve the quality of her life. And she says that the next loan she requests will be used to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, batting, zippers, buttons and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Elmira's Group

texts.en:
Elmira S. is the leader of this group. She is 46, widowed, and has four children, two of whom attend school and two of whom work.  In order to earn money to meet the family's needs, Elmira sells five liters of milk every day and earns 2,100 soms per month. Elmira also cultivates agricultural products and sells part of the harvest to earn additional money. With the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase fuel and fertilizers for field work. In the future Elmira wants to see her children get married. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and fertilizers

loans.name: Karar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 20 years old, single and lives with five family members, three of whom work. In 2008, Karar opened a food market where he sells recharge cards for mobiles and all kinds of food and juices. He has experience in this field and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

Karar is requesting a $3000 loan to buy a gas generator. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a gas generator.

loans.name: Alberto Balmore

texts.es:
Alberto, está casado, vive con su esposa y tres hijos de 15, 17 y 11 años de edad, se dedica a la agricultura y también trabaja como motorista, la primer actividad la realiza desde hace 20 años, la aprendió de su padre, la segunda actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años y la aprendió por medio de amigos, él necesita comprar insumos agrícolas ya que se dispone a sembrar.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono y fertilizantes, este préstamo será una gran ayuda para su familia, ya que una parte es de consumo y la otra la comercializa.
Para Alberto su propósito es ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios, orientarlos a buenas cosas, enseñarles a trabajar en la agricultura y ofrecerles una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Alberto is married and lives with his wife and three children aged 15, 17 and 11.  Alberto is a farmer and he also works as a driver.  He has been farming for 20 years and learned the business from his father.  He has been driving for 5 years and learned the business from his friends. 

Alberto needs to buy farm supplies as he is getting ready to sow his crops.  He is requesting a loan to buy manure and fertilizers.  This loan will be a great help to his family since they eat some of their crops and sell the rest.

Alberto's goal is to help his children in their education, guide them toward good things, teach them to farm and offer them better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizers for his corn crop

loans.name: Martha  Josefina

texts.es: La Sra. Martha  y su esposo son un matrimonio joven, que se preocupa por arreglar su vivienda ya que le esta haciendo falta unos arreglos de pintura en la parte exterior de la casa, y desean darle mantenimiento  para dar  una buena imagen a todos los vecinos  y  familiares, ademas, ellos  están muy  preocupados porque  el techo de  su vivienda  esta   deteriorado, es  por  ello  que  requieren de  nuestra  ayuda  para  realizar  este  proyecto,ven en el credito la  oportunidad  de   brindar  un  ambiente  mas  confortable  a su  familia  y  amigos  que  los  visitan.
texts.en: Martha and her husband are a young couple who are concerned about fixing up their home since it needs some painting carrying out on the outside walls.  They would also like to have some maintenance work done to the house so that they can present a good image to all their neighbors and family members.  In addition, they are very worried because their roof is in a bad state of repair and they need our help to carry out this project.  They see this loan as an opportunity to provide a more comfortable environment to their family and friends who visit them.

loans.use: to have work done on her roof

loans.name: Gissela

texts.es: Gissela tiene 34 años, convive con Edu, su esposo. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, a los que crían y educan en unión familiar en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la ciudad de Tarma. Hace 11 años que se dedica en la compra y venta de papa en un puesto que alquiló en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Todos los días desde las primeras horas comercializa un promedio de 40 sacos diarios como mínimo, los cuales vende a 45 nuevos soles cada uno. Según cuenta maneja un capital de trabajo de 5 mil soles diarios. El trabajo que realiza es muy sacrificado y a la vez gratificante, pues lo que más le gusta a Gissela es negociar la venta de las diferentes variedades y clases de papa. Al terminar el día se siente agotada por el trajín diario. Ahora ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de un camión para poder trasladar los sacos de papa que cosecha hacía la ciudad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Integra” y este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para lograr sus objetivos. Razón por lo que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas, además de ser una persona responsable, ya que es miembro de su asociación. Gissela de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de papa de los agricultores para comercializarlos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Gissela is 34 years old and lives with her husband Edu.  The couple have four children who they raise and educate as a family in a rental house which is located in the city of Tarma.

Gissela has been buying and selling potatoes from a rented stall in the wholesale market in her city for 11 years.  She makes her sales every day, from very early in the morning, selling an average of 40 sacks a day at a minimum.  She sells each sack for 45 Peruvian soles.  She tells us that she manages working capital of 5,000 soles each day.  The work that she carries out is very demanding but also rewarding.  What she most enjoys about her work is negotiating the sale of her different varieties and classes of potato.  At the end of the day, she feels exhausted by her daily work.  She would like to expand her business by purchasing a truck so that she can transport her sacks of potatoes to the city.

Gissela belongs to the 'Integra' community bank and this is her seventh loan from MFP.  She hopes to receive your cooperation in helping her to achieve her goals.  For this reason, she will make her loan repayments punctually.  She is a responsible person as she is a member of her community bank.  With your support, Gissela will invest the money she has requested in buying several sacks of potatoes from farmers so that she can sell them wholesale.

loans.use: to buy several sacks of potatoes

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Alicia has a shop that sells Avon and Natasha products. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy products from Natasha and Avon for resale.

Alicia has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy products from Natasha and Avon to resell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is 37 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is married and has three children between the ages of two and eleven, all of whom attend school. For the past five years Gloria has been selling doughnuts in the local market. One of the main challenges she faces is that she has to wake up by 4a.m. to prepare her doughnuts. She is requesting a loan to purchase flour and oil. In the future, she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase flour and oil.

loans.name: Bujubuli Abeteraine Development Association Group

texts.en:
Robert is a Ugandan male, aged 31 years. He needs a loan to buy land. He hails from Kyenjojo District, and is a father of one child aged two years. He is a retailer, who dreams of becoming a whole-seller and educating his child. 
He is a member of Bujubuli Abeteraine Development Group, the group is comprised of fifteen people, but two did not take the loan, and they are in the photo because the policy requires them to guarantee their members while accessing credit facilities.

loans.use: To buy land.

loans.name: Mirriam

texts.en: Mirriam is 44  years old and married. She supports a family of eight people. She runs a retail shop. she has been in her bussiness for a period of three  years. She was given a loan of KES. 20,000 which she invested in her business. She earns a monthly income of  six thousand per month. She will use the loan to purchase other goods and also improved the animals she has. She will use the anticipated profit to buy a plot and also to educate her children. This is her first loan with KADET and she believes that she will pay it well. Her hope for the future is to extend the business and to educate her children to be better people in future.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing more goods for resale

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
L.  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Cachimayo, en L. Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

L.  socia Basilia; tiene 42 años de edad,  L. socia es conviviente; L. socia tiene 3 hijos  de 20, 6, 5 años de edad;  L. socia es comerciante minorista, L. socia tiene dos facetas de ventas, elL. ofrece sus productos de belleza en catálogos, una vez que le hacen el pedido esperan a que llegue los productos, luego los reparte le dan una parte del precio del producto, y L. otra parte le dan a fines del mes, por otro lado elL. viaja a Ayaviri a unas tres horas de L. ciudad del Cusco y trae docenas de moldes de queso, los cuales los reparte a los diferentes restaurantes y el precio del queso si le pagan de inmediato con L. excepción de algunos clientes que ya gozan de su confianza y les deja para el pago en un par de semanas. L. socia con este monto que ingresa a casa elL. puede ahorrar para pagar las mensualidades de sus tres hijos en sus respectivos colegios y universidad, y compra víveres para el hogar, el conyugue apoya en el pago de los servicio y de L. casa, en cubrir algunas veces los estudios y útiles también de este modo los dos ingresos se complementan bien, L. socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en L. compra de quesos al por mayor para L. venta.

L.  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Basilia is a member of the Solidaridad-Cachimayo Community Bank located in the district of Cachimayo, Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco.

Basilia is 42 years old and married with three children aged 20, 6, and 5. She is a businesswoman with two jobs.  She sells beauty products from catalogs. Once her customers have put in an order and the products have arrived, Basilia delivers them and is given part of the cost of the item. Then she receives the rest of the money at the end of the month.

Basilia also travels to Ayaviri, some three hours from Cusco, and brings back dozens of cheeses which she distributes to various restaurants. Most of them pay her for the cheeses immediately, with the exception of some trustworthy customers who pay her a couple of weeks later. 

With the income from these two jobs, Basilia pays the fees for her three children in their respective schools and universities and buys groceries for the home. Her husband contributes to the costs of services and household expenses, and sometimes to their children's studies and educational supplies. In this way their two incomes cover their expenses. 

Basilia is grateful for the support that is offered and promises to make the loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy cheeses at wholesale prices for resale

loans.name: Yamid Alejandro

texts.es: Yamid Alejandro es un microempresario que a sus 33 años de edad sueña con sacar a sus 2 hijos adelante y brindarles un mejor futuro, trabaja todos los días vendiendo zapatos a vecinos, allegados, y buenos clientes, pues reconoce que le gusta vender y hace muy bien esa labor, , actualmente Yamid espera poder ampliar las ventas para así generar mas ingresos que le permitan suplir las necesidades que su familia presenta, sin embargo no cuenta con el capital suficiente para comprar mercancía al por mayor y generar mas utilidades, motivo por el cual solicita un crédito que le ayude a aumentar sus ingresos y a que su negocio  progrese. Pues su sueño es llegar a tener un gran almacén que sea reconocido en el sector por su variedad de productos y el buen servicio, por lo cual cada mañana se levanta con la ilusión de ir construyendo poco a poco su sueño.
texts.en: Yamid Alejandro is a 33-year old small businessman who dreams of providing his two children with a better life. He works every day selling shoes to his neighbors and other clients. He enjoys his work as a salesman, and he is good at his job. Currently, Yamid hopes to increase his sales and thus fulfill his family's needs. However, he doesn't have enough capital to make wholesale purchases of his merchandise. The loan will help his business progress and increase his earnings. His dream is to one day have a large store that is known for a variety of products and good customer service. This dream is what drives him to wake up in the morning and start building little by little towards fulfilling that dream.

loans.use: purchase merchandise at wholesale prices

loans.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
This is Nerissa.  She is a 49 year old resident of Pasay City in the Philippines.  She is married to Emmanuel who is a driver, and she is a mother to three children.  She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nerissa oversees operations of their vehicle rental business.  They have two L300 vans that they offer to be rented for cargo or for people who need vehicles when transferring household materials to other places.  They provide their services within the city and to nearby provinces.  Aside from this she also earns income from making rugs.  She earns a minimum of 5000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 17,000 loan.  She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and provide maintenance for her vans.  She expects a boost in her business as she expands.  

Nerissa hopes to have her own house someday and dreams to be able to give her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work on her business.  She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of their vehicles.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.en: Bernardo is 66 years old and lives in Landing, Baliangao. He is married with seven children. Bernardo works in the fishing industry and catches fish for a living. He has been doing this for four years. He has requested a loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials. Bernardo has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials

loans.name: Theng

texts.en: Theng is a 57-year-old farmer with 8 children. She grows rice and beans on her farmland to support her family. She has been growing rice and beans for 32 years. This is her first loan from Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Theng requested a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her plantation. With this loan, she hopes to increase her crop yields with good quality and to sell for high prices in order to earn more income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her plantation

loans.name: Gbenonkpo (Tori Bossito) Group

texts.fr: Le groupement GBENONKPO (Tori Bossito) est formé de dix-huit  personnes qui appartiennent à un même groupe de travail. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Josiane est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Josiane est âgée de 44 ans, et est une veuve. Josiane a trois enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux à sa charge. Josiane n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis vingt six ans, Josiane vend des tissus ; ce qui lui permet d’assurer ses diverses charges et ceux de ses enfants. Josiane  achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin et les revend à une gare du Bénin. C’est la deuxième fois que Josiane et les autres membres du groupement GBENONKPO (Tori Bossito) sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra de renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The group GBENONKPO (Tori Bossito) is comprised of eighteen persons who belong to the same work group. The group's representative, by the name of Josiane, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She is 44 years old and a widow. She has three children, all in school. Two of the children are in her care. 

Josiane did not go to school. For 26 years, she has sold cloth which enables her to cover her diverse expenses and those of her children. She gets her supplies in a city in Benin and resells the goods at a transit station in Benin. 

This is the second time that Josiane and the other members of the group GBENONKPO (Tori Bossito) have requested a loan from ALIDé. This loan will allow them to bolster their business in order to respond better to the demands of their customers. The first loan was indeed repaid.

loans.use: to buy cloth

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La Sra. Norma tiene 32 años de edad, es soltera, tiene una pareja, tiene 4 hijos quienes aun son pequeños. Todos viven en su casa de la ciudad de Curuguaty.
Ella es dueña de un Taller de refrigeración, moto y gomería, el cual montaron con muchos sacrificio y esfuerzo. Hoy en día es la única fuente de ingreso de la familia, ya que su pareja es mecánico y trabaja en el taller, donde también sus hijos son sus son ayudantes.
Hace como 6 años que se dedican a esto, por lo que ya tienen muy buena experiencia. Comenta que brinda servicios a las zonas de Araujo Cúe, Acepar, Manduara y Yasy Cañy, realizando visitas en el domicilio del cliente de acuerdo a la necesidad.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de repuestos para motos, lo cual le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio, para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Norma is 32 years old and single. She and her partner have four young children. They all live in their home in the city of Curuguaty.

Norma is the owner of a refrigeration, motorcycle, and tire repair shop that she established through great sacrifice and effort. Today it is the only source of income for her family. Her partner is a mechanic and works in the shop. Their children work as his assistants. Norma has managed her business for six years and she has acquired very good experience. She says that they provide services to the Districts of Araujo Cúe, Acepar, Manduara, and Yasy Cañy since they will visit the customer’s home when necessary.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy motorcycle parts, which will be of great help to her business since she will be able to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Kananachi B Group

texts.en:
Antony is the facilitator of the Kananachi B group. Antony and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Antony takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Antony had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Antony was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Antony and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Antony will educate his children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Kananachi B group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 27 years old and a single mother of a five-year-old child. To earn a living, she provides mobile phone money-transfer services. She has been in this business for five years and has employed five people. She also does farming to supplement her income.

Catherine hopes to open other outlets of her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to add float for her phone business.

loans.use: to add float for her mobile phone business

loans.name: Chhun

texts.en:
Chhun was taken a photograph with her husband at her house, which is located in Prey Chor district. She is 42 years old and has 5 children, one of whom is already married and lives away from home. Chhun generates her income by growing annual rice crops on her inherited farmland. However, the output is rarely enough to satisfy the whole family. To help the difficult situation, two of her daughters decided to work as sewing staff in a garment factory in Phnom Penh and send a part of their monthly salary home to help their parents.

In the coming months, one of Chhun’s children is going to get married, thus, Chhun will take responsibilities to manage the party. Consequently, Chhun would like to ask for some funds to prepare the wedding party of her child, which will come soon. She is very happy and grateful to all lenders who kindly help her family.

loans.use: to prepare the wedding party of her child.

loans.name: Otila

texts.en:
Otila is married with 8 children.

Prior to joining the SPBD loan program she worked as a housegirl. 

She took out her first loan in 2005 and has already paid back 3 loans. These loans were used to expand her vegetable garden and plantation.

She is pictured at her roadside stall in her village  of Nonoa, along with produce from her vegetable garden and plantation.

SPBD loans have helped her not only build up her vegetable garden, but also upgrade her housing.

loans.use: Weed killer, fertiliser, seeds, equipment and tools

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Teresia Wambui Mutura intends to buy a dairy cow and renovate the cow shed

loans.name: Gercen Onan

texts.en:
My name is Gercen Onan, I'm a businessman and my primary sales are watches and watch batteries. I am a street vendor and have been doing this for 3 years, which provides me enough income to support my family.

Hola Mi nombre es Gercen Onan, soy comerciante, mi actividad principal es la venta de relod de puño y baterias para el mismo, los que vendo de manera mabulante, tengo 3 años de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, el que me genera ingresos para cubrir los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos.

loans.use: Purchase different styles of watches and watch batteries.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: “I sew at home with my daughters to sell in the neighbourhood and also teach sewing skills to young girls. Since my business is too small and does not yield enough profit, I would like to borrow for my son who runs a rent-a-bike shop in a small town in the province of Punjab in Pakistan. I hope that business will ensure my son’s financial future.”

loans.use: Purchase a motor bike

loans.name: Ni Luh Sudermi

texts.id:
After getting married, Ni Luh Suderni has already started this business to solve her problems. Ni Luh Suderni has a sow which she feed in the morning and afternoon, and every 6 months this sow gives birth to about 6-10 piglets which is then sold at around Rp.150.000 - Rp.175.000 each, she earns about Rp.800.000. From this she used to finance Gede Adi Sanjaya's education, which is now in Secondary Year 2. art of the income is also used to maintain her house expenses and repairs. The finance from DINARI will be used to buy pig feedings, furthermore her sow has just given birth to 10 piglets, hopefully they will be well feed and able to fetch a good price.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Sejak menikah Ni Luh Suderni sudah menekuni usaha ini untuk menopang kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Ni Luh Suderni memelihara 1 ekor babi induk yang secara rutin diberi makan pagi dan sore hari. Setiap 6 bulan sekali induk babi ini mempunyai anak 6 sampai 10 ekor,yang laku dijual dengan harga Rp.150.000 sampai Rp.175.000 perekor. Dari penjualan ini keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.800.000. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk biaya sekolah Gede Adi Sanjaya, anaknya yang kini sudah duduk dibangku SMA kelas 2, Keuntungan ini juga sedikit demi sedikit disisihkan untuk memperbaiki rumahnya sehingga menjadi permanent seperti sekarang ini. Dana yang dipinjam dari DINARI dipergunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak apalagi sekarang Penginduk ini baru melahirkan 10 ekor anak jadi dibutuhkan makanan yang bagus agar anak-anaknya pun bertumbuh dengan bagus dan berkwalitas sehingga hasil penjualannya menjadi meningkat

loans.use: membeli bibit babi dan makanan ternak - to buy piglets and pig feedings

loans.name: Aas

texts.en: Aas is 25 years old and is married. She has a small shop which sells snacks, and a few household items. She usually earns $7 per day, with a small profit. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver and can earn $2 per day. Aas needs a IDR 1,000,000 loan to buy more goods and complete her shop. She's a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods and complete her shop

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther has been a member of the Comunal Kutimuy Bank for 4 years. "Kutimuy" is an indigenous word which means "return", Esther is the president of this roup. She tells us that at first she was scared of becoming a member because she wasn't sure of being able to pay back these loans. Her friends encouraged her a lot and told her that women are able to move ahead in society and this is what she did. Esther has a kiosk where she sells breads, sodas, candies and many other things. She's been running this business for 18 years. She tells us that with the first loan she got, she was able to provide for her store and support her home.

Esther has three children of her own. Their ages are 15, 12, and 4 years old. They are the whole reason for her existence! Her loan will help her purchase sodas, gum, cigars, candies, liquor, cookies/crackers and phone cards. The savings will help her buy land so that she can build a house. Her dream is to have a modest home and that her children grow up to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

Esther es socia del Banco Comunal Kutimuy desde hace 4 años. Kutimuy es una palabra quechua que significa “regresa” y del cual Esther es Presidenta. Ella cuenta que al inicio tenía temor de ser socia porque creía que no podría pagar los préstamos y sus compañeras le ayudaron mucho y le enseñaron que las mujeres sí pueden salir adelante y así lo hizo. Esther tiene un kiosco donde vende panes, gaseosas, dulces y otros productos mas, este negocio lo realiza hace 18 años, ella cuenta que con su primer préstamo surtió su negocio y comenzó a mantener sola su hogar. Esther tiene 3 hijos de 15, 12, y 4 años que son su razón de vivir. Su préstamo es de 3000 soles que serán invertidos en la compra de gaseosas, chicles, cigarros, caramelos, licores, galletas y tarjetas telefónicas. Sus ahorros los utilizará para la compra de un terreno y luego para la construcción de su casa. Su Sueño es tener una casa propia de material noble y que sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Purchase of sodas, bubble gum, cigars, candy, liquor, cookies/crackers and phone cards.

loans.name: Ya

texts.en:
Mrs. P. Ya (age 55) and her husband, Mr. Phouk Moeun (age 56) have been married since 1975. They have three children—one son and two daughters. Ya’s son is doing farming. One of her daughters is studying in the local school and another one is weaving silk. Ya and her family are living across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She is in the business of weaving silk at home. She learned to weave silk from her mother and started her silk production in 1968. Her husband is a fisherman and does farming. He grows vegetables and rice.

Ya is requesting her fourth loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase a water pumping machine, fertilizer, and pesticides for her husband who does farming.

loans.use: To purchase water pumping machine, fertilizer, and pesticide.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.es:
Emerita R. is a hardworking person who sells bread, food, instant soup, deodorants, razors, fashion jewelry, etc. In short, she has been running a small grocery store in the Villanueva district of Chinandega for 20 years.

Her greatest motive for keeping this business is her two small children, whom she loves very much. She asserts that her greatest wish is to see her children obtain a college degree and become successful people in life. Despite having gone through financially difficult times, Emerita has requested loans from Ceprodel in order to restock her mini market, thus permitting her to get ahead in life. She has obtained a total of 8 loans.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Emerita R. es un apersona muy esforzada que se dedica a la venta de pan, comestibles, sopas instantáneas, desodorantes, afeitadoras, bisuterías, etc. En fin es una tienda de víveres que la administra desde hace 20 años en la ciudad de Chinandega específicamente en el pueblo de Villanueva.

Su mayor motivo para seguir con este negocio han sido sus dos pequeños a los que ama mucho y afirma que son sus mayores deseos que ellos coronen una carrera universitaria para ser personas de éxito en la vida. A pesar de haber pasado por momentos muy complicados hablando financieramente, Emerita ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para surtir las necesidades de la pulpería y de esta manera salir adelante. Su record crediticio es de 8 créditos.

loans.use: Restock her small general store

loans.name: Raquel

texts.pt:
Raquel T. is 52 years old and native to the Matutuine district in the province of Maputo. As a child she was unable to attend school due to the distance between her home and the school, and being a girl in her culture with discrimination between sons and daughters she was only able to attend until the 3rd grade. She grew up with her parents.

At 19 years old she married and had 6 children. She has suffered great pains from the civil war between Frelimo and Renamo having been kidnapped by the enemy army, and even today the effects of the war continue in her memory.

Thanks to the access to credit she has been able to structure her life and without it her life would have continued to be very difficult. With her activity she is able to support a family of 8 people, between children and grandchildren. Despite having an official husband, he seldom helps the family due to his low monthly income.

With this loan of $1,125US she intends to purchase inventory both of new and different products following the necessities of her customers. It should be noted that by her great entrepreneurship she sells on foot at different markets each week in the district of Matutuine. In the future as her age increases she realizes that she is not going to be able to handle the various trips to sell at the markets so she intends to build a small commercial establishment in the village of Bela Vista.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

Raquel T., de 52 anos de idade, natural do Distrito de Matutuine, provincia do Maputo, durante a sua infáncia não teve possibilidade de estudar, devido a distancia que tinha da casa para escola e sendo mulher por questoes culturas havia descriminacao entre filhos e filhas, tendo frequentado até 3ª classe. Cresceu junto dos pais. Aos 19 anos casou se e deste casamento naeceu 6 filhos, diz ter ficado com grandes magoas da guerra civil entre Frelimo e Renamo, tendo sido raptada pelas exercito da oposicao e ate hoje as sequelas desta guerra continuam ficaram registados na memoria dela. Diz que graça ao acesso do credito que consegue estruturar a sua vida, porque se não fosse a vida continuaria lhe dificil. Com a sua actividade consegue suportar uma familia de 8 pessoas, dentre filhos e netos, apesar de ter um marido funcionario, mas este poucas vezes tem ajudado a familia, devido a baixa renda mensal. Com o emprestimo de 27.000,00MT, tenciona reforcar o stock de diferentes artigos e adquirir novos produtos segundo as necessidades dos clientes. De salientar que por grande empreendedorismo dela faz vendas ambulatorios nas diferentes feiras semanais realizadas no distrito de Matutuine. No futuro como a idade vai aumentando, esta consciente que nao vai aguentar continuar fazer varias viagens para vender nas feiras, pretende construir um pequeno estabelecimento comercial na vila da Bela Vista.

loans.use: To increase stock in her business

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Pon T. is 40 years old and has been working since 1990 as a collector of recyclable items. She makes her living by reselling these bottles, cans, and other such recyclables bringing in roughly US $1 per day. Her husband shares in this family business making US $1 per day as well. They have four children, one of whom works as a local tailor making about US $189 per month. She wants to use her loan to buy a greater quantity of recyclable items. Her hope is to be able to someday soon afford a motorbike on which to transport her purchased goods and make her business more efficient.

loans.use: To purchase recyclable items

loans.name: Cesarea Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca started her business selling shoes by catalog to meet her basic economic needs, given that when she became a widow she was left without any means of support. For this reason, she started selling shoes so she could get ahead with the immediate requirements of the household. She started four years ago selling to friends, neighbors and acquaintances and little by little has increased her customer base thereby attaining better earnings.

She needs a loan of $575USD, to be repaid in six months, to purchase more merchandise and therefore be able to make more sales. With your support, Francisca will be able to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Francisca inició su negocio de venta de zapatos por catalogo para solventar sus necesidades económicas ya que cuando enviudo se quedo sin un sustento económico por esto emprendió la venta de zapatos para poder salir adelante con las necesidades propias del hogar. Comenzó hace 4 años vendiendo entre amigos, vecinos y familiares y poco a a poco ha incrementado su cartera de clientes obteniendo mejores ingresos.

Ella necesita un crédito por US $575 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar mercancía y así tener mayor venta. Con tu Apoyo Francisca lograra salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Jinane

texts.en: Jinane is a 33-year-old woman who lives in southern Lebanon, in Saida. Jinane is in the commerce business. She sells sanitation products and accessories. This is the second time she has applied for a loan from Al Majmoua. She needs to buy merchandise to sustain and develop her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Zene

texts.pt:
Zene A. is 26 years old and native to the province of Gorongosa in the center of Mozambique. He is the father of 2 children. Besides his children he also supports his mother and his brother sending money every month.

He is a student in the 11th grade and attends at night. He came to Maputo in 2003 to fulfill his military service. He is an employee for the Ministry of Defense.

He does not have his own home yet. This is the first loan with Hluvuku and his second one in his life. The first loan was through the International Bank of Mozambique for 18,000MT. He came to know Hluvuku through some colleagues who were already clients. His biggest dream is to have his own home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer
